story:
Overwatch is the next generation in interactive and social gaming.  Now, all of the technology gamers love from combat video games is available in real life, right on a smartphone—Live GPS Radar, Bluetooth Voice Chat, and In-Game Perks.  The games of airsoft, paintball, and laser tag just became a whole lot more tactical.  Now it's not just game time.  It's game time for real.

SEE IT IN ACTION:


Overwatch is not just another smartphone game, it is a tactical utility to enhance airsoft, paintball, and laser tag gameplay.  Instead of being distracted from your game by trying to play through your smartphone like a Head-up Display, Overwatch provides vital game information at a glance—just like a radar does in combat video games.  Here's a glance at the features and design:



What devices will be able to run the Overwatch app?



There are two Overwatch mount styles to fit how you play.




The app uses a WiFi or 3G/4G/LTE connection to transmit and receive streaming GPS data.  This provides the near real-time location tracking for the in-game radar.  Instead of using a bluetooth connection for voice chat, a data transmission is used.  This allows multiple devices on a team to communicate without a 30-foot range limitation, and to ensure that devices with different operating systems can communicate.  While the device-to-device connection is not bluetooth, a user can connect a bluetooth headset instead of using the default speakerphone interface.




Due to our recent partnership with Cybergun, the largest airsoft company in the world, we are able to provide the products that will be sold right alongside Overwatch in retail stores at a discounted price for Indiegogo Overwatch backers only!  Get your gear now before the deals are all claimed!





Overwatch is backed by Cybergun, the world leader in airsoft guns and accessories.  In fact, Cybergun has partnered with Overwatch to ensure Overwatch products will be available in retail stores worldwide and online at every major airsoft store.


Overwatch is nearing completion, but we need YOUR help to complete it!  If our goal is met, Overwatch will be released with a basic feature set, but the more you contribute past our minimum goal, the more features and game modes we will be able to implement into the intial launch of the Overwatch app.  Check out our stretch goals below:




Overwatch team at ARK Challenge Demo Day

     Overwatch has had a meteoric rise in the past 7 months.  The Overwatch app was brought to life when the the team entered a startup business accelerator in Northwest Arkansas called The ARK Challenge.  Chosen from a pool of over 90 different companies from 15 different states and 15 different countries, Overwatch began work in June of 2013.  Just 14 weeks later, a polished prototype was finished.  With incredible progress made, the team continued to push, eventually securing $170,000 of investment to continue app development. Overwatch recently partnered with Cybergun, the largest airsoft company in the world. Through this strategic partnership, Overwatch will now have access to retail stores by early next year, but only if backers show support and help fund the project to completion.  With the app ready for beta-testing and the hardware in version two of prototyping, the final push to completion will be swift and shows great promise.



     "We believe Overwatch will finally bridge the gap between physical and digital gaming,  and we can't wait to get it into the hands of gamers.  We feel Indiegogo is the best place for us to plant the seeds of the Overwatch community.  With strong backers and the money from our Indiegogo campaign, we will be able to deliver a truly incredible product.  Thank you to all who have supported us along the way, and especially to those who will help see us through to completion.  We can't do this without you!"

-Josh Moody, CEO



ARK Challenge II Names 3 Winners: Info Assembly, Overwatch, Langhar

High School Senior Seeks Startup Success with Overwatch



Have any questions?  Email us at founders@overwatchapp.com

story:
RedRock: Unwritten Events


Hey, we are a small indie team that loves making games that they themselves would want to play. Right now we are working on a game called Red Rock: Unwritten Events and it's coming along pretty nicely

What is RedRock? Well lets put it this way, RedRock is a story driven zombie survival first person shooter but it's more than that actualy. We want to create a game with a world as vast and charming as Skyrim, a story as complex and fascinating as The Last of Us or The Walking Dead, and a gameplay even better than DayZ or Rust. This game will have everything you wanted from some of the best games combined while still keeping his layer of originality. We have a post world war setting, psychic powers, badass weapons, complex characters, over the top enemies and bosses. We are making sure this game will be awesome and apeall to a large range of people.

Keep in touch, and see you guys on RedRock Island 

In the year 2036 the American government found a boy in the woods of  the occupied Canadian province of Prince Edward Island with a very evolved brain. His brain capacity had evolved to the point where he could manipulate objects around him with the power of his mind. Since then a secret division of the American Empire is researching the possibilities of these powers of the mind at the remote Island RedRock. A few years have gone by, and now, without any recollection of the past, you are Subject No. 12

Short Summary

Singleplayer (multiplayer will be an option if stretch goal is reached, not the main focus)

Action / Adventure

"Supernatural" powers to some extend (i.e. telekinesis, control over the perception of time)

Open world game: the goal is to make the Island RedRock completely explorable in every direction, and we mean every diretion.

The storyline will be adaptive to the players choices

High octane battles between you and pretty much anything that moves

Discover the truth of RedRock Island and who you really are

Gameplay

RedRock: Unwritten Events will at first be created using a first-person view. With enough funding we will add the option of playing in third person. The main focus will be on survival on an island full of potential enemies. Ranging from the American soldiers to those who were once human but got infected by Subject no. 4. 

To survive you will have to develop your own strategy based on your experience, control of powers and resources you find. Bend the world around you and kill faster and precise, or choose to avoid combat and sneak your way around. Not only will you be able to use any weapon in the game, you will be able to repair broken ones or create your own. 

Basic human needs will also be implemented in the game to make the experience as real as possible. You will have to find ways to feed yourself to survive in the harsh environment that is RedRock Island. You might find those juicy apples in the trees suit your needs, or maybe meat and the pleasure of the hunt is more to your taste.

All in all, if you are looking for a game with an extensive storyline and intense action, this game will be just the game for you. To help us make this game a reality we humbly ask for your contribution in the form of funding.

Goals:

We plan to launch the game some time in march for testing. We have a protoype version of the game using placeholder art and unity assets so we can test some of the scripts and make sure that the game is actually working to the point we want it in, upon release of the full game we hope to remove ANY thing that is not our original work.

the game will focus more on a gripping story than multiplayer, we are a game that has zombies not a zombie game, the main enemys wont be the undead but the evil government that has used you as a guneepig for their twisted experiments 

If we hit our goal of 3k we will be able to pay for our dropbox fees and the licence for the programs we need but don't have.


Streach Goals

$ 3.000 - Release of the Game

We want to release our game, but we need to get a few licenses and assets to make the game complete and completely legal. For now we have a prototype of the game using placeholder art and unity assets, but we want to remove anything that is not our original work. To do this we need time, but as all of us are volunteering at the moment it is very hard to make time next to our normal job. We will eventually make this game happen, but with your help we will get there much faster!

$3.500 - Vehicles

Including drivable vehicles is a lot of scripting and animating. We really want to include this in the game but we'll need more funding. The vehicles will include cars, choppers and maybe even boats or planes.

$4.000 - Multiplayer

We think this concept has some great possibilities for a multiplayer mode, but to set this up we will need to remake quite some parts of the game, and we also need to set up a server.

$6.000 - Oculus Rift

For the ultimate experience it would be amazing to play the game while seeing IN the world, rather then on the screen. Adding another layer to the survival feeling of the game. 

Make sure to take a look at our Facebook page and to get the latest updates and news concerning RedRock. Any help will be much apreciated, drop by a message on skype at aditufrumosu or murrdy17 if you are interested in joining the development team.

story:
Campaign Summary

This campaign is for raising money to fund travel and other expenses for Mr.
Pydiramu [wheelchair (paralympion) athlete] for participation in 8th Tunisia international athletics meet, to qualify in the Asian games 2014. His events of participation are Club throw and Discuss throw.

He always believes that ‘Dreams are vision to the future’!.

He suffers from a post-Polio residual paralysis of both lower limbs and hence he
is a wheelchair user.

His positive spirit has kept him going against all odds in life. He has chosen sports to inspire and be a role model to like minded people in the world..!

Since 8 years, he has been a table tennis player in Paralympic tournaments and has achieved international the below feat of medals.

Unfortunately, he has an injury while playing semi-final match against Kuwait player in Jordan Para Championship. He has suffered a left shoulder dislocation and doctors suggested him a rest for 1 year. If this injury occurs second time, then he would need to go for a surgery.

His dream vision is to be in next Olympics tournament.

So with the spirit of fighting against all odds, he has started playing in club throw and discuss throw competitions with the guidance from Mr. Ramesh Tikaram, an Arjuna Awardee in paralympics.

Below are his recent achievements under club throw and discuss throw competitions:

So he whole heatedly requests each and every one of you to help him in all his financial needs for his participation in the upcoming athletics competition [i.e, IPC Grand Prix - Tunisia]. This financial aid will help not only him alone but also will help him to accommodate an assistant [escort] during his participation.

story:
World Basketball Manager 2 (WBM2) will be the sequel to the successful series of basketball management games.

If you are not familiar with WBM, you should know that is a basketball strategy game that covers all serious basketball action around the world with 100+ national and international tournaments, 1.200+ teams, 20.500+ basketball players and 1.300+ managers.

The accurate representation of the basketball world forces the players to make the same decisions and face the same problems as their real life counterparts. It deals not only with the sport aspect of the game, but also with financial, managerial, administrative, training, psychological and PR situations that arise in the everyday life of a basketball manager.

The biggest success of WBM is the real time match engine that produces realistic results and accurate match statistics, using a genetic algorithm for the A. I.

Another huge plus of the game is the big network of researchers that help in data and tournament updates. The game is available in 12 languages: English, French, German, Greek, Italian, Lithuanian, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Serbian, Spanish and Turkish.

To learn more about the current version of the game please visit www.wbmgame.com

We have also released a Tycoon version of the game which you can download and play from the official website www.wbmtycoon.com


World Basketball Manager 2 will be a completely new game, but will continue to develop as an old school manager game.

We have already spent thousand of hours and resources on this project. Right now we have finished 75% of the project and we need the necessary funds to give us the final push to complete the game.

All the funds will go to for the development of the new improved and friendly user interface and the new 2D match engine. We have already created new code and database that make the game run faster (New game initialization in WBM2 takes only 5 seconds!).

A first version of the game will be ready in Summer 2014 and will run on Windows and MacOS .

Here are some screens of what is already developed for WBM2:

New interface is 100% more user friendly. These are the main improvements:  
 1. The Navigation tree. From here you can have access to all database and game screens in a tree view. When you don’t need it, you can just hide the Navigation tree to gain more space for the info on the screen.

  2. Tabs. So now when you see for example a Team’s roster Physical Attributes, you have easy access to all other categories.

  3. Navigation icons for all different pages of the element you are viewing. If you see a Club for example, you get Roster, Departments, Training, Schedule etc in icons beside the open page. This works additionally to the Tabs and the Tree and the old functionality for faster browsing.

  4. It is resizable, so it adjusts automatically to your screen resolution.

The Visual Match Engine
The game already features an incredibly well-balanced, real-time match algorithm, with realistic results and challenging A.I. 

All the player and manager attributes are calculated during the match. And there are also special considerations including match’s crucial moments, clutch players, match importance, player temperaments, traditional enemy teams and much more. 
The managers control lineups, offensive and defensive tactics, play speed etc.

The match action features live commentary and ambient sound that responds to crowd attendance, crowd temperament, match importance, as well as the events in the course of the game which creates a perfectly realistic match atmosphere and loads of live data are displayed in full detail.

Our plan is to create a visual 2D match engine that will also present to the user the player movements on the court, in order to be able to see, not only statistically but also visually, what is working and what is not with his team’s offense and defense plans.

Other major improvements in the game engine:

  • Ability to transfer manager data from WBM to WBM2, so that you can continue your current career in the new game.
  • A More active transfer market.
  • Teams will keep more native players in their rosters.
  • NBA style players trades.
  • The game will keep stats and news histories for Managers, Players, Teams, Tournaments and Countries for ever. That means that you can see a boxscore 20 seasons back!
  • A More realistic players' worth rating system.
  • More detailed financials for clubs.

The 2D Animation Editor

This is the main tool we use in order to create the key frames of the game animations and the managers' attack systems playbook. Later the users will be able to use this in order to create their own attack systems.


The Online Data Editor (already running in beta mode)This is the main tool we have created for the research team to update the game database. We have already used it for the database of WBM 2014 and the feedback we received from the researchers was great.

Here you can read more on how the online data editor works: 
http://www.wbmgame.com/files/WBMOnlineEditor.pdf


From the first day WBM has been a community project. 

When we finished the first game design, the game was asking for a database that included more than 100 national and international club and national team tournaments, 1.100 teams, 20.000 players and 1.200 managers. Also 30 characteristics per country, 25 characteristics per team, 51 characteristics per basketball player and 10 characteristics per manager. Immediately came clear to us that we would never be able to create this huge database without a lot of help.

The first thing we did was to start building an online community of game fans and the first piece of code we wrote, was for a data editor that the community would use in order to collect the data. Also we created a localization kit for the community.
In a magical way, WBM became immediately a community project and today WBM includes the biggest basketball database the world has ever seen in a game and is available in 12 languages. We just can’t thank enough our community for all the help they have offered to the game!

Now with our crowd funding project we have the opportunity to get the community involved even more.


“World Basketball Manager” story goes many-many years in the past. Back then we were a bunch of gamers that loved to play Old School soccer manager games. But since basketball is a very popular sport and the national team and clubs have won many international titles, we always wanted to find and play a basketball management game.

As hard core sport manager game fans, we already knew that basketball would be the perfect theme for such a game.  All sport manager games are after all statistical simulators of the sport they represent and basketball is a sport that statistics give a clear view of the game and why a team wins or loose. In basketball, statistics and evaluations of a game really matters compared to other sports. If you take soccer for example, a team could have 80%-20% possession of the ball, 30 -1 shots on target, 20-5 fouls, 15-1 corners etc. and still lose the game cause the opponent team managed to score a goal in the only corner they took.

This could never happen in a basketball game. The team with the most rebounds and better ratings in field goals, fouls etc. is for sure the winner.

So we decided that it would be great to create a videogame that uses the same statistics that the real life professionals of basketball use in order to analyze a game and the performance of the players.

Thanks for reading through our project and for supporting independent developers.

Have a question? If the info above doesn't help, you can ask the project creator directly. Ask a Question
story_txt:
World Basketball Manager 2 (WBM2) will be the sequel to the successful
series of basketball management games.If you are not familiar with WBM, you should know that is a basketball strategy
game that covers all serious basketball action around the world with 100+ national and
international tournaments, 1.200+ teams, 20.500+ basketball players and 1.300+
managers.
The accurate representation of the basketball world forces the players to make
the same decisions and face the same problems as their real life counterparts.
It deals not only with the sport aspect of the game, but also with financial,
managerial, administrative, training, psychological and PR situations that
arise in the everyday life of a basketball manager. 
The biggest success of WBM is the real
time match engine that produces realistic results and accurate match
statistics, using a genetic algorithm for the A. I. 
Another huge plus of the game is the big network of
researchers that help in data and tournament updates. The game is available in 12 languages: English, French, German, Greek, Italian, Lithuanian, Polish,
Portuguese, Russian, Serbian, Spanish and Turkish.To learn more about the current version of the game please visit www.wbmgame.comWe have also released a Tycoon version of the game which you can download and play from the official website www.wbmtycoon.com
World Basketball Manager 2 will be a completely new game, but will continue
to develop as an old school manager game.We have already spent thousand of hours and resources on this project. Right now we have finished 75% of the project and we need the necessary funds to give us the final push to complete the game.All the funds
will go to for the development of the new improved and friendly user interface and
the new 2D match engine. We have already created new code and database that make the game run faster (New game initialization in WBM2 takes only 5 seconds!).A first version of the game will be ready in Summer 2014 and will run on Windows and MacOS .Here are some screens of what is already developed for WBM2:New interface is 100% more user friendly. These are the main improvements:   1. The Navigation tree. From here you can have 
access to all database and game screens in a tree view. When you 
don’t need it, you can just hide the Navigation tree to gain more space for the 
info on the screen.  2. Tabs. So now when you see for example a Team’s 
roster Physical Attributes, you have easy access to all other categories.  3. Navigation icons for all different pages of the 
element you are viewing. If you see a Club for example, you get Roster, 
Departments, Training, Schedule etc in icons beside the open page. This works additionally to the Tabs and the Tree and 
the old functionality for faster browsing.
  4. It is resizable, so it adjusts automatically to your screen 
resolution.The Visual Match EngineThe game already features an incredibly well-balanced, real-time match algorithm, with realistic results and challenging A.I. All the player and manager attributes are calculated during the match. And there are also special considerations including match’s crucial moments, clutch players, match importance, player temperaments, traditional enemy teams and much more. The managers control lineups, offensive and defensive tactics, play speed etc.The match action features live commentary and ambient sound that responds to crowd attendance, crowd temperament, match importance, as well as the events in the course of the game which creates a perfectly realistic match atmosphere and loads of live data are displayed in full detail.Our plan is to create a visual 2D match engine that will also present to the user the player movements on the court, in order to be able to see, not only statistically but also visually, what is working and what is not with his team’s offense and defense plans.Other major improvements in the game engine:

Ability to transfer manager data from WBM to WBM2, so that you can continue your current career in the new game.


A More active transfer market.


Teams will keep more native players in their rosters.


NBA style players trades.


The game will keep stats and news histories for Managers, Players, Teams, Tournaments and Countries for ever. That means that you can see a boxscore 20 seasons back!


A More realistic players' worth rating system.


More detailed financials for clubs.

The 2D Animation EditorThis is the main tool we use in order to create the key frames of the game animations and the managers' attack systems playbook. Later the users will be able to use this in order to create their own attack systems.The Online Data Editor (already running in beta mode)This is the main tool we have created for the research team to update the game database. We have already used it for the database of WBM 2014 and the feedback we received from the researchers was great.Here you can read more on how the online data editor works: http://www.wbmgame.com/files/WBMOnlineEditor.pdf
From the first day WBM has been a community project. When we finished the first game design, the game was asking for a database that included more than
100 national and international club and national team tournaments, 1.100 teams,
20.000 players and 1.200 managers. Also 30 characteristics per country, 25
characteristics per team, 51 characteristics per basketball player and 10
characteristics per manager. Immediately came clear to us that we would never
be able to create this huge database without a lot of help.
The first thing we did was to start building an online community of game
fans and the first piece of code we wrote, was for a data editor that the
community would use in order to collect the data. Also we created a
localization kit for the community. In a magical way, WBM became immediately a
community project and today WBM includes the biggest basketball database the
world has ever seen in a game and is available in 12 languages. We just can’t
thank enough our community for all the help they have offered to the game!Now with our crowd funding project we have the opportunity to get the community involved even more.

“World Basketball Manager” story goes many-many years in the past.
Back then we were a bunch of gamers that loved to play Old School soccer manager games. But since basketball is a very popular sport and the national
team and clubs have won many international titles, we always wanted to find and
play a basketball management game.
As hard core sport manager game fans, we already knew that basketball
would be the perfect theme for such a game.  All sport manager
games are after all statistical simulators of the sport they represent and
basketball is a sport that statistics give a clear view of the game and why a
team wins or loose. In basketball, statistics and evaluations of a game really
matters compared to other sports. If you take soccer for example, a team could
have 80%-20% possession of the ball, 30 -1 shots on target, 20-5 fouls, 15-1
corners etc. and still lose the game cause the opponent team managed to score a
goal in the only corner they took. 
This could never happen in a basketball game. The team
with the most rebounds and better ratings in field goals, fouls etc. is for
sure the winner. 
So we decided that it would be great to create a
videogame that uses the same statistics that the real life professionals of basketball
use in order to analyze a game and the performance of the players.Thanks for
reading through our project and for supporting independent developers.
Have a question? If the info above
doesn't help, you can ask the project creator directly. Ask a Question

story:
What is On The Slopes?

On The Slopes is a skiing-themed family-style board game where you and up to three friends race around a mountain to be the first to visit every lodge.

 

On The Slopes is a FINALIST in the 2016 Hasbro Game Design Challenge!

On The Slopes has been selected as one of five finalists in the 2016 Hasbro Game Design Challenge!

We are running a crowdfunding campaign and need at least 100 backers in order to win the competition.

 

How to Play On The Slopes

A game of On The Slopes takes about 45 minutes, and you can learn to play in under three minutes!  Each player is a skier (or snowboarder) racing around a mountain, trying to be the first one to visit all the lodges to collect all your stones.

 

On your turn, you have three actions, which you can use to go up a lift, ski down a run, or pick up a stone.  But runs and lifts only work in one direction, so you need to keep that in mind as you plan your route for the day.

 

Whenever you pick up a stone, you also get a Snow Card, which can give you benefits like extra action tokens or a one-time-only ability.  Some Snow Cards let you help or hinder other players.

 

When going down runs, you can choose between easy green runs, intermediate blue runs, or advanced or expert black diamond runs.  The more difficult runs are faster, but be careful: You might fall and have to take a Wipeout Card, which can cause bad things to happen.

 

If you are the first one to get to a lodge, you can pick up an action token, which gives you an extra action… or you can save your action tokens and use them to re-roll bad die rolls.

 

Advanced players can play with special characters that give each player a unique ability they can use throughout the game.

 

What’s in the Box

On The Slopes includes the following components:

  • 1 high-quality game board with map of mountain
  • 4 pawns
  • 48 stones
  • 15 bus tickets
  • 30 action tokens
  • Snow Card deck
  • Wipeout Card deck
  • 2 reference mats
  • 7 special character mats
  • 1 rulebook
  • 1 die
  • And lots of fun!

(Prototype shown; exact appearance of final components subject to change)

 

Perks

Here are some of the perks you can get by supporting On The Slopes:

Beginner Package. This basic package includes a personalized thank-you email from the designers of On The Slopes.

Intermediate Package. This package includes a copy of On The Slopes, plus a personalized thank-you email from the designers of On The Slopes.

Black Diamond Package: This package includes all of the above, plus 4 premium skier meeples (one of each color).

Double Black Diamond Package: This package is for the best skiers around. It includes all of the above, plus 10 exclusive bonus cards and one exclusive bonus character.

Backcountry Package (quantities limited): This is where the fun really begins.  This package includes all of the above, plus a cool skier figurine, plus you will get your name in the rulebook as a contributor!  And we will personally autograph your copy of the game!

Ski Patrol Package (quantities limited): You are good enough to be on ski patrol!  This package includes TWO copies of On The Slopes, with all of the bonuses listed above.  Best of all, with this perk, you can design one Snow or Wipeout Card that will be included in the final game with your name on it (pending our approval)!

IF YOU ARE IN THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA, you can save shipping costs by clicking on one of the following links, and we'll arrange for you to pick up the game locally:

  • Double Black Diamond package with no shipping charges (local pickup in SF Bay Area)
  • Black Diamond package with no shipping charges (local pickup in SF Bay Area)
  • Intermediate package with no shipping charges (local pickup in SF Bay Area)

 

About Us

We are a father-son board game design team from Redwood City, California.  What are our day jobs? Well, Aaron is a senior in high school; Amir (Aaron's Dad) is a patent attorney.

 

The “On The Slopes” Story

We both love playing board games.  We also love skiing.  One day, while on the way home from a family ski trip in Lake Tahoe, Aaron thought, "Why not make a skiing-themed board game?" So we got to work on a prototype:

 

That was several years ago. Since then, On The Slopes has gone through many playtest sessions and revisions, and has transformed from a hand-drawn game on poster board to a finalist in the Hasbro competition!

 

Playtesting at Gen Con 2014:

 

Playtesting at Celestispiel 2015:

 

Playtesting at Protospiel 2016:

 

How to Support On The Slopes

You can support On The Slopes by contributing to our campaign. Now that we are a finalist in the Hasbro Game Design Challenge, we need at least 100 backers in order to win the competition. If we win, we get an opportunity to visit Hasbro's headquarters and talk to them about further development of the game!

Also, we need your help to spread the word and tell all of your friends to support us! You can use the Indiegogo tools or tell them to go to OnTheSlopes.net, which will bring them to this page.

 

FAQ

Question: Do I need to know how to ski or snowboard to play On The Slopes?

Answer: No; we have played this game many times with people who haven’t even seen snow.

Question: Can you play On The Slopes while skiing or snowboarding?

Answer: Possibly. We have brought the game on ski trips before, but have never actually played the game while skiing.

Question: Is On The Slopes an accurate representation of skiing or snowboarding?

Answer: While skiing or snowboarding, each path is actually one direction, since you can only go up lifts and down runs. And you can choose to go on easy slopes or take harder ones.  Also, when you are out on the slopes for real, it’s fun to try to cover the entire mountain or as much as you can in the shortest amount of time possible; hence visiting every lodge.  We use stones in the game as a way to keep track of how many lodges you have visited.

Question: I’m not really into boardgaming.  Will I like this?

Answer: We’ve playtested On The Slopes with many non-gamers, and they really get into it.  It’s super-easy to teach, and everyone immediately understands what they are trying to do.  There’s definitely strategy to the game, but the Snow Cards and Wipeout Cards offer just enough unpredictability and luck that even a beginner has a good chance of winning the game.   We do recommend that beginners start with the basic game, and introduce the special characters after playing it a few times.

Question: Who did the artwork?

Answer: Artwork and visual design for On The Slopes were done by Jayme Kalpin (jayme_kalpin@hotmail.com) and Sean Lautenschlager (seanlautenschlager@gmail.com).

Question: How much is shipping?

Answer: We will ship your copy of On The Slopes anywhere in the world.  Shipping costs are as follows:

  • US addresses: $11
  • Canadian addresses: $22
  • Rest of the world: $50
  • Note: IF YOU ARE IN THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA, you can save shipping costs by clicking on one of the following links, and we'll arrange for you to pick up the game locally:
    • Double Black Diamond package with no shipping charges (local pickup in SF Bay Area)
    • Black Diamond package with no shipping charges (local pickup in SF Bay Area)
    • Intermediate package with no shipping charges (local pickup in SF Bay Area)

If you have any other questions, feel free to email us at OnTheSlopes@raubvogel.com

story:
Funding Campaign Top Priorities

Salute WWIIOL community members! We have some big objectives we're requesting your assistance to make some great progress for the game. Here is the short list of priorities that this funding campaign is designed to support:

  1. Create a whole new server base for WWII Online.
  2. Renew essential software for game development.
  3. Obtain a newer version of SpeedTree to improve graphics of environmental objects.
  4. Support the development of the current Roadmap.
  5. Enhance marketing reach to obtain new players.

We have 40 days to obtain the goal of $40,000 (USD) which will amplify all of these efforts.

A whole new server base for WWII Online: Cornered Rat Software is taking WWII Online's servers to the latest standards in an all-new location! Here's some short notes of how your support will be put into action:

  • New powerful servers with more horsepower, energy efficiency and remote management.
  • New Gigabit router, switches and cables for maximum throughput.
  • New Gigabit internet service provider, with emphasis on improved latency for North American and European customers.
  • New remote power management power strips, with increased monitoring utilities.

This new server base will be setup in Portland Oregon, where Cornered Rat Software HQ is, and the old servers in Dallas will be decommissioned. Fortunately we will be able to spare a couple of these servers from past funding events as these are newer and meet the criteria we're looking for.

Many of our technical personnel now reside on the West Coast which will reduce logistics and increase proactive measures taken to ensure optimal health of the servers. Oregon also has zero sales tax and a new deal has been worked out to reduce monthly expenses to operate WWIIOL.

Game Software Renewal(s): Developing WWII Online requires us to upkeep some critical software that gives our production team (producers and artists) the tools our game depends on:

  • Creator: Used for everything to develop art assets (vehicles, terrain / environmentals, etc).
  • Granny: Used for everything related to infantry (models, animations, etc).

We're always evaluating ways to enhance WWII Online's graphics, and obtaining the SpeedTree SDK version 8 is one big way to do that. SpeedTree currently manages all of the:

  • Trees, bushes and foliage. 
  • By upgrading, we can introduce efficient, newer assets that are realistic (meaning they move and cast proper, low intensity shadows).
  • SpeedTree runs on the GPU, where WWIIOL runs on the CPU, so this will reduce any conflict on performance / efficiency of the game - providing you have a decent Graphics Processor.

Support the current Dev Roadmap: There are so many exciting things we have on the current Roadmap and your support will help push them forward. Here's a quick list of what they are:

  • 64-bit applications (75% completed, in progress).
  • Integrated voice comms.
  • Vehicles to receive the load out option (base functionality obtained).
  • Server tracked bombs.
  • Upgrading speed tree technology.
  • New / improved user interface (in progress).
  • Upgrading TrackIR technology (in progress).
  • Connection / networking improvements via code (in progress).
  • Infantry controls (mouse sensitivity).
  • HUD markers for mission leaders.
  • Junkers 88 A-4 (Axis medium fast bomber). (in progress)
  • Wellington (Allied medium-heavy bomber).
  • Early War Truck (SPAAs). (in progress)
  • City Blocks (major urban areas). (in progress)

View the current roadmap and related pictures.

Help us enhance marketing / player acquisition: We want to put an end to "I wish I would have heard of this game before!" and accelerate our marketing efforts. There are many fans-to-be that we need to get in touch with, and with your help we can do it. Here's what we'll be doing to boost marketing through your help!

  • We will be a vendor at the Oregon International Air Show and provide play-able stations to an audience of over 40,000 air show / gamer enthusiasts. - in progress
  • We will contract a team to provide us professional search engine optimization and website improvements so we can organically obtain more players over time and be competitive.
  • We will employ a physical marketing campaign to reconnect with previous members currently unsubscribed who are most likely to return.
  • We will create a new line of purchase-able shirts and SWAG items.
  • We will renew our Joomla website license which provides new capabilities.
  • We will obtain a new e-mail newsletter system with new tools so we can keep you in touch with all WWIIOL related activities.

Ready to support WWIIOL? 

Here's what you can do!

  1. Select your perk and contribute and watch the progress bar go up!
  2. Share this funding campaign on all relevant WWIIOL pages, groups, and friends.
  3. Actively communicate this to fellow WWIIOL community members and help them understand how significant these development items are.

And that's all there is to it.

You are eligible to make additional contributions at any time beyond your initial contribution.

We'd like to thank all of your for your support and are excited that we can finally share this campaign and its goals with you, it's a very big deal!

For any help or questions related to this funding drive, please contact CRS at http://support.wwiionline.com

Share this funding campaign on all relevant WWIIOL pages, groups, and friends.
Actively communicate this to fellow WWIIOL community members and help them understand how significant these development items are.

And that's all there is to it.You are eligible to make additional contributions at any time beyond your initial contribution.We'd like to thank all of your for your support and are excited that we can finally share this campaign and its goals with you, it's a very big deal!For any help or questions related to this funding drive, please contact CRS at http://support.wwiionline.com

story:
WE DID IT!

Sword of the Stars: The Pit is an Indiegogo Success Story.

A small team of dedicated developers. A small group of generous supporters. Our campaign did not raise the complete budget of 60K required to complete a game from start to finish, but between the Flexible Funded Indiegogo campaign and the contributions to the game's dedicated website, we raised enough money to continue our work.

A successful Exclusive Beta test for our supporters ran from December of 2012 to mid-February of 2013, when the game was finally ready for release.

The team had to make some sacrifices, but we have delivered a fun, addictive game which had 30% more content than we had projected, and we've already shipped a variety of quality Perks that our supporters have really enjoyed.

 

Sword of the Stars: The Pit was released on Gamer's Gate on February 21, 2013.

The game was released initially on Gamer's Gate. It remained steadily in the Top 10 selling games on the site for the first ten days, and remains in the Top 20.

The Pit was released on Steam on March 8, 2013.

It has been in the Top 50 since release, rising to a peak of Number 5 on the Top Seller's list in its opening weekend.

The Players Are Having Fun!

To see what the buyers of The Pit think of their purchase, please scroll down to the bottom of the game's Product Page on Gamer's Gate to see their scores and reviews.

There is also a lively discussion on the Community Hub Page for the game on Steam.

Both Steam and Gamer's Gate have a free demo available.

 

 

"I like a good Roguelike and so far I’m liking The Pit an awful lot."

--Dragonchasers

 

"All in all, the game is great fun if you’re into roguelike games. The layouts are always random. The classes can be leveled up in various ways. No two play-throughs are alike and you’ll find yourself dying many different ways as you progress. The Pit delivers a solid experience and should be a must buy for fans of the genre. And remember, in space, no one can hear you scream as you die for the forty-second time."

--Twonkhammer

 

"The Pit compares favorably with another modern (and better known) Roguelike, FTL: Faster Than Light. As in FTL, you will die. A lot. Even after playing 40+ hours on the easiest difficulty, I never came close to seeing the bottom of the Pit at level 30. However, I also never felt frustrated. And I am very easily frustrated. Both The Pit and FTL nail their goal of making exploration entertaining. My first thought after dying isn’t my normal “some-variation-of-damn-it!” but instead “one more try!”

And that’s really the highest praise I can give a game."

--Express Bus to Hell

 

"Taking us back to the old school era of Rogue with a fresh lick of paint on a 2D canvas, this fast action turn-based RPG initially looks trivial in the first minutes of play but quickly reveals itself as a veritable alternative for gamers looking for quick-burst of RPG play sessions."

--Awesome Games

 

"The Pit is a joy to play but at the same time something so brutally difficult it just bends you over and paddles your arse like you’re a freshman in Dazed and Confused."

--Pixelbedlam

 

"Are you a sucker for punishment? If the answer is yes, Sword of the Stars: The Pit is the game you have been longing for!"

...the witty commentary from the voice actors in-game is fantastic. They add a note of sarcasm and lighthearted fun into the otherwise frustrating mix. They always have something to say, even if it’s Travis exclaiming, “Let’s try shootin’ it” when an attempt at Lock-picking fails, or “Travis one; monsters zero” after eradicating a mob of enemies. You’ll find yourself associating with the characters more often, or having a semi love-hate relationship when they comment on how bad you are at the game, or how awesome they are when an attempt at a Security Bypass or Repair succeeds."

--Gamer Living

 

"There’s a ton of fun to be had here and it definitely has the addictive “one more go” quality that you want to be there for this kind of thing. But over the course of my games- an awful lot of which were played that first night that I got it- I began to feel that I was in something resembling an abusive relationship. But it keeps telling me that it loves me, and sometimes I love it too."

--No High Scores

 

"Ooo, hello. Yeah, this is getting really really bad. Let's re-load the pistol and then use a med-kit--ow ow ow ow ow, ow ow ow, ow ow!"

--Total Biscuit, WTF is Sword of the Stars: The Pit?

 

"The Pit makes no accommodations for newbies. This is a hardcore roguelike and as such it is sure to please fans. There is such a wealth to do and upgrade that it never feels like you’re [pl]aying the same game twice. Levels only grow larger and tougher the further you descend. This is a game that requires tons of time and dedication to make it to the bottom. Players who enjoy this sort of thing will find themselves spending hours trying to build characters just right so their next mission will succeed. Sword of the Stars: The Pit is just the game for those roguelike fans who enjoy statistics and unfriendly aliens."

--Game Podunk

 

"The Pit is a roguelike both relatively accessible and hard as nails. There’s something there for newbies getting into roguelikes, veterans who want an interesting setting plus a solid game, and fans of the Sword of the Stars universe."

--Techzwn

 

Don't Panic!

You can still support The Pit for a few more days, until February 28, 2013, if you pick up one of our two upcoming Lore books for the Sword of the Stars universe. You can continue to follow the game's development and get notice of Updates and upcoming Expansions by visiting the game's dedicated website.

We will try to keep you posted on how The Pit is doing, now that the game has been released.

Thank you once again to all of the wonderful folks who stepped up to support this game and our team.

Per Ardua Ad Astra!

"BUY THIS GAME. Hey guys; I don't think I've ever done a celebrity-endorsement of an Indiegogo project until now, but I'm going to do it today."

--RPGpundit

"Sword of the Stars: The Pit - A perfect mix of old school retro art combined with new school game mechanics in this action/RPG. Swords of Stars takes me back to the games of yore that I loved so much and I cannot wait to play this game." 

--John Vaskis, Indiegogo Games Guru!

"I had a blast with my time in The Pit, and highly encourage everyone to give it a shot."

--James Barry, Colony of Gamers

"I immediately lost myself to inward-looking concerns about getting my lockpicking skill up, finding enough food to stay alive (in addition to replenishing health) and frantically switching to melee attacks to conserve ammo."

--Alec Meer, Rock Paper Shotgun

"We're very excited to be a part of The Pit, both during this campaign period and throughout development. We’re life-long gamers at Power Up. We strive for the modern ‘standard of awesome’ in all our work, but we’ve got a soft spot for the retro vibe. We jumped at the chance to be involved with a game like The Pit.”

--Kevin Regamey, Power Up Audio

 

Sword of the Stars: The Pit is a fun, fast, light-hearted action RPG, in the tradition of Rogue and other old school dungeon-diving games.

We've been working on it for a few months, and the game is presently at the Alpha phase. The goal of this campaign is to push the game forward to its Beta state.

With your support, we'd like to make this game our first self-published title.


What Is The Pit?

The Pit is short for The Pit of the Bloodweaver. In this game, you play a brave Human soldier exploring a multi-level underground lab facility. The place was built and abandoned years ago by the Bloodweaver, an alien super-genius with delusions of godhood. He was the ultimate mad scientist, and The Pit was his favorite box of tinker toys.

As you break through locked doors, open storage containers, dodge traps and evade security systems, you'll also have to contend with a variety of crazy foes. The Pit is full of the mutants, monsters and minions that the enemy left behind.

They're hungry, and you look like lunch.

 

TIME TO SADDLE UP, SPACE MONKEYS!

You can download a Six Level Playable Demo from GAMER'S GATE.

This demo of The Pit provides you with an introductory tutorial and a chance to fight your way down into the first 6 levels of the game! But there’s still a lot more of the game that will only be found in the full version;

  • 2 More Characters to choose from… the Marine and the Scout, each with their own unique advantages!
  • Level your character up as you dive down into 24 more levels, each one bigger than the last!
  • Dozens more enemies drawn from the SotSverse!
  • Dozens and dozens of additional weapons and armors with a variety of special effects, including flamethrowers, rocket launchers, plasma cannons and powered Brawler armor!
  • 50 more items to discover, ranging from the familiar to the ancient exotic tech.
  • Dozens of room types containing a host of exotic devices to help and hinder the player
  • And while the demo will try and kill you in many fiendish ways, the final game will always have more poisons, traps, diseases and monsters.

 


 

Why Make This Game?

The Pit came out of our love of dungeon-diving and retro-style games. Roguelikes are the low hanging fruit of the “small game” market at the moment, but any genre can be made new and fun if you give it the right spin.

The Pit takes the usual Kerberos approach to the classics: we pay tribute to the great games of the past, without actually cloning them.  Instead, we wanted to reimagine the Good Old Days through the lens of modern gameplay.

With The Pit, we deliver retro graphics, but give you the levelling, ammo, crafting and skills of a true dungeon dive. And of course, we set the action in our favourite playground, the SotSVerse!

And so The Pit was born.

Why You Will Love This Game

The Pit is a game is for everyone who wants to smile, snarl, chuckle and swear their way through play sessions ranging from 10 minutes to 3 hours.

The game sticks with the traditional Rogue model. It's all about how long you can live and how deep into The Pit you can go, but it is combined with gameplay and a backdrop you can seriously sink your teeth into. 

From the action RPG perspective, your character will gain in levels and skill as you defeat more opponents and complete more tasks.

Despite being quick and fun, you'll have to sweat to keep your Character alive and you'll be identifying with the Li'l Dude just enough that it stings when he gets eaten by a Rabid Moon Bear.

Game Features

 The Pit was released on February 21, 2013. The finished game is now available for download.

Here's the Feature List we promised on release in October 2012:

  • 3 Characters to choose from…Marine, Scout and Engineer!
  • Go up levels and improve your skills as you try and find a way to survive the depths.
  • 30 Levels of ancient evil science between you and the cure!
  • Dozens of enemies drawn from the SotSverse!
  • Over 30 weapons and armors with a variety of special effects including flamethrowers, rocket launchers, plasma cannons and powered Brawler armor!
  • Randomized augmentation effects to make each game unique.
  • Crafting lets you make special items from bits and pieces of your enemies.
  • Over 60 items to discover, ranging from the familiar to the ancient exotic tech.
  • Dozens of room types containing a host of exotic devices to help and hinder the player.
  • Many fiendish ways to die including poisoning, disease, traps, radiation, starvation and of course…MONSTERS.

 

We did our best to cook up a lot of cool swag for The Pit. Most of these items are Special Edition, One-Time-Only goodies for this particular campaign. Even if we launch another campaign in the future for some other game, most of the Perks will be very different.

 

Supporters at the $10 level were able to download the full game on release day, and are listed in the credits of the game. All supporters of the game will receive updates and have access to Wallpapers, Avatars and other digital goodies for Sword of the Stars: The Pit.

 

The Repensum Bumper Sticker

Supporters at the $15 received the finished game on release day and a Repensum Bumper Sticker as a thank-you for their support.

The Repensum Bumper Sticker is printed on durable vinyl, suitable for display on your car, truck or dreadnaught. It features the unofficial motto of Sol Force: REPENSUM EST CANICULA, "Payback is a Bitch."

Final size is 279mm x 76mm, or approximately 11 inches x 3 inches. You can add the Repensum Bumper Sticker to any other Perk for an additional $5.

 

The Official Sol Force Service Mug

Our Service Mug is a 16 oz double walled stainless steel mug with a plastic liner, foam insulated, and has a push-on lid to prevent your beverage from spilling when you lose artificial gravity or take a pounding from kinetic weapons. It is printed with the Sol Force logo and the official motto: PER ARDUA AD ASTRA, "Through Hardship, the Stars".

The Perk Price covers the cost of delivery anywhere in the USA or Canada. For International Postage outside the USA or Canada, please add $10.

 

 

 

Cool Campaign T-Shirts

Supporters at $50 or more could choose from one of two t-shirts. The Kerberos Logo t-shirt is an old stand-by, and at least one or two are owned by every developer in the studio. The Pit t-shirt is a Special Edition item for supporters of this campaign only.

Both t-shirts are screen-printed on black 100% cotton shirts, available in sizes S-4XL. You could order more than one t-shirt, and the Perk price covered delivery in the USA and Canada. For International Shipping outside the USA and Canada, it was an additional $10.

 

Sword of the Stars 2 Ship Schematics

Supporters at the $60 level receive Early Beta Access, plus choose one of six beautiful 18 x 24 inch ship schematic posters.

Designs available at this level include Human, Hiver, Tarka, Liir, Zuul and Morrigi ships from Sword of the Stars 2: Lords of Winter. Please add $30 for each additional poster at this level, and please add $10 for International Shipping outside of the USA and Canada.

 

Kerberos Concept Calendar 2013

Supporters at the $75 level receive Early Beta access to the game, plus a full-color Kerberos Concept Art Calendar for 2013 as a thank-you for their support.

The Kerberos Calendar features 13 months of concept art, including sneak previews of unannounced projects. Exclusive swag for supporters of this campaign. Kerberos Insiders Only!

BONUS BOOK: Thanks to Supporter Feedback (and lack of space in the main Lore Book!), we decided to add a bonus book to this Perk!

Black Section: The Complete Files is an over-sized softcover art-and-lore book, focused exclusively on the Random Encounters, Grand Menaces and Mysteries of the Sword of the Stars universe. The book will have full-color plates, fiction tidbits and hazard data on many of the classic encounters of Sword of the Stars and Sword of the Stars 2: Lords of Winter. A must for fans of the SotSverse! It is slated for delivery in April of 2013.

Please add $10 for International Shipping outside the USA and Canada.

The Pit Premium Lore Book

One of the special items created for this campaign is a premium Sword of the Stars Lore Book. Collected for the first time in print are over a hundred full-color illustrations, tidbits of background fiction, interviews with artists and designers on the Sword of the Stars series, and never-before-seen internal concept art related not only to The Pit, but to all the games in the Sword of the Stars franchise.

The first hundred of these special edition hardbacks will be personally signed by the Lead Writer of the Sword of the Stars series, Arinn Dembo, and the in-house concept artists for the series, Chris Gerspacher, Ken Lee and John Yakimow.

The Premium Lore Book is slated for delivery in April of 2013.

The Sword of the Stars 2 Poster Pack!

We created seven special edition schematic posters for this campaign, representing the ships for all seven of the playable Factions which presently exist for Sword of the Stars 2: Lords of Winter. Each poster is 18 x 24 inches, printed with a lovely matte finish on high quality poster paper.

The Schematics for the Human, Hiver, Tarka, Liir, Zuul and Morrigi ships could be picked up one or two at a time at the $60 level, but 7th Poster was a Special Surprise only available to supporters at the $200 level.

The Ultimate Collector's Pack

This Perk was a package which included Early Beta Access and all the swag for this campaign, including:

- the Repensum bumper sticker
- 2 Sol Force Service Mugs
- 2 Campaign T-shirts
- the Kerberos Concept Art Calendar
- the Premium Lore Book, signed by the Lead Writer and Concept Artists for Sword of the Stars
- and the Complete Poster Pack, complete with all 7 ship schematics.

True Believer: Become a V.I.P.

Supporters at the $1000 level will receive a copy of every Kerberos Productions release for the next ten years! Every game and its expansions will be yours. In addition, we will send 2 Campaign t-shirts of your choice, and make a special VIP card for you, printed with your name.

Holders of the Kerberos VIP card will be granted free entry to any Kerberos public event, including those that would normally be Press Only. They will also have the right to cast a vote when choosing the company's next project.

 

Come to Vancouver and Visit Kerberos!

This package included all the benefits of the True Believer Perk, but you can also come on down for two days this December and party with Kerberos!

The X-Mas Perk package will cover two hotel nights in Vancouver, dinner with the Kerberos Team, a tour of our Mount Pleasant studio, and a day of board-gaming and sci-fi movies with Mecron and the Pit Crew.

Airfare and other expenses were not included in this package.

 

 

Do we have Stretch Goals? Yes, we do!

Although we did not reach our initial funding goal during this campaign, we have never given up on our three preliminary Stretch Goals for The Pit. The first is the Mind Games Expansion.

 

The Mind Games Expansion will be a nice bundle of new DLC content for The Pit, complete with new levels, a new Character to play, new monsters, items, and other cool mechanics. If we reach this Stretch Goal, all Supporters of this campaign--including those who picked up Just the Game at the $10 Level--will receive the Mind Games Expansion for free.

People who buy the game later will have to pay extra for expansions.

Stretch Goal two is pretty simple: more platforms! If we reach our $90,000 Stretch Goal, we will convert The Pit for Android and iPad, which will make it playable on your data pad of choice!

Kerberos Productions is a small studio of passionate, highly committed game developers in Vancouver, BC. Since the studio formed in 2004 we have released three ground-breaking games for the PC: Sword of the Stars, Fort Zombie, and Sword of the Stars 2: Lords of Winter.
 
For eight years we have worked to build and maintain a reputation for innovative design, developer-player interaction and post-release product support which is second to none. We are a small company with big ideas and a big heart.
 
 
The production team of Sword of the Stars: The Pit consists of seven professional game devs, who between them have over 80 years of experience in the computer gaming industry. We've contributed to 15 released titles over the years.
 
For more information about the dev team, please visit our Team Page.
 

We Have a Plan to Become Fully Independent

The Plan has both Short term and Long Term Goals.

The Short Term Goal is simple. We wanted to make The Pit. It is a fun little game, and we hope that you will enjoy it.

The Long Term Goal is more complicated. We need to find a new way of making games in general. Our player base has been actively trying to support our studio for years, by buying our games and expansions.

Sadly, in the eight years that we have been making games, not a penny of that support has EVER reached us directly. The old system just isn't working well for us, for a variety of reasons, and we aren't alone in this: there are a lot of developers feeling the crunch.

Needless to say, in order to keep doing what we love to do and still survive, we have to start doing things in new ways.

We Want More Control

It is time to move forward on our own.

We want more control over the complete life cycle of our games, from funding and early development to release. We want to be able to keep up product support long after our games hit the market.

In order to achieve this, we need your help.

We Want to Connect

We have always been one of the most accessible game dev teams in the business. Now, thanks to sites like Indiegogo and Kickstarter, our connection to our players can have a lot more impact on the health of our studio and the direction of our games.

A committed group of supporters can make amazing things happen. The Pit is living proof of that.

You can decide what games are made, and how much content those games will have.

The Pit Is Part of the Plan

Our plan is to start small and work our way to bigger things.
 
We want to develop a catalog of games which are completely independent and self-published. We're starting with small projects, games with smaller budgets and faster turn-around times.
 
Over time we'll build up to bigger, more ambitious games. Small projects like The Pit will teach us what we need to know about publishing and distributing our own games and merchandise.
 
Once we have a few successful self-published games under our belts, we'll be ready to launch something bigger and more involved, like Fort Zombie 2 or Northstar.
 

Join the Expedition

Every supporter of this campaign will be listed in the credits for The Pit if they wish, and will have access to some special wallpapers, forum avatars and regular updates on the progress of the game.

If you can't chip in right now, you can still help!

Get the word out and help make some noise about The Pit! We have a nice selection of banners that you can put into your signature file on your forum of choice, and we’re happy to answer questions about the game or our future on your site of choice for gaming news and reviews.

Get the word out about the Big Switch to fully independent development for Kerberos. Spread the word about any games that you liked from us in the past, and the games you'd like to see from us in the future.

Share this campaign with your friends, family, and followers!

Many thanks for visiting our campaign page.

Why Make This Game?
The Pit came out of our love of dungeon-diving and retro-style games. Roguelikes are the low hanging fruit of the “small game” market at the moment, but any genre can be made new and fun if you give it the right spin.
The Pit takes the usual Kerberos approach to the classics: we pay tribute to the great games of the past, without actually cloning them.  Instead, we wanted to reimagine the Good Old Days through the lens of modern gameplay.
With The Pit, we deliver retro graphics, but give you the levelling, ammo, crafting and skills of a true dungeon dive. And of course, we set the action in our favourite playground, the SotSVerse!
And so The Pit was born.

Why You Will Love This Game
The Pit is a game is for everyone who wants to smile, snarl, chuckle and swear their way through play sessions ranging from 10 minutes to 3 hours.
The game sticks with the traditional Rogue model. It's all about how long you can live and how deep into The Pit you can go, but it is combined with gameplay and a backdrop you can seriously sink your teeth into. 
From the action RPG perspective, your character will gain in levels and skill as you defeat more opponents and complete more tasks.
Despite being quick and fun, you'll have to sweat to keep your Character alive and you'll be identifying with the Li'l Dude just enough that it stings when he gets eaten by a Rabid Moon Bear.
Game Features
 The Pit was released on February 21, 2013. The finished game is now available for download.
Here's the Feature List we promised on release in October 2012:

3 Characters to choose from…Marine, Scout and Engineer!


Go up levels and improve your skills as you try and find a way to survive the depths.

30 Levels of ancient evil science between you and the cure!


Dozens of enemies drawn from the SotSverse!

Over 30 weapons and armors with a variety of special effects including flamethrowers, rocket launchers, plasma cannons and powered Brawler armor!

Randomized augmentation effects to make each game unique.

Crafting lets you make special items from bits and pieces of your enemies.

Over 60 items to discover, ranging from the familiar to the ancient exotic tech.

Dozens of room types containing a host of exotic devices to help and hinder the player.

Many fiendish ways to die including poisoning, disease, traps, radiation, starvation and of course…MONSTERS.

 
We did our best to cook up a lot of cool swag for The Pit. Most of these items are Special Edition, One-Time-Only goodies for this particular campaign. Even if we launch another campaign in the future for some other game, most of the Perks will be very different.
 


Supporters at the $10 level were able to download the full game on release day, and are listed in the credits of the game. All supporters of the game will receive updates and have access to Wallpapers, Avatars and other digital goodies for Sword of the Stars: The Pit.
 


The Repensum Bumper Sticker
Supporters at the $15 received the finished game on release day and a Repensum Bumper Sticker as a thank-you for their support.
The Repensum Bumper Sticker is printed on durable vinyl, suitable for display on your car, truck or dreadnaught. It features the unofficial motto of Sol Force: REPENSUM EST CANICULA, "Payback is a Bitch."
Final size is 279mm x 76mm, or approximately 11 inches x 3 inches. You can add the Repensum Bumper Sticker to any other Perk for an additional $5.
 

The Official Sol Force Service Mug
Our Service Mug is a 16 oz double walled stainless steel mug with a plastic liner, foam insulated, and has a push-on lid to prevent your beverage from spilling when you lose artificial gravity or take a pounding from kinetic weapons. It is printed with the Sol Force logo and the official motto: PER ARDUA AD ASTRA, "Through Hardship, the Stars".
The Perk Price covers the cost of delivery anywhere in the USA or Canada. For International Postage outside the USA or Canada, please add $10.
 
 
 


Cool Campaign T-Shirts
Supporters at $50 or more could choose from one of two t-shirts. The Kerberos Logo t-shirt is an old stand-by, and at least one or two are owned by every developer in the studio. The Pit t-shirt is a Special Edition item for supporters of this campaign only.
Both t-shirts are screen-printed on black 100% cotton shirts, available in sizes S-4XL. You could order more than one t-shirt, and the Perk price covered delivery in the USA and Canada. For International Shipping outside the USA and Canada, it was an additional $10.
 


Sword of the Stars 2 Ship Schematics
Supporters at the $60 level receive Early Beta Access, plus choose one of six beautiful 18 x 24 inch ship schematic posters.
Designs available at this level include Human, Hiver, Tarka, Liir, Zuul and Morrigi ships from Sword of the Stars 2: Lords of Winter. Please add $30 for each additional poster at this level, and please add $10 for International Shipping outside of the USA and Canada.
 


Kerberos Concept Calendar 2013
Supporters at the $75 level receive Early Beta access to the game, plus a full-color Kerberos Concept Art Calendar for 2013 as a thank-you for their support.
The Kerberos Calendar features 13 months of concept art, including sneak previews of unannounced projects. Exclusive swag for supporters of this campaign. Kerberos Insiders Only!
BONUS BOOK: Thanks to Supporter Feedback (and lack of space in the main Lore Book!), we decided to add a bonus book to this Perk!
Black Section: The Complete Files is an over-sized softcover art-and-lore book, focused exclusively on the Random Encounters, Grand Menaces and Mysteries of the Sword of the Stars universe. The book will have full-color plates, fiction tidbits and hazard data on many of the classic encounters of Sword of the Stars and Sword of the Stars 2: Lords of Winter. A must for fans of the SotSverse! It is slated for delivery in April of 2013.

Please add $10 for International Shipping outside the USA and Canada.


The Pit Premium Lore Book
One of the special items created for this campaign is a premium Sword of the Stars Lore Book. Collected for the first time in print are over a hundred full-color illustrations, tidbits of background fiction, interviews with artists and designers on the Sword of the Stars series, and never-before-seen internal concept art related not only to The Pit, but to all the games in the Sword of the Stars franchise.
The first hundred of these special edition hardbacks will be personally signed by the Lead Writer of the Sword of the Stars series, Arinn Dembo, and the in-house concept artists for the series, Chris Gerspacher, Ken Lee and John Yakimow.
The Premium Lore Book is slated for delivery in April of 2013.


The Sword of the Stars 2 Poster Pack!
We created seven special edition schematic posters for this campaign, representing the ships for all seven of the playable Factions which presently exist for Sword of the Stars 2: Lords of Winter. Each poster is 18 x 24 inches, printed with a lovely matte finish on high quality poster paper.
The Schematics for the Human, Hiver, Tarka, Liir, Zuul and Morrigi ships could be picked up one or two at a time at the $60 level, but 7th Poster was a Special Surprise only available to supporters at the $200 level.

The Ultimate Collector's Pack

This Perk was a package which included Early Beta Access and all the swag for this campaign, including:
- the Repensum bumper sticker - 2 Sol Force Service Mugs - 2 Campaign T-shirts - the Kerberos Concept Art Calendar - the Premium Lore Book, signed by the Lead Writer and Concept Artists for Sword of the Stars - and the Complete Poster Pack, complete with all 7 ship schematics.

True Believer: Become a V.I.P.
Supporters at the $1000 level will receive a copy of every Kerberos Productions release for the next ten years! Every game and its expansions will be yours. In addition, we will send 2 Campaign t-shirts of your choice, and make a special VIP card for you, printed with your name.
Holders of the Kerberos VIP card will be granted free entry to any Kerberos public event, including those that would normally be Press Only. They will also have the right to cast a vote when choosing the company's next project.
 


Come to Vancouver and Visit Kerberos!
This package included all the benefits of the True Believer Perk, but you can also come on down for two days this December and party with Kerberos!
The X-Mas Perk package will cover two hotel nights in Vancouver, dinner with the Kerberos Team, a tour of our Mount Pleasant studio, and a day of board-gaming and sci-fi movies with Mecron and the Pit Crew.
Airfare and other expenses were not included in this package.
 

 
Do we have Stretch Goals? Yes, we do!
Although we did not reach our initial funding goal during this campaign, we have never given up on our three preliminary Stretch Goals for The Pit. The first is the Mind Games Expansion.
 


The Mind Games Expansion will be a nice bundle of new DLC content for The Pit, complete with new levels, a new Character to play, new monsters, items, and other cool mechanics. If we reach this Stretch Goal, all Supporters of this campaign--including those who picked up Just the Game at the $10 Level--will receive the Mind Games Expansion for free.
People who buy the game later will have to pay extra for expansions.

Stretch Goal two is pretty simple: more platforms! If we reach our $90,000 Stretch Goal, we will convert The Pit for Android and iPad, which will make it playable on your data pad of choice!



Kerberos Productions is a small studio of passionate, highly committed game developers in Vancouver, BC. Since the studio formed in 2004 we have released three ground-breaking games for the PC: Sword of the Stars, Fort Zombie, and Sword of the Stars 2: Lords of Winter.
 
For eight years we have worked to build and maintain a reputation for innovative design, developer-player interaction and post-release product support which is second to none. We are a small company with big ideas and a big heart.
 

 
The production team of Sword of the Stars: The Pit consists of seven professional game devs, who between them have over 80 years of experience in the computer gaming industry. We've contributed to 15 released titles over the years.
 
For more information about the dev team, please visit our Team Page.
 


We Have a Plan to Become Fully Independent
The Plan has both Short term and Long Term Goals.
The Short Term Goal is simple. We wanted to make The Pit. It is a fun little game, and we hope that you will enjoy it.
The Long Term Goal is more complicated. We need to find a new way of making games in general. Our player base has been actively trying to support our studio for years, by buying our games and expansions.
Sadly, in the eight years that we have been making games, not a penny of that support has EVER reached us directly. The old system just isn't working well for us, for a variety of reasons, and we aren't alone in this: there are a lot of developers feeling the crunch.
Needless to say, in order to keep doing what we love to do and still survive, we have to start doing things in new ways.
We Want More Control
It is time to move forward on our own.
We want more control over the complete life cycle of our games, from funding and early development to release. We want to be able to keep up product support long after our games hit the market.
In order to achieve this, we need your help.
We Want to Connect
We have always been one of the most accessible game dev teams in the business. Now, thanks to sites like Indiegogo and Kickstarter, our connection to our players can have a lot more impact on the health of our studio and the direction of our games.
A committed group of supporters can make amazing things happen. The Pit is living proof of that.
You can decide what games are made, and how much content those games will have.
The Pit Is Part of the Plan
Our plan is to start small and work our way to bigger things.
 
We want to develop a catalog of games which are completely independent and self-published. We're starting with small projects, games with smaller budgets and faster turn-around times.
 
Over time we'll build up to bigger, more ambitious games. Small projects like The Pit will teach us what we need to know about publishing and distributing our own games and merchandise.
 
Once we have a few successful self-published games under our belts, we'll be ready to launch something bigger and more involved, like Fort Zombie 2 or Northstar.
 

Join the Expedition
Every supporter of this campaign will be listed in the credits for The Pit if they wish, and will have access to some special wallpapers, forum avatars and regular updates on the progress of the game.
If you can't chip in right now, you can still help!
Get the word out and help make some noise about The Pit! We have a nice selection of banners that you can put into your signature file on your forum of choice, and we’re happy to answer questions about the game or our future on your site of choice for gaming news and reviews.
Get the word out about the Big Switch to fully independent development for Kerberos. Spread the word about any games that you liked from us in the past, and the games you'd like to see from us in the future.
Share this campaign with your friends, family, and followers!
Many thanks for visiting our campaign page.

story:
Every day a documented average of 22 Veterans and 1 active duty Serviceperson suffering from PTSD takes their own life.

In November of 2013 Army Ranger SFC Jason B Granger was made aware that one of his fellow Rangers, Cpl Chris Bemiss, was sitting in his pickup with his prescription pain meds, alcohol, and his pistol, ready to permanently end his own pain.

Sgt Granger immediately intervened and was able to avert a tragedy that has taken more lives than the Global War On Terror itself.

Tragically, SFC Granger was killed in a skydiving accident the very next month, just 2 days after Christmas.

Since that time, Cpl Bemiss (Retired) has, himself, waged an unrelenting battle against the demons of war and has been instrumental in pulling brothers from the fire as well.

Jason's family feels very strongly that this legacy MUST continue, the tide must be turned, and the epidemic of Veteran suicides must be ended immediately.

The V.A. is overwhelmed and choked by politics and bureaucracy and is unable to keep pace with the tragic numbers.

One of the proven tools at our disposal is Equine Assisted Psychotherapy. A team approach utilizing a therapist, a handler, a horse, and the Veteran. Numerous studies prove the efficacy of this treatment and is one we are able to implement.

We don't need to own property, we don't need to own horses, we just need to bring Veterans and these elements together with the certified and licensed individuals in a relaxing and private setting.

We have the individuals at the ready, the horses are available and we just needed the setting.

Last month we were introduced to Julie, owner of Wagon Wheel Ranch in Hesperia, California. Julie and her husband have spent years running and expanding a horse ranch for underprivileged and special needs children. They began a large expansion several years ago having site plans produced, blueprints created, and permits pulled. Obtaining the Conditional Use Permit itself was a monumental task. Unfortunately, 2 months ago, Julie's husband passed away quite suddenly leaving her with almost a half million dollar investment with the only thing to show for it being signed permits and graded building sites.

So a vision derailed by tragedy meets a vision born from tragedy. Beauty from ashes.

We have partnered with Wagon Wheel Ranch to prepare the property and raise the critically needed building funds in exchange for use of the property for therapy sessions and associated recreational activities and events. Quid Pro Quo.

Citizens doing what the bloated system can't. But we need your help as well. We have January and February to raise the needed amount for phase one in order to retain the Conditional use permit. We will begin to raise funds for the rest of the project as soon as the administrative pressure is off of Phase one. Phase one is the trenching, rough plumbing and electrical, and the pouring of the foundation of the Rec Hall which will include a kitchen area, dining area, showers, and restrooms. Nothing can continue until these are completed.

To paraphrase Sir Winston Churchill, We owe so much to so many and it is time to pay the debt owed to America's sons and daughters.

Won't you help us as we begin our part of giving back to those who have given so much?
