story:
Short Summary

In the 70's and 80's, RPG box sets with booklets were all the rage. In recent years, many game publishers have shifted to publishing 200+ page RPG hardbacks instead of the much-beloved booklet format of prior years. Hardbacks have a great shelf-life, but many of us miss the convenience of smaller books which have streamlined mechanics and easily lay flat the game table. 

We've been waiting for the 5e OGL/SRD for some time, and had this secret project already in the works! This project leverages OGL content to create two 8.5x11" booklets — a Player's Guide and a Gamemaster's Guide — each between 36-44 pages, which together form a complete RPG system that is fully 5e compatible. There are four standard classes: Fighter, Wizard, Cleric, and Thief and the game can advance those characters up to level 15.

What We Need & What You Get

While we have some of the art already commissioned and done, we are seeking funding to create additional art and text content for this exciting product!

  • Backers get PDF copies as well as print-at-cost codes from DriveThroughRPG. You can get hard copies at cost; you just need to pay shipping! Costs for backers to back this project and print at cost will be cheaper than retail costs after the project ends.
  • We also plan to offer you a Kit — a PDF, cover file, and instructions — that lets you you print these booklets at cost at any other printer you choose! For example, you can print several copies at Lulu.com or Kinkos, and get the in booklet, spiral, or hardback format!
  • We also will enable you to customize the look and feel of the cover. To that end, we will soon be announcing a contest to design additional booklet cover designs — you can use one of these alternate covers from the contest, or even create your own! We'll give you some templates in OpenOffice/LibreOffice to customize the cover for your personal printing. 
  • Is it a box? No, we call it 'Red Box RPG' to harken back to the various box set RPGs of the 70's and 80's, but this project is producing the two game booklets only. We will have a separate project later in the year to produce a 'White Box RPG' that actually WILL have a box!

Player's Guide

We will include all the rules and content needed to play the four standard races: Human, Elf, Dwarf, and Halfling. We will also support the four standard classes: Fighter, Wizard, Cleric, and Thief. We will include a choose-your-own-adventure style introductory game that is fun for learning or for solo play. Just like the original!

Gamemaster's Guide

The Gamemaster's Guide will give you all the tools to run the game, including a bestiary. The guide also provides unique tools to make running dynamic, sandbox games and hex-crawls a breeze! Here is a sampling of some of the tools (space permitting) you can expect in the Gamemaster's Guide:

Bestiary

  • Concise Bestiary with easy-to-scan-and-use stat blocks that feel like 1e but are compatible with 5e! Here's a sample:

    DOPPELGANGER: HP 52 (8d8+16); AC 14; Atk 2 slam (+6 to hit, 7 (1d6+4) dmg); Speed 30'; Abilities Str +0, Dex +4, Con +2, Int +0, Wis +1, Cha +2; Perception 11; CR 3; XP 700; Special mimics shapes, immune to charmed condition, darkvision 60 ft., +10 (3d6) dmg on first attack if surprising opponent, reads thoughts.

Combat

  • Combat Outs, Critical Fail / Fumbles, Escalations, Hit Locations

People

  • Aristocrats, City NPCs, Contact Reactions, Motive / Needs, NPC Encounters, NPC Names, NPC Quirks, NPC Reactions, Relationships, Rules for Hirelings (wages, etc.)

Places

  • Businesses, Locations, Tavern Names, Town Names, Time & Tides, Weather & Hazards

Things

  • I Search the Body, Mundane Objects, Ship Names, Quick Traps

Treasure

  • Treasure Tables, Unique Magic Items, Books & Tomes, Curiosities (similar to Trinkets)

Conversions

  • On-the-fly 1e to 5e Conversion Guide

Who We Are

Rogue Comet is a new RPG company formed by fans of the hobby who want to create time-saving GM tools to make gaming easier. Together with a hoard of helpers and supporters we strive to create fantastic products for everyone! We just completed a very successful Kickstarter for 5e Adventures, and now look forward to expanding our product lines. While not part of this IndieGoGo project, we have a related future project on our roadmap to create a series of 5.5x8.5" booklets and a box set RPG that has similar content to 'Dungeonesque: Red Box RPG' called 'Dungeonesque: White Box RPG' -- compatible rules and similar content but with smaller booklets. We plan on an entire line of booklet products to give you old-school tools you can use!


FAQs

Question: What exactly IS Dungeonesque?

Answer: Dungeonesque is a concise version of 5e using a retro layout (white pages, clean design) and styled after 70s and 80s boxed set games. There will be a Red Box (8.5x11", two booklet) version and a White Box (5.5x8.5", three booklet) version of the core rules, along with a physical box for the White Box edition.  This project is for the Red Box version.

Question: What is the advantage of using the Dungeonesque booklets vs. the current hardback books from WOTC?

Answer: There's a few things we're striving for:

Usability: In my day job I have been a human-centered-design expert for many years. Table-top ergonomics are a big focus for me. I want the content to be easy to scan, easy to understand, and easy to thumb through to find the content you want. To that end, we'll experiment with tricks like putting key tables and an index on the back cover.

Hackability: These books have black-and-white interiors. And they're inexpensive. Write in the margins. Print a custom version of the PDF that has some additional charts and tables you've made for your campaign and add then to the back. Slap a cool custom book cover that gets designed in a cover design contest that we'll soon kick-off. Then get the final product spiral-bound at a local printer. Hack these booklets, and use them like you want!

Providing an inexpensive, high-production-value tool for new players: One of the things I've loved about Savage Worlds is their inexpensive $10 rulebook. We want to allow that same, low-cost freedom. Have a new player to the game? You can have a stack of low-cost Dungeonesque Player's Guides you can hand out like candy. You can print them through DriveThruRPG, or print them at home. We'll have special low-ink covers that will look great even if you're printing at home and getting Kinko's to spiral bind the books.

Mixing booklets and traditional hardback handbooks at the same table: One of our top goals is to make the Dungeonesque Player's Guide and Gamemaster's Guide interoperable with the other 5e core books already published. For my part, I'll use Wizard's DMG for certain activities when I prepare for a game, but the Dungeonesque Gamemaster's Guide will be my go-to tool for use during the game. My players will use a mix of traditional hardback PHBs with one or two having a Dungeonesque Player's Guide. It all works together.

Question: Why not just print out the WOTC 5e Basic Rules?

Answer: The 5e Basic Rules published by WOTC are great and certainly are useful for printing. They clock in at 115 pages, have no cover, and no interior art. Dungeonesque will provide a streamlined alternative set of rules that run around 40 pages, have interior art, and a beautiful cover (and in fact, we'll make sure you have multiple, beautiful cover options). Both products cover the same set of rules.

Question: What is the difference between the Dungeonesque rules and the full set of rules in the SRD at http://dnd.wizards.com/articles/features/systems-reference-document-srd?

Answer: The exact contents are written in pencil, not pen, and the final contents may flex a bit as we experiment with copy and art layouts. But the current plan is this:

For the Player's Guide:

We have reduced scope to just a few races (Human, Elf, Dwarf, Halfling, etc.), and four classes (Fighter, Wizard, Cleric, and Thief).

We've reduced the level support to 1-15 instead of 1-20. Those higher levels add lots of complexity in terms of word count, spell descriptions, etc.

We take a very old-school approach in terms of conciseness. A lot of content has been completely rewritten from the SRD, so even though it explains the same rule, we do it with fewer words. In many cases, the content is 1/8 the size of the SRD description of the same set of rules.

For the Gamemaster's Guide:

We'll have many of the expected tools, but we'll have a bigger focus on 'tools you need during the game' to support on-the-fly adventuring. The Bestiary will be concise, expressing stat blocks with 1/8 the text but conveying the same information (and, arguably more, since we'll add a 'tactics' section for spellcasters for example).

We're not changing any rules or in any way making this incompatible with the standard 5e rules, we're just having a very concise expression of those rules and adding some really cool tools and gaming aids.

Risks & Challenges

The vast majority of the text is complete. All that remains is some small additions to the GM's Guide, the choose-your-own-adventure text, and layout. We think we can deliver this project without problems.

However, as with any manufacturing process, things can go wrong. We have identified that delays in layout and delays in printer setup could happen. So we have allowed additional time in our schedule as a buffer to enable us to avoid such delay issues. If all goes as planned we may even be able to deliver the project a little sooner.

We understand the printing process as our founder has published several fiction and nonfiction books before and has worked with multiple printers. With projects like this there is nearly always something that costs more, so it makes business sense to have contingencies for this. We have built this into our costs.

Conventional crowdsourcing risks of fulfillment and printing are virtually nonexistent since we are using OneBookshelf's DriveThruRPG front end for printing and shipping on an at-cost basis for print-level backers. In the unlikely case that DriveThruRPG goes out of business, we have sufficient financial reserves to refund print backers the difference in pledge levels.

No matter what problems occur we will always keep our backers and supporters informed of any issues that arise so you will be aware of the situation and how we will be handling it.

Spread The Word!

We always appreciate your help in spreading the news about our 5e Adventures and Maps, and we want to thank you in a meaningful way.

Post the link to this project on the social media of your choice. Then tag @RogueComet (Twitter, Facebook, or Google Plus), and send a link or screenshot of the post to info@roguecomet.com. After the project funds, we’ll email you a link to the PDF copy of new one-sheet 5e adventure — exclusively available to our Social Media and Blog fans! Better yet, pledge to support the project at the MINION level or higher and then spread the word. Thanks so much for your support!
story_txt:
Short Summary In the 70's and 80's, RPG box sets with booklets were all the rage. In recent years, many game publishers have shifted to publishing 200+ page RPG hardbacks instead of the much-beloved booklet format of prior years. Hardbacks have a great shelf-life, but many of us miss the convenience of smaller books which have streamlined mechanics and easily lay flat the game table. 
We've been waiting for the 5e OGL/SRD for some time, and had this secret project already in the works! This project leverages OGL content to create two 8.5x11" booklets — a Player's Guide and a Gamemaster's Guide — each between 36-44 pages, which together form a complete RPG system that is fully 5e compatible. There are four standard classes: Fighter, Wizard, Cleric, and Thief and the game can advance those characters up to level 15.   What We Need & What You Get While we have some of the art already commissioned and done, we are seeking funding to create additional art and text content for this exciting product!
 
Backers get PDF copies as well as print-at-cost codes from DriveThroughRPG. You can get hard copies at cost; you just need to pay shipping! Costs for backers to back this project and print at cost will be cheaper than retail costs after the project ends. 
We also plan to offer you a Kit — a PDF, cover file, and instructions — that lets you you print these booklets at cost at any other printer you choose! For example, you can print several copies at Lulu.com or Kinkos, and get the in booklet, spiral, or hardback format!

We also will enable you to customize the look and feel of the cover. To that end, we will soon be announcing a contest to design additional booklet cover designs — you can use one of these alternate covers from the contest, or even create your own! We'll give you some templates in OpenOffice/LibreOffice to customize the cover for your personal printing. 

Is it a box? No, we call it 'Red Box RPG' to harken back to the various box set RPGs of the 70's and 80's, but this project is producing the two game booklets only. We will have a separate project later in the year to produce a 'White Box RPG' that actually WILL have a box!





Player's Guide
We will include all the rules and content needed to play the four standard races: Human, Elf, Dwarf, and Halfling. We will also support the four standard classes: Fighter, Wizard, Cleric, and Thief. We will include a choose-your-own-adventure style introductory game that is fun for learning or for solo play. Just like the original!

Gamemaster's Guide The Gamemaster's Guide will give you all the tools to run the game, including a bestiary. The guide also provides unique tools to make running dynamic, sandbox games and hex-crawls a breeze! Here is a sampling of some of the tools (space permitting) you can expect in the Gamemaster's Guide:

Bestiary
Concise Bestiary with easy-to-scan-and-use stat blocks that feel like 1e but are compatible with 5e! Here's a sample:DOPPELGANGER: HP 52 (8d8+16); AC 14; Atk 2 slam (+6 to hit, 7 (1d6+4) dmg); Speed 30'; Abilities Str +0, Dex +4, Con +2, Int +0, Wis +1, Cha +2; Perception 11; CR 3; XP 700; Special mimics shapes, immune to charmed condition, darkvision 60 ft., +10 (3d6) dmg on first attack if surprising opponent, reads thoughts.

Combat
Combat Outs, Critical Fail / Fumbles, Escalations, Hit Locations
People
Aristocrats, City NPCs, Contact Reactions, Motive / Needs, NPC Encounters, NPC Names, NPC Quirks, NPC Reactions, Relationships, Rules for Hirelings (wages, etc.)
Places
Businesses, Locations, Tavern Names, Town Names, Time & Tides, Weather & Hazards
Things
I Search the Body, Mundane Objects, Ship Names, Quick Traps
Treasure
Treasure Tables, Unique Magic Items, Books & Tomes, Curiosities (similar to Trinkets)
Conversions
On-the-fly 1e to 5e Conversion Guide   Who We Are
Rogue Comet is a new RPG company formed by fans of the hobby who want to create time-saving GM tools to make gaming easier. Together with a hoard of helpers and supporters we strive to create fantastic products for everyone! We just completed a very successful Kickstarter for 5e Adventures, and now look forward to expanding our product lines. While not part of this IndieGoGo project, we have a related future project on our roadmap to create a series of 5.5x8.5" booklets and a box set RPG that has similar content to 'Dungeonesque: Red Box RPG' called 'Dungeonesque: White Box RPG' -- compatible rules and similar content but with smaller booklets. We plan on an entire line of booklet products to give you old-school tools you can use!





FAQs

Question: What exactly IS Dungeonesque?
Answer: Dungeonesque is a concise version of 5e using a retro layout (white pages, clean design) and styled after 70s and 80s boxed set games. There will be a Red Box (8.5x11", two booklet) version and a White Box (5.5x8.5", three booklet) version of the core rules, along with a physical box for the White Box edition.  This project is for the Red Box version.

Usability: In my day job I have been a human-centered-design expert for many years. Table-top ergonomics are a big focus for me. I want the content to be easy to scan, easy to understand, and easy to thumb through to find the content you want. To that end, we'll experiment with tricks like putting key tables and an index on the back cover.
Hackability: These books have black-and-white interiors. And they're inexpensive. Write in the margins. Print a custom version of the PDF that has some additional charts and tables you've made for your campaign and add then to the back. Slap a cool custom book cover that gets designed in a cover design contest that we'll soon kick-off. Then get the final product spiral-bound at a local printer. Hack these booklets, and use them like you want!
Providing an inexpensive, high-production-value tool for new players: One of the things I've loved about Savage Worlds is their inexpensive $10 rulebook. We want to allow that same, low-cost freedom. Have a new player to the game? You can have a stack of low-cost Dungeonesque Player's Guides you can hand out like candy. You can print them through DriveThruRPG, or print them at home. We'll have special low-ink covers that will look great even if you're printing at home and getting Kinko's to spiral bind the books.
Mixing booklets and traditional hardback handbooks at the same table: One of our top goals is to make the Dungeonesque Player's Guide and Gamemaster's Guide interoperable with the other 5e core books already published. For my part, I'll use Wizard's DMG for certain activities when I prepare for a game, but the Dungeonesque Gamemaster's Guide will be my go-to tool for use during the game. My players will use a mix of traditional hardback PHBs with one or two having a Dungeonesque Player's Guide. It all works together.

story:
Every story has a beginning and an end.

WWW.ADA-GAME.COM

ITCH.IO

GAMEJOLT

Main features:

  •  Story driven adventure filled with unique characters with their own story lines, know them well becouse they will accompany you along your road,
  •  Explore vast and cruel open world crafted pixel by pixel with passion and love, find all secrets scattered across the land (and water),
  •  Fight your way through hordes of diverse enemies with unique behaviour and design, be prepared, observe, adapt and survive,
  •  Unlock and upgrade skills, equip your favourite ones, forge your character in unique way that suits your style,
  •  Brew potions and other powerful consumables, forage land for ingredients to combine them into useful items, 
  •  Be prepared for the unexpected as world around you  is constantly changing and you never know what you will run into, be it  at night or day time.
 

 

PLATFORMS

 Ada will get initially released on PC, Mac and Linux. Both steam and  DRM-free. What will follow is later release on consoles, which with  enough funding could happen simultaneously.

 

"I could swear I knew that forest, but so many things have changed" 

"Things I grew up around are no longer here. Are those even the same places? I guess there is only one way to find out" 

 Open world  - World of Ada is open for you to explore. You can choose whichever path you want as long as you can fight your way throu encountered enemies! 

 Fast travel - there are two fast travel mechanics in Ada, short and long distance. You can either teleport between crystals as a shortcut or move between whole zones.

 Hand crafted zones that are proceduraly put together - each play-through world of Ada is built differently, from carefuly handcrafted and designed zones. This way you can get unique experience without making it feel artificial and unimmersive.

 Random Encounters - while exploring world of Ada, you will run into many unexpected situations. Be prepared! Or... die!!!!!

  • ghouls feasting on preys be it animals or dead families, 
  •  traveling merchants, 
  • knowledgable priests,
  • bandits laying in ambush, 
  • monster lairs, 
  • post-war scenes,
  • and many more... uh... there's a lot of them!

 Some encounters change overtime. Friendly traveling merchants could become prey of ghouls or other vile creatures lurking around the world of Ada.

 

Fast-paced skill based combat - Combat in Ada is based on combination of basic attack routine with secondary skill of your choice and potions/consumables. No fight could end well without proper movement and dodging.

 Dark Crystals - most attacks in Ada requires  Dark Crystals, you can get them by attacking enemies. Ragelike mechanic  used for everything (also spells)

Basic combat mechanics

  •  Base attack - slash through enemies with a classic deadly 3 - attack combo,
  •  Roll - classic evasive manouver, roll your way to victory,

Secondary skills:

  •  Attack skills - powerful melee attacks, blink AoE smashes, shooting dark ink bolts, traps that shoots spikes at enemies and more.
  •  Defensive skills - shield yourself, heal yourself, get invisible for a brief amount of time, turn foes against each other and much more.
  •  Items - throw potions, plant seeds, send animated skulls at enemies... and more!

       Every enemy in Ada is carefully designed to bring the highest  amount of fair difficulty to game. They are unique both visually and mechanic wise. Some will attack you alone with big combos or huge swings, other will be fast, agile and evade your attack while some may group up to get you with numbers.

 No matter what enemy type are you facing you always need to focus or else it may go really wrong. Some enemies will jump at you from hiding or spawn as you disturb their nest. Be aware as you never know from which direction the danger will come.

 Ranks of monsters is constantly growing not only in sheer numbers, but also in variety. Player can run into undeads, vicious beasts, local tribesmen, creepy insects or ancients.

 Enemies in Ada does not end here. Once you get deep enough you will find out that there is something more. Something far more dangerous than what you have seen. Prepare for epic encounters with main and side bosses that are fitting for the zone you are exploring. Some you must face, while others could be skipped, but remember: with great danger comes great reward.

 

Face all challenges to come as not-so-brave tomb raider.

"Being thrown into gruesome and cruel world as a fragile  girl is harsh, especially that you never would have guessed what will come."

 Ada may feel out of place, but this is what she has to do. While progressing throughout the story you will find out where she come from, why is she here and what her destiny is.

 Unlock and upgrade skills as you go. Choose from handful of amazing abilities that will be crutial for defeating tougher enemies.

Once you unlock the skill you can upgrade it to get more slots to put your infusion orbs in. Each and every upgrade comes with different effect. From basic ones like boosting damage, range or speed to advanced ones like players after image, flaming footsteps or defense shield.

 Equip those that suit you best. Or just slash everything with basic attack. No matter what you choose the world will be againts you. Becouse you are an outsider.

 

"It always amazes me how leaves, roots and blood of a rodent turn into weapons of mass destruction."

Use alchemy to create useful potions. Some may be used to heal, boost  up abilities or can be thrown at enemies to harm, confuse, stun or even  turn them against each other.

 Collect herbs, crystals, vials and all kind of ingredients to create  powerful potions. Each of them comes in different sizes, and as we know  the bigger the size, the stronger the explosion.

 

 Some potions could be even used to interact with environment. To burn things down or freeze up the water. Who knows what that might mean for you and exploring the world of Ada.

 

 Every story needs to start somewhere. This is where you meet Ada and as much as you'd want her to have a normal, happy life it is just not possible in this land, in this time, in this world. Any job would be better than that. But what if that is the only one...

"I should have never entered these ruins. Well, no one  could ever change Madys mind?"

 "Something was terribly wrong."

Things always worked out. Somehow. But not this time.

"She was always the one to take risks, so why am I the one left alone?"

Everything has changed... It always was hard, you had to be tough to survive, but now? How could it turn out this way...

 "I'm sure I knew those woods. Not anymore, I guess."

 Dive right into the story filled with mystery and loneliness. Nothing in this land is what it looks like and nothing is  how  you remember. 

Interact with characters, participate in their storylines and complete quests. Each and every one of them has its own story, character and appearance.

Pieces of history of the land you explore can be found scattered along your way. Either as paintings or flashbacks showing you ancient battles, turning crubling ruins into castles or historical events.

"Why my head hurts so much, as if seeing all those flashback is not enough."

 

Original soundtrack for the game is being made by amazing Bryan Nguyen. Once you sink in it you can never go back. 

Game will feature a full length soundtrack which will accompany the  player across the whole world of Ada and help him immerse into it. 

LISTEN TO SAMPLE OF SOUNDTRACK

Ada is a product of love and passion. All of the game that you can see was made by one person, which is me. 

Idea to make a 2d action rpg emerged in mid 2017 and evolved into the  style that you can see today in the middle of 2018. Being a story  driven game that focuses not only on tight mechanics but also delivering  unique and memorable experience to the player, it needs plenty of  diverse assets made and o lot of work to be put on creating art. All of  that makes making Ada especially difficult task for only one person.

That being said you can see that much of the game is already there.  Most of the mechanics and gameplay systems are already implemented and  working. Almost all of the basic assets for most zones are also done.  Although the core of the game is solid and progressing with steady pace,  there is still much to do to bring to the game its unique feel and  "real" soul.

Development timeline:

 Q3 2020 - Beta Tests (for serious testing) 

 Q1 2021 - Release for PC (Steam, GoG) 

 Q2+ 2021 - Release for Consoles (with enough funding could be released with PC version)

 I strongly believe in transparency. When the development of the game  goes well, there is nothing to hide. Thats why I'm always updating you  with whats going on with Ada and am open to answer any questions. Be  sure to follow me everywhere you like!

Follow development:

http://ada-game.com/
https://www.facebook.com/HazyGameDev/
https://twitter.com/HazyGameDev
https://www.instagram.com/hazygamedev/?hl=en
https://hazygamedev.tumblr.com/
PressKit

 

Hi! My name is Jakub Hakiel. 

Ada is my precious project and it's been developed by me, myself and  I, which means that I'm a solo indie games developer. I'm an educated  programmer with experience as a software developer, math programmer,  engineer, scientist and more. It all made it possible for me to be able  to handle all the stuff from design to final product release. I believe  all the skills I aquired during my professional career are being used  while making Ada come true.

Music for Ada is being masterfully put together by  amazing and talented hands of Bryan Nguyen. Whose work i encourage you  to check out! He's making music for movie trailers like Player Ready One or Bumblebee. 

https://soundcloud.com/therealghostinthemachine

https://twitter.com/RobotsInTweets

 

Risks and challenges

As you most likely know, developing a game is an ever-changing process. That means it's really hard to predict everything that we will run into.
I'm working on Ada each and every day and I know I'll run into problems. I can assure you though that whatever will be happening I'll be 100% transparent and you will always be informed of any problems that might affect either your experience while playing game or the release date.

Some you must face, while others could be skipped, but remember: with great danger comes great reward. Face all challenges to come as not-so-brave tomb raider."Being thrown into gruesome and cruel world as a fragile  girl is harsh, especially that you never would have guessed what will come." Ada may feel out of place, but this is what she has to do. While progressing throughout the story you will find out where she come from, why is she here and what her destiny is. Unlock and upgrade skills as you go. Choose from handful of amazing abilities that will be crutial for defeating tougher enemies.Once you unlock the skill you can upgrade it to get more slots to put your infusion orbs in. Each and every upgrade comes with different effect. From basic ones like boosting damage, range or speed to advanced ones like players after image, flaming footsteps or defense shield. Equip those that suit you best. Or just slash everything with basic attack. No matter what you choose the world will be againts you. Becouse you are an outsider. "It always amazes me how leaves, roots and blood of a rodent turn into weapons of mass destruction."Use alchemy to create useful potions. Some may be used to heal, boost  up abilities or can be thrown at enemies to harm, confuse, stun or even  turn them against each other. Collect herbs, crystals, vials and all kind of ingredients to create  powerful potions. Each of them comes in different sizes, and as we know  the bigger the size, the stronger the explosion.  Some potions could be even used to interact with environment. To burn things down or freeze up the water. Who knows what that might mean for you and exploring the world of Ada.  Every story needs to start somewhere. This is where you meet Ada and as much as you'd want her to have a normal, happy life it is just not possible in this land, in this time, in this world. Any job would be better than that. But what if that is the only one..."I should have never entered these ruins. Well, no one  could ever change Madys mind?" "Something was terribly wrong."Things always worked out. Somehow. But not this time."She was always the one to take risks, so why am I the one left alone?"Everything has changed... It always was hard, you had to be tough to survive, but now? How could it turn out this way... "I'm sure I knew those woods. Not anymore, I guess." Dive right into the story filled with mystery and loneliness. Nothing in this land is what it looks like and nothing is  how  you remember. Interact with characters, participate in their storylines and complete quests. Each and every one of them has its own story, character and appearance.Pieces of history of the land you explore can be found scattered along your way. Either as paintings or flashbacks showing you ancient battles, turning crubling ruins into castles or historical events."Why my head hurts so much, as if seeing all those flashback is not enough." Original soundtrack for the game is being made by amazing Bryan Nguyen. Once you sink in it you can never go back. Game will feature a full length soundtrack which will accompany the  player across the whole world of Ada and help him immerse into it. LISTEN TO SAMPLE OF SOUNDTRACKAda is a product of love and passion. All of the game that you can see was made by one person, which is me. Idea to make a 2d action rpg emerged in mid 2017 and evolved into the  style that you can see today in the middle of 2018. Being a story  driven game that focuses not only on tight mechanics but also delivering  unique and memorable experience to the player, it needs plenty of  diverse assets made and o lot of work to be put on creating art. All of  that makes making Ada especially difficult task for only one person.That being said you can see that much of the game is already there.  Most of the mechanics and gameplay systems are already implemented and  working. Almost all of the basic assets for most zones are also done.  Although the core of the game is solid and progressing with steady pace,  there is still much to do to bring to the game its unique feel and  "real" soul.Development timeline: Q3 2020 - Beta Tests (for serious testing)  Q1 2021 - Release for PC (Steam, GoG)  Q2+ 2021 - Release for Consoles (with enough funding could be released with PC version) I strongly believe in transparency. When the development of the game  goes well, there is nothing to hide. Thats why I'm always updating you  with whats going on with Ada and am open to answer any questions. Be  sure to follow me everywhere you like!Follow development:http://ada-game.com/https://www.facebook.com/HazyGameDev/https://twitter.com/HazyGameDevhttps://www.instagram.com/hazygamedev/?hl=enhttps://hazygamedev.tumblr.com/PressKit Hi! My name is Jakub Hakiel. Ada is my precious project and it's been developed by me, myself and  I, which means that I'm a solo indie games developer. I'm an educated  programmer with experience as a software developer, math programmer,  engineer, scientist and more. It all made it possible for me to be able  to handle all the stuff from design to final product release. I believe  all the skills I aquired during my professional career are being used  while making Ada come true.Music for Ada is being masterfully put together by  amazing and talented hands of Bryan Nguyen. Whose work i encourage you  to check out! He's making music for movie trailers like Player Ready One or Bumblebee. https://soundcloud.com/therealghostinthemachinehttps://twitter.com/RobotsInTweets Risks and challengesAs you most likely know, developing a game is an ever-changing process. That means it's really hard to predict everything that we will run into.I'm working on Ada each and every day and I know I'll run into problems. I can assure you though that whatever will be happening I'll be 100% transparent and you will always be informed of any problems that might affect either your experience while playing game or the release date.

story:
Who Are We?

Tucson Game Developers is a group of game developers in Tucson, AZ. We are a passionate group of hobbyist and professional artists. Our mission is to grow gaming in Tucson, and to promote it as an art form. We host events, including the Global Game Jam and Ludum Dare. We will be hosting a booth in the gaming area of the Tucson Comic-Con showcasing some of the great games made here in Tucson.

Why Stickers?

Because stickers are a great, easy way for artists to promote their work. Making games is hard, but marketing your game can be even harder.

  • All of the money collected will be used to make stickers.
  • These are high quality stickers printed at StickerMule.
    • Approx 2-3" die-cut stickers.
    • Weatherproof, durable vinyl stickers.
    • Perfect for your car, your laptop, or repairing that crack in your sofa.
  • Even if we do not reach our goal we will be printing stickers. We'll just print whatever we can afford with the given amount of money donated.

What Do I Get?

I mean, this is a sticker drive, so you're going to get stickers :D. The higher the tier the more stickers. We are still taking submissions from artists, but we are expecting about 5-10 different designs available.

We'll be posting more information about the individual stickers and the games they belong to as the campaign progresses.

What Does TGD Get?

After all backers of the campaign have been given their rewards the rest of the stickers will be split between the individual artists and TGD. Artists can do whatever they like with their stickers, but chances are they are going to hand them out and sell them. TGD will use the stickers at our upcoming events as swag.

The Future Of Gaming

TGD works to promote these artists because we believe in games as an art form, and that these artists are the future of gaming.

  • TGD provides a place for us desert-dwellers to meet and learn about making games.
  • Shipping a game is hard. Its a small thing but having stickers helps make shipping these games more real. Every bit helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you're not necessarily the sticker type. That's cool. But perhaps you know somebody who's into games, and wants to support the future of gaming in Tucson.

  • Please share this campaign. Get the word out!

Thanks for your time!

story:
>> Watch an Alpha Game in your browser! <<

[ Watch replay and take control! ]

 



"The gameplay is fast and addictive and immediately makes you want to invite your friends to play for hours of fun."

"It’s a great time sink and breath of fresh air compared to RTS games that try to needlessly over-complicate their mechanics"

         - Indie Game Insider

"I’d strongly recommend this game to all strategists out there, 1) so they can enjoy the game and 2) so I have people to play against."

         - Thirteen1

"Pulling off a successful pincer movement is as satisfying as ever, and there's something oddly cathartic about watching a sea of enemy tanks meet your own resulting in a spectacular array of explosions"

         - Digitally Downloaded

"This is supposed to tell you if this game has got some potential. And I'm here to say it does, and it deserves your money to support."

         - RTS Guru

 

Conquer Mars is a multiplayer game of massive drone armies and cunning strategy designed with the goal of having a lot of fun whether you win or lose.

Win the game with the best strategy; outmaneuver your opponents with the best tactics, and convince the other players to fight each other instead of you.

All the unnecessary micro-management has been cut out. No hidden map or fog of war that demands tedious scouting. No placing of buildings and sentry towers. Build 20 units at a time for each mine you control, base-building limited to upgrades and defensive towers, and a gameplay focused on armies rather than individual units. It’s build and go!

This makes Conquer Mars more like a fast-paced game of Chess or Risk, but with 8 players and explosions.

  • Feel powerful when you beat your friends in massive 8 player battles

  • Insanity mode with thousands of units (example)

  • Play in seconds, under 7MB for the entire game including sound
    "Load times were indeed near nonexistent" - Eurogamer.dk

  • Share replays with instant online playback to boast of your victories

  • Awesome post-game graphs and analytics for your inner nerd (example)

 

 


We are a small, self-funded indie studio called Zero Blood Games with just two people, Jonas and Thomas, who are both programmers by profession and aspiring game designers.

Conquer Mars has been our passion for the past many months, and we have hired freelancers to create quality art for the game and enlisted friends and family to help in any way possible to make Conquer Mars a reality.

To power Conquer Mars we have created our own 3D multiplayer game engine from scratch, implemented most of the gameplay and are well on our way to prove that we can pull off an ambitious project like this.

We have previously worked on big government and corporate projects, but we have always dreamed of making awesome games - and we hope that dream can come true with Conquer Mars.

This is a flexible funding campaign because we have already invested so much time and money in Conquer Mars that we will definitely release it - but the result of this campaign means a lot for how great the final game will be.

So please help spread the word and make Conquer Mars all it can be :)

 

 

A Giant Leap for Mankind

In the early 2000s, discord and random acts of war and terror stole the headlines of newspapers and the minds of politicians. The first response was war, surveillance and suspicion, but results were meagre and indecisive. After a few decades, a series of financial meltdowns and several minor wars, the governments of the world were ready for a previously unseen level of cooperation. The Earth Assembly was formed in 2032 and under a transnational leadership the countries of the world saw peace and prosperity.

The force of this cooperative effort was too large for one planet and the nations formed the Solar Consortium in 2037. The Solar Consortium coordinated the fledgling space mining industries of the individual nations into a large, effective mining consortium. It built infrastructure and ensured effective tech and knowledge sharing, creating a massive mining operation that spanned moons, asteroids and the planet of Mars. Rare metals and minerals soon flowed to earth.

The Solar Consortium grew and expanded mining operations across the solar system, but on earth the Earth Assembly slowly deteriorated and it finally fell apart in 2068. Turmoil and wars claimed the attention and resources of the Earth nations once again and without the support and leadership from the Earth Assembly, the Solar Consortium fell apart as well.

By 2068 half a million people were living in space, and they had no intention of returning to Earth. Their homes were the capital control ships, colonies, mining squads and beam transporters that were built for the mining effort and the distribution of resources. No nation on Earth had the resources to claim the space mining corporations for their own and as the supply of metals and minerals was largely uninterrupted, they saw no need.

7 years after Solar Consortium disintegrated, they are still there, mining. On Mars the competition for the best mines is fierce. Rival corporations and rogue mining gangs fight over the mining facilities using droids and AI-controlled war machines, claiming the resources mined and beaming them to the Capital Control ships that remain the neutral backbone of the space mining infrastructure. Welcome to 2075. Welcome to Mars.

  

Premium membership

The premium membership has three main benefits:

  • You earn game credits at 3x the speed of a free player, enabling you to unlock units and upgrades faster

  • You get to build a greater variety of units in the game

  • You can chat in public games

Alpha access

You get instant Alpha Access to play Conquer Mars when you support us!
The game will be ready for hours of fun but the game will still have missing features. However, you will be able to provide valuable feedback to the developers to help shape the game.

Starts: Instant (We send a key to your email within 8 hours) 
Duration: 1-3 months.

Beta access

When Conquer Mars has all the essential features completed we will open up for beta access. The game will be more complete but you can still provide feedback and help shape the game in its final phase.

When the game nears completion we will slowly open up for all alpha/beta players to invite new players to the game until Conquer Mars is ready for everyone.

Starts: When the Alpha ends.
Duration: 2-3 months.

Own the game / Instant unlocking of current and future units

You can unlock units either by paying with real money or in-game credits, but with instant unlocking you don’t have to spend anything on new units as they will be available to you as soon as we make them.

Everything that affects the gameplay will be immediately available to you - always. This is why it's called "own the game" :)

This doesn’t mean your hard earned in-game credits are useless though. We plan to make different visual upgrades and other things that don’t affect the gameplay which you can then spend your in-game credits on.

Special badges

All players will have a badge associated with them, both in the lobby and in the game. We will probably even display them in 3D on the mines you control in the game. The special badges that you get here can only be obtained from this Indiegogo campaign.




 

Wages

Conquer Mars is designed and programmed by two people (Jonas and Thomas), and we really want to dedicate all our time to releasing the best possible game.

Freelancers

Most of the art is created by talented freelancers. This includes the 3D models, sound, music, and concept art.

Servers

Conquer Mars is an online multiplayer game at heart, so there always has to be servers available for you to play on. Making sure the servers can run 24x7 is what the premium membership helps pay for.

Dreaming big

Our dreams for Conquer Mars aren’t limited to what you see in this campaign. We’re just trying to be realistic. With enough support we would love to expand the story in the universe and create a campaign. We also want to make a version of Conquer Mars for tablets which we intend to make free for backers - but we only want to promise the things we know we can deliver.

 

Everything in this list will be delivered if we reach the $100.000 goal.

  • Intelligent AI
    We have a basic AI in Conquer Mars that is quite fun for beginners. But we need a much smarter AI that can play at all levels, utilize all units intelligently, use missiles and avoid them, defend or attack on multiple fronts and so on.
  • Map editor
    All the maps in Conquer Mars are currently auto-generated. This gives a nice variation, but it will be great to have player designed maps to play on.
  • More units
    We already have models and textures ready for two new units: Attack buggy and The Pincer. With your support we hope to supply a steady stream of cool new units for you to play.
  • Replay and sharing
    You know that awesome game where you were a total underdog, but still beat 7 other players with cunning and manipulation in a huge final battle? We have prototype functionality ready so you can replay that game, but we want to make a polished replay system for sharing online and even embed on your own website or blog.
  • High scores, achievements, profiles, badges
    You need to be able to customize your profile, select a badge to represent your style, get achievements for destroying the armies of your enemies and claim your spot on the high score charts.
  • Friends list
    Add your friends, invite them to games or send them chat messages. When spectator mode is available you can also follow your friends and follow the games they play.
  • Ranking and matchmaking
    Unlike many other games, Conquer Mars can still be a lot of fun when playing against players better than you. But it’s still better to be matched against players at roughly your level, so we need a ranking and matchmaking system to make sure you get the most fun out of playing. 
    We also want to make a handicap system, so you can make games where players of different skill are automatically handicapped to give everyone a fair chance.
  • Gameplay features
    The gameplay in Conquer Mars works really well but there is still more to do. For example, we want you to be able to influence your fellow players by telling them to focus on a player who is starting to dominate. You may also have an idea for a great and necessary feature that we just have to get in the game before it’s released. Let us know!
  • Balance and polish
    Making Conquer Mars is a huge project just to make the basic 3D, multiplayer and gameplay. But it’s not worth much if the gameplay is unbalanced or there are too many bugs. We’re good at making bugfree and polished software, but it’s still a very time consuming process.

 

  

If you think Conquer Mars looks promising then please follow us on Twitter or like us on Facebook.

To motivate you a bit we are promising two cool features that we will implement if we reach our goals.

1000 followers on Twitter: Spectator mode

Spectator mode is where others can watch games live without themselves playing it. This is great for making your small tournaments among friends, or simply watching how the best players play and follow them live.

1000 likes on Facebook: Team Play

The only play mode in Conquer Mars right now is free for all, where you compete against all the other players at once. With team play modes you can make 3v3, 2v2v2v2 games or any other combination that you want.

$125.000: Offline play

Although Conquer Mars is an online multiplayer game at heart, it is still a lot of fun to play against just the AI. We will create an installable version of Conquer Mars where you can play against the AI when you are disconnected from the internet.

$150.000: Tournaments

Conquer Mars is perfect for making tournaments where spectators can watch the games live as they unfold. We will build the tools to host tournaments and we will also make it possible for you to arrange your own private tournaments in Conquer Mars.

We also want to make it possible for you to embed Conquer Mars on your own website, if you want to build a special community or host a tournament. As long as people are playing Conquer Mars and nobody is trying something sleazy, we’re open to anything.

Possible future stretch goals

16+ player modes

Multiview desktop version

Tablet version

Level editor + Custom models for units

Campaign


  

Several extremely talented freelancers helped bring Conquer Mars to where it is today.

3D models and textures

Daniel McCarthy: http://www.danielmccarthycgartist.com/

Daniel has been working on Conquer Mars from the start, creating all the awesome models and textures you experience in the game. Not surprisingly, The Creative Assembly recently hired Daniel to work full time on the Total War series.

This also means we need someone to help us create the next wave of Conquer Mars units. If you (or someone you know) can make great low-poly 3D models and texture them to fit with the current quality and style, then please send us an email at contact@conquermars.com

Sound effects

Tapio Liukkonen: http://www.kaamossound.com/

Tapio is an award winning sound designer who has worked on games like Amnesia, Overgrowth, and Xenonauts. He creates many of his sounds from real sources deep in the Finnish woods to build an immersive and powerful soundscape for the battles on Mars.

Music

Mikko Tarmia: http://www.mikkotarmia.com/

Mikko is an award winning composer who has made music for games like Amnesia, Overgrowth, and Penumbra. Mixing the classical with the electronic, Mikko makes great music that really sets the mood for Conquer Mars.

For Conquer Mars, Mikko has helped create a dynamic music system where the game engine fades layers of music in and out to fit the level of action you are experiencing.

Story and universe creation

Lars Vilhelmsen: http://larsvilhelmsen.dk/

Lars is a talented writer with a passion for games. Lars is working with us to create a believable and fascinating universe for Conquer Mars, which goes far beyond the current Martian dirtside action.

Trailer

Pachin Ivan: info@sip-studio.pro

Promotional art pieces

Dennis Björk: http://fruktsallad.deviantart.com/

Andrey Egorov: http://egorov-andr-x.blogspot.com/

 

Game engine

To power Conquer Mars we have built our own game engine in ActionScript 3 for Flash and Stage3D. The engine is specifically built to handle thousands of units in a 3D multiplayer setting.

Handling lots of units means that many things have to be simpler, but we prefer to have very large armies of simple units rather than small detailed armies.

Runs in your browser

Conquer Mars is a Flash-based browser game, and it's optimized to be as small as possible. The entire game with models, textures, and sounds is under 7MB! The music streams in after the game has loaded.

The small size means that the game loads in seconds the first time, and your browser caches the game and then loads instantly the next time you want to play.

Multiplayer tech

Conquer Mars is powered by Player.IO, a multiplayer game service recently acquired by Yahoo! We have worked with Chris and Oliver, the founders of Player.IO, to make the multiplayer in Conquer Mars close to flawless.



Platforms: Windows + Mac + (Maybe?) Linux

Conquer Mars is made in Flash, and is fully supported on all PC & Mac computers that support the latest Flash with Stage3D.

This means all versions of Google Chrome, Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari, Opera - as long as you have the latest Flash.

You can go to www.conquermars.com - If the website loads without any warnings you should be good to go.

Linux support: We don’t have a Linux box available with 3D graphics to test this ourselves. If you have Chrome running on Linux with 3D support and you want to help please send us an email at contact@conquermars.com.

Update: Looks like it does work on Linux! 
http://www.gamingonlinux.com/articles/the-funding-crowd-12-july-23th-30th.2213/page=2

Get ’em before your friends! ;)

Mars Orbit

- By Dennis Björk

1024x768 | 1280x800 | 1280x1024 | 1366x768 | 1600x900 | 1680x1050
1920x1080 | 1920x1200 | 2560x1440 | 2560x1600 | Full size

 

Mars Battle

- By Andrey Egorov

1024x768 | 1280x800 | 1280x1024 | 1366x768 | 1600x900 | 1680x1050
1920x1080 | 1920x1200 | 2560x1440 | 2560x1600 | Full size

 

Trailer

Link to the trailer with in-game footage


Contact

contact@conquermars.com

Starts: When the Alpha ends.Duration: 2-3 months.
Own the game / Instant unlocking of current and future units
You can unlock units either by paying with real money or in-game credits, but with instant unlocking you don’t have to spend anything on new units as they will be available to you as soon as we make them.
Everything that affects the gameplay will be immediately available to you - always. This is why it's called "own the game" :)
This doesn’t mean your hard earned in-game credits are useless though. We plan to make different visual upgrades and other things that don’t affect the gameplay which you can then spend your in-game credits on.
Special badges
All players will have a badge associated with them, both in the lobby and in the game. We will probably even display them in 3D on the mines you control in the game. The special badges that you get here can only be obtained from this Indiegogo campaign.




 
Wages
Conquer Mars is designed and programmed by two people (Jonas and Thomas), and we really want to dedicate all our time to releasing the best possible game.
Freelancers
Most of the art is created by talented freelancers. This includes the 3D models, sound, music, and concept art.
Servers
Conquer Mars is an online multiplayer game at heart, so there always has to be servers available for you to play on. Making sure the servers can run 24x7 is what the premium membership helps pay for.
Dreaming big
Our dreams for Conquer Mars aren’t limited to what you see in this campaign. We’re just trying to be realistic. With enough support we would love to expand the story in the universe and create a campaign. We also want to make a version of Conquer Mars for tablets which we intend to make free for backers - but we only want to promise the things we know we can deliver.
 

Everything in this list will be delivered if we reach the $100.000 goal.


Intelligent AI We have a basic AI in Conquer Mars that is quite fun for beginners. But we need a much smarter AI that can play at all levels, utilize all units intelligently, use missiles and avoid them, defend or attack on multiple fronts and so on.

Map editor All the maps in Conquer Mars are currently auto-generated. This gives a nice variation, but it will be great to have player designed maps to play on.

More units We already have models and textures ready for two new units: Attack buggy and The Pincer. With your support we hope to supply a steady stream of cool new units for you to play.

Replay and sharing You know that awesome game where you were a total underdog, but still beat 7 other players with cunning and manipulation in a huge final battle? We have prototype functionality ready so you can replay that game, but we want to make a polished replay system for sharing online and even embed on your own website or blog.

High scores, achievements, profiles, badges You need to be able to customize your profile, select a badge to represent your style, get achievements for destroying the armies of your enemies and claim your spot on the high score charts.

Friends list Add your friends, invite them to games or send them chat messages. When spectator mode is available you can also follow your friends and follow the games they play.

Ranking and matchmaking Unlike many other games, Conquer Mars can still be a lot of fun when playing against players better than you. But it’s still better to be matched against players at roughly your level, so we need a ranking and matchmaking system to make sure you get the most fun out of playing.  We also want to make a handicap system, so you can make games where players of different skill are automatically handicapped to give everyone a fair chance.

Gameplay features The gameplay in Conquer Mars works really well but there is still more to do. For example, we want you to be able to influence your fellow players by telling them to focus on a player who is starting to dominate. You may also have an idea for a great and necessary feature that we just have to get in the game before it’s released. Let us know!

Balance and polishMaking Conquer Mars is a huge project just to make the basic 3D, multiplayer and gameplay. But it’s not worth much if the gameplay is unbalanced or there are too many bugs. We’re good at making bugfree and polished software, but it’s still a very time consuming process.

 
  
If you think Conquer Mars looks promising then please follow us on Twitter or like us on Facebook.
To motivate you a bit we are promising two cool features that we will implement if we reach our goals.
1000 followers on Twitter: Spectator mode
Spectator mode is where others can watch games live without themselves playing it. This is great for making your small tournaments among friends, or simply watching how the best players play and follow them live.
1000 likes on Facebook: Team Play
The only play mode in Conquer Mars right now is free for all, where you compete against all the other players at once. With team play modes you can make 3v3, 2v2v2v2 games or any other combination that you want.

$125.000: Offline play
Although Conquer Mars is an online multiplayer game at heart, it is still a lot of fun to play against just the AI. We will create an installable version of Conquer Mars where you can play against the AI when you are disconnected from the internet.
$150.000: Tournaments
Conquer Mars is perfect for making tournaments where spectators can watch the games live as they unfold. We will build the tools to host tournaments and we will also make it possible for you to arrange your own private tournaments in Conquer Mars.
We also want to make it possible for you to embed Conquer Mars on your own website, if you want to build a special community or host a tournament. As long as people are playing Conquer Mars and nobody is trying something sleazy, we’re open to anything.
Possible future stretch goals
16+ player modes
Multiview desktop version
Tablet version
Level editor + Custom models for units
Campaign

  

Several extremely talented freelancers helped bring Conquer Mars to where it is today.
3D models and textures
Daniel McCarthy: http://www.danielmccarthycgartist.com/
Daniel has been working on Conquer Mars from the start, creating all the awesome models and textures you experience in the game. Not surprisingly, The Creative Assembly recently hired Daniel to work full time on the Total War series.
This also means we need someone to help us create the next wave of Conquer Mars units. If you (or someone you know) can make great low-poly 3D models and texture them to fit with the current quality and style, then please send us an email at contact@conquermars.com
Sound effects
Tapio Liukkonen: http://www.kaamossound.com/
Tapio is an award winning sound designer who has worked on games like Amnesia, Overgrowth, and Xenonauts. He creates many of his sounds from real sources deep in the Finnish woods to build an immersive and powerful soundscape for the battles on Mars.
Music
Mikko Tarmia: http://www.mikkotarmia.com/
Mikko is an award winning composer who has made music for games like Amnesia, Overgrowth, and Penumbra. Mixing the classical with the electronic, Mikko makes great music that really sets the mood for Conquer Mars.
For Conquer Mars, Mikko has helped create a dynamic music system where the game engine fades layers of music in and out to fit the level of action you are experiencing.
Story and universe creation
Lars Vilhelmsen: http://larsvilhelmsen.dk/
Lars is a talented writer with a passion for games. Lars is working with us to create a believable and fascinating universe for Conquer Mars, which goes far beyond the current Martian dirtside action.
Trailer
Pachin Ivan: info@sip-studio.pro
Promotional art pieces
Dennis Björk: http://fruktsallad.deviantart.com/
Andrey Egorov: http://egorov-andr-x.blogspot.com/

 

Game engine
To power Conquer Mars we have built our own game engine in ActionScript 3 for Flash and Stage3D. The engine is specifically built to handle thousands of units in a 3D multiplayer setting.
Handling lots of units means that many things have to be simpler, but we prefer to have very large armies of simple units rather than small detailed armies.
Runs in your browser
Conquer Mars is a Flash-based browser game, and it's optimized to be as small as possible. The entire game with models, textures, and sounds is under 7MB! The music streams in after the game has loaded.
The small size means that the game loads in seconds the first time, and your browser caches the game and then loads instantly the next time you want to play.
Multiplayer tech
Conquer Mars is powered by Player.IO, a multiplayer game service recently acquired by Yahoo! We have worked with Chris and Oliver, the founders of Player.IO, to make the multiplayer in Conquer Mars close to flawless.

Platforms: Windows + Mac + (Maybe?) Linux

Conquer Mars is made in Flash, and is fully supported on all PC & Mac computers that support the latest Flash with Stage3D.
This means all versions of Google Chrome, Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari, Opera - as long as you have the latest Flash.
You can go to www.conquermars.com - If the website loads without any warnings you should be good to go.
Linux support: We don’t have a Linux box available with 3D graphics to test this ourselves. If you have Chrome running on Linux with 3D support and you want to help please send us an email at contact@conquermars.com.
Update: Looks like it does work on Linux! http://www.gamingonlinux.com/articles/the-funding-crowd-12-july-23th-30th.2213/page=2


Get ’em before your friends! ;)
Mars Orbit

- By Dennis Björk
1024x768 | 1280x800 | 1280x1024 | 1366x768 | 1600x900 | 1680x10501920x1080 | 1920x1200 | 2560x1440 | 2560x1600 | Full size
 
Mars Battle

- By Andrey Egorov
1024x768 | 1280x800 | 1280x1024 | 1366x768 | 1600x900 | 1680x10501920x1080 | 1920x1200 | 2560x1440 | 2560x1600 | Full size
 
Trailer
Link to the trailer with in-game footage

Contact
contact@conquermars.com

story:
LudoRudo is an epic twist of the classic Ludo in the West, also famously known as the 'Aeroplane Chess' in the East. And yes, there are PANDAS!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Digital Version of Ludo Rudo on FACEBOOK

( Ready on the SAME DAY as Christmas 2015 ! )

Game Modes

  • Practice: Practice with 3 AI Players
  • Multi-Player: Play with Family and Friends
  • Rush: When a game lasts more than 20 minutes, Players cannot plant Mines, and are able to enter Goal without reversing.

Mines

Targeted Mines

Ability to destroy any unit of the SELECTED colour.

Ultimate Landmine

Ability to destroy any unit of ANY colour.


Features

Attacking

Attacking on Bridge

Soldier Jumping

Conveyor Belt Movement

Destroyed by Mine

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

LudoRudo is a retro game which is love for its simplicity and its casual gameplay to bring fun for the family. Through the use of dice, LudoRudo brings enough luck factor into the game to keep players on their toes at all times. Players need to face situation which requires strategic decision on making the right choice of unit during their turn to their advantage. Would you progress your Soldier that is nearing the goal, or would you attempt to bring that Tank unit at the starting point forward or to sabotage others progress?

The Story

In ancient China, there existed a magical place where highly intelligent pandas lived in secrecy. In all their cuteness, they were constantly waging war among each other in a bid to claim the legendary Panda Castle for their own - a fortress that encompasses the sweetest bamboo forest in all the lands.

In LudoRudo, you become one of the four feuding panda families with 2 Soldiers, a Mini-Tank and a Tank. By cleverly planting mines and choosing which unit to activate each turn, you will attempt to bring all your members into the castle in the middle of the board.

Components of the Board Game

  • 1 Game Board
  • 2 Dice (6-Sided)
  • 8 Panda Soldiers
  • 4 Panda Mini Tanks
  • 4 Panda Tanks
  • 25 Mine Tokens (5 Types)

How To Play LudoRudo?

1. Reach the goal at the center first! Units move in a clockwise direction!

2. Click on the dice to throw! Select Unit and click GO!!

3. Plant mines when the button lights up!

Player Units


Attacks: Soldier
Magic Numbers: 2, 4, 6
Stack: Unable to Stack
Conveyor Belt: Yes
Skills: Plants ultimate landmine when rolled a double six. Jumps to next own color tile if landed on own colour tile.

Attacks: Soldier, Mini Tank
Magic Numbers: 4, 6
Stack: Carries 1 Soldier
Conveyor Belt: Yes
Skills: None

Attacks: All Units
Magic Number: 6
Stack: Carries 2 Soldiers and 1 Mini Tank.
Conveyor Belt: No
Skills: None
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ONE Game TWO Platform

For every copy of the physical board game ( Board Game version will arrive on the June Vacation Break of 2016 ! ) LudoRudo, you can opt to also buy the fully functional digital version of it which can be played online with others who also own the game! ( Digital version is Same Day Delivery on Christmas Day on 2015 ! ) We want to get this fun and casual game out into the hands of as many friends and families as possible! Therefore, we are offering the game to you at an awesome price!

( Physical prototype showcased during Casual Connect Asia, May 2015. Prototype shown is not representative of the actual product's material. Ready by June 2016 )

3D-Printed Accessories

Our studio is printing out the 3D-Printed Components, Parts and Accessories for Ludo Rudo. Below is our first prototype version and final version will come in 4 different colors of Red, Blue, Green, Yellow  

All components comes in solid black, which you can paint to your own customization! (Image is not representative of the actual product)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stretch Goals

Our Stretch Goal is the digitization of the board game in mobile form, specifically Android. And if there is a double delights, we will make it for iOS too! If we meet that goal, we will try to make it happen!

(Image is not representative of the actual product)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Risks & Challenges

Digital Version // We have already completed the Digital version to get it Ready on the SAME DAY as Christmas! Perfect for your love ones, and family joy or simply forward the email with access codes as Digital Gift !

Board Game Version // We are working with a top toy manufacturer with an impeccable track record in both quality and delivery, who also produces quality board games for Hasbro and Mattel. For shipping, we have partnered ourselves with an experienced fulfillment company that specializes in handling shipping for crowdfunding campaigns recommended by the manufacturer.


Other Ways You Can Help

So you have found us! Congratulations on discovering a wholesome present that offers a large packet of fun for a small token of cash. However, we need all the help we can get to make this game a reality! Do help to spread the word for us on this epic find to your friends and relatives! The more we get funded, the faster we can get this game out to your table and your computer!


Credits - Development Team

Creator

  • Chong Lai
PR & Marketing
  • Morris Seng
Artists & Programmers
  • Marcus Lim
  • Keniver Woo
  • Jack Ng
  • Kang Eileen
  • Lim Jing Xuan
  • Lim Jun Jie
  • Ang Fu Yi
  • Zeng Huiying

The more we get funded, the faster we can get this game out to your table and your computer!

story:
INTRODUCING THE NACON ALPHA PAD

A New Way to Win in PC eSports

Professional video gaming has experienced an astronomical rise in popularity over the last five years. However many PC eSports enthusiasts, particularly those with console gaming backgrounds, are discouraged from entering competitions due to the lack of a gamepad that can challenge the success of keyboard and mouse control.

Having already developed a reputation for producing innovative PC gaming accessories, NACON’s latest pioneering product is set to change that.

 

 

Weitere Infos zum Projekt in deutscher Sprache finden Sie hier:

http://nacongaming.com/de/gc400es-project/

  

N'hésitez pas à découvrir le projet en français en vous rendant sur: 

http://nacongaming.com/fr/gc400es-project/

Non esitate a scoprire il progetto in italiano al seguente link:

http://nacongaming.com/it/gc400es-project/

 

 

 

 

  

No dudes en revisar el proyecto en tu propio idioma en :

 

http://nacongaming.com/es/gc400es-project/

 

 

 

 

 

The Alpha Pad is a PC controller capable of elite-level performance across all gaming genres. The world’s first eSports-ready gamepad, it offers the ergonomic and intuitive movement control benefits of a controller and the precision and customisability of a mouse and keyboard.

Developed with the help of world champion pro-gamer Norman “GEN1US” Chatrier and the French eSports Academy, the Alpha Pad has been put through its paces by top professional players. With its unique abilities and affordable price point, it offers PC gamers a whole new way to take part in eSports.

 

 

 

Before we can get the Alpha Pad into the hands of professional PC gamers and aspiring eSports competitors, we need your support to make it a reality. In exchange for helping us reach our campaign target of $30,000 USD, we’re offering a variety of perks, including the chance to own a limited-edition Alpha Pad and to receive money off the purchase price.

So if you’re one of the army of PC gamers out there looking for an easier way to get into eSports, we invite you to join the huge community already supporting the Alpha Pad’s creation. By backing this campaign, you’ll be helping us create a product that will alter the landscape of professional PC gaming. Thank you! 

 

 

 

The Alpha Pad has been created to offer the comfort, analog movement and portability of a gamepad, the precision of a mouse and the customisability of a keyboard.

The Alpha Pad’s ergonomic design and intuitive control layout have been painstakingly crafted to provide the optimum user experience, even over extensive and challenging periods of use.

The use of special materials ensures maximum grip while a series of removable weights in its handgrips ensure the pad sits comfortably in any hand.

 

 

 

 

 

The digital movement controls offered by keyboards have never been a match for the analog control of a gamepad’s left stick, but pro gamers have traditionally preferred the aiming accuracy of a mouse.

Boasting an amplitude of 46 degrees, compared to the 38 degrees offered by most controllers, the Alpha Pad’s ultra-sensitive right stick offers the pinpoint precision of a gaming mouse.

 

Meanwhile, larger action buttons ensure complete control and a specially-designed, thumb-friendly directional pad is perfect for nailing complex combo chains.

 

 

 

Compatible with all PC games, the Alpha Pad offers two modes aimed at different playing abilities. Its upgradeable onboard memory, which can hold up to four separate profiles, will ensure it stays at the cutting edge as PC gaming evolves.

 

Designed for intermediate gamers, Classic Mode offers up direct and X input modes. Engaging Pro-Gamer Mode, offers up to four preset profiles tailor-made for specific genres and games meanwhile, elevates the Alpha Pad’s performance potential to the elite level, allowing it to excel in every genre, from first-person shooters like Counter-Strike to multiplayer online battle arena titles like League of Legends and real-time strategy games like StarCraft. Aimed at professional players, this mode allows users to customise profiles to produce  a truly personalised setup. 

Featuring four extra buttons, the fully-programmable Alpha Pad can easily adapt to all preferences. It can even directly emulate a keyboard (buttons and left stick) and mouse (right stick and shoulder buttons).

 

 

The Alpha Pad’s onboard memory contains up to four profiles with a software installation required to modify the settings.  Once your controller is configured, thanks to the dedicated software you can bring it with you, meaning you can travel, plug, play and keep on winning.

Wired for extra accuracy, the Alpha Pad’s durable braided cable features a robust metal connector that can be quickly detached for transportation.

Easy to fit into its included travel pouch, the Alpha Pad beats a bulky keyboard and mouse combination when on the move.

 

 

 

 

 

Benefiting from an extensive development process and input from both the French eSports Academy and world champion professional video gamer Norman “GEN1US” Chatrier, the Alpha Pad has generated a great deal of interest amongst eSports enthusiasts.  But how did the project get started?

The notion of a high-end controller aimed at the keyboard-and-mouse-dominated PC eSports market isn’t a new one. Gamers and eSports enthusiasts – especially those with console gaming backgrounds – have been calling for a new way to take part in professional PC gaming for many years.

After fielding a huge number of requests from frustrated gamers amongst the vibrant community that had grown around its groundbreaking PC gaming products, NACON decided to take on the challenge.

 

To make it truly competitive at the elite level of PC gaming, the new gamepad would require software and hardware innovations never before seen in a controller. Its right stick would have to mirror the manoeuvrability of a gaming mouse and its button layout would have to offer the flexibility of a keyboard.

 

 

After developing a series of early prototypes, NACON entered discussions with the French eSports Academy and enlisted the help of respected pro-gamer, GEN1US. The early tests were promising and what was to become known as the “Alpha Pad” began to generate a great deal of interest amongst gamers. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The final prototypes were produced in January 2016 and, with your support, we will be able to begin production in anticipation of shipping the Alpha Pad towards the end of the year.

 

 

 

 

At NACON our mission is to create tools that turn players into gamers. Passionate about their work , our young and innovative team of designers and engineers enjoy close links with the professional gaming community, and it’s the valuable feedback of pro gamers around the world that has allowed us to bring a succession of pioneering  products and accessories – including gaming mice, keyboards, gamepads, USB hubs and headsets – to the market since 2014.

Here are some of the key names behind the creation of our most requested product, the Alpha Pad:

 

 

 

 

 

Help us promote our campaign by referring as many friends as you can to our Indiegogo page. The first 50 referees to generate 699 or more visits to our page will receive a black Alpha Pad completely free of charge.

How to Participate

1.  Login to Indiegogo.

2.  Copy your unique URL link and share it with your friends via social media, email or your blog or website.

3.  Check your Referral Status through your Indiegogo profile.

For more information about Indiegogo referral contests, click here.

 

 

 

 

We have a working prototype of the Alpha Pad ready to go. We just need your help to take the next step.

We will use the first $30,000 USD raised to fund the initial production run (53%), contribute to the cost of tooling (12%), pay Indiegogo and payment fees (10%) and meet marketing and admin costs (25%).

 

 

 

 

Why is the Alpha Pad wired?

The Alpha Pad is wired for extra accuracy. Its durable braided cable features a robust metal connector that can be quickly detached for transportation.

Could I access to the project in different languages?

 Do not hesitate to check the project in your own language at: http://nacongaming.com/gc400es-project/ 
No dudes en revisar el proyecto en tu propio idioma en :

http://nacongaming.com/es/gc400es-project/

N'hésitez pas à découvrir le projet en français en vous rendant sur: 

http://nacongaming.com/fr/gc400es-project/

Non esitate a consultare il progetto nella propria lingua a:

http://nacongaming.com/it/gc400es-project/

Zögern Sie nicht, das Projekt in Ihrer eigenen Sprache zu überprüfen, um:

http://nacongaming.com/de/gc400es-project/

Is it compatible with Windows 10?

The Alpha Pad is fully compatible with Windows 7, 8 and 10.

Is it compatible with all PC games?

Yes, the Alpha Pad is compatible with every PC game. It has been designed to offer the optimum performance across all gaming genres.

Can the Alpha Pad truly perform in gaming genres, like MOBAs, that are usually only suited to mice and keyboards?

Yes. The NACON team have worked closely with the French eSports Academy, world champion gamer Norman “GEN1US” Chatrier and the professional PC gaming community to ensure the Alpha Pad is competitive across all genres.

How can I protect my Alpha Pad when I am not using it?

The Alpha Pad comes with a fabric travel pouch.

Will it work the xbox one as it runs on Windows 10?

No only on WINDOWS PC, for XBOX ONE compatibility you need to have the license of Microsoft ( security chipset )

When will the Alpha Pad be available?

We are aiming to ship the Alpha Pad in September 2016. However this date is subject to change and we will keep everyone who has ordered one updated.

What’s the retail price?

The Alpha Pad’s recommended retail price is set to be €99 (including VAT), £60 (including VAT) and $89.99 USD (not including taxes). However you can purchase it at a significant discount by selecting one of the above perks.

Will you ship internationally?

At launch we will ship to Canada, the European Union and the United States. If you live elsewhere, please contact us and we will find a shipping solution for your location.

What is the cost of shipping?

Shipping costs will vary depending on your location. Check out our perks to see how you can get your Alpha Pad shipped to Canada, the European Union and the United States for free.
