INTRODUCING THE NACON ALPHA PADA New Way to Win in PC eSportsProfessional video gaming has experienced an astronomical rise in popularity over the last five years. However many PC eSports enthusiasts, particularly those with console gaming backgrounds, are discouraged from entering competitions due to the lack of a gamepad that can challenge the success of keyboard and mouse control.Having already developed a reputation for producing innovative PC gaming accessories, NACON’s latest pioneering product is set to change that.  Weitere Infos zum Projekt in deutscher Sprache finden Sie hier:http://nacongaming.com/de/gc400es-project/  N'hésitez pas à découvrir le projet en français en vous rendant sur: http://nacongaming.com/fr/gc400es-project/Non esitate a scoprire il progetto in italiano al seguente link:http://nacongaming.com/it/gc400es-project/      No dudes en revisar el proyecto en tu propio idioma en : http://nacongaming.com/es/gc400es-project/     The Alpha Pad is a PC controller capable of elite-level performance across all gaming genres. The world’s first eSports-ready gamepad, it offers the ergonomic and intuitive movement control benefits of a controller and the precision and customisability of a mouse and keyboard.Developed with the help of world champion pro-gamer Norman “GEN1US” Chatrier and the French eSports Academy, the Alpha Pad has been put through its paces by top professional players. With its unique abilities and affordable price point, it offers PC gamers a whole new way to take part in eSports.  
 

Before we can get the Alpha Pad into the hands of professional PC gamers and aspiring eSports competitors, we need your support to make it a reality. In exchange for helping us reach our campaign target of $30,000 USD, we’re offering a variety of perks, including the chance to own a limited-edition Alpha Pad and to receive money off the purchase price.
So if you’re one of the army of PC gamers out there looking for an easier way to get into eSports, we invite you to join the huge community already supporting the Alpha Pad’s creation. By backing this campaign, you’ll be helping us create a product that will alter the landscape of professional PC gaming. Thank you! 

 
 

 
The Alpha Pad has been created to offer the comfort, analog movement and portability of a gamepad, the precision of a mouse and the customisability of a keyboard.

The Alpha Pad’s ergonomic design and intuitive control layout have been painstakingly crafted to provide the optimum user experience, even over extensive and challenging periods of use.
The use of special materials ensures maximum grip while a series of removable weights in its handgrips ensure the pad sits comfortably in any hand.
 
 
 
  

The digital movement controls offered by keyboards have never been a match for the analog control of a gamepad’s left stick, but pro gamers have traditionally preferred the aiming accuracy of a mouse.
Boasting an amplitude of 46 degrees, compared to the 38 degrees offered by most controllers, the Alpha Pad’s ultra-sensitive right stick offers the pinpoint precision of a gaming mouse.
 
Meanwhile, larger action buttons ensure complete control and a specially-designed, thumb-friendly directional pad is perfect for nailing complex combo chains.
 
 

 


Compatible with all PC games, the Alpha Pad offers two modes aimed at different playing abilities. Its upgradeable onboard memory, which can hold up to four separate profiles, will ensure it stays at the cutting edge as PC gaming evolves.
 
Designed for intermediate gamers, Classic Mode offers up direct and X input modes. Engaging Pro-Gamer Mode, offers up to four preset profiles tailor-made for specific genres and games meanwhile, elevates the Alpha Pad’s performance potential to the elite level, allowing it to excel in every genre, from first-person shooters like Counter-Strike to multiplayer online battle arena titles like League of Legends and real-time strategy games like StarCraft. Aimed at professional players, this mode allows users to customise profiles to produce  a truly personalised setup. 
Featuring four extra buttons, the fully-programmable Alpha Pad can easily adapt to all preferences. It can even directly emulate a keyboard (buttons and left stick) and mouse (right stick and shoulder buttons).
 

 
The Alpha Pad’s onboard memory contains up to four profiles with a software installation required to modify the settings.  Once your controller is configured, thanks to the dedicated software you can bring it with you, meaning you can travel, plug, play and keep on winning.
Wired for extra accuracy, the Alpha Pad’s durable braided cable features a robust metal connector that can be quickly detached for transportation.
Easy to fit into its included travel pouch, the Alpha Pad beats a bulky keyboard and mouse combination when on the move.
 
  
 
 

Benefiting from an extensive development process and input from both the French eSports Academy and world champion professional video gamer Norman “GEN1US” Chatrier, the Alpha Pad has generated a great deal of interest amongst eSports enthusiasts.  But how did the project get started?
The notion of a high-end controller aimed at the keyboard-and-mouse-dominated PC eSports market isn’t a new one. Gamers and eSports enthusiasts – especially those with console gaming backgrounds – have been calling for a new way to take part in professional PC gaming for many years.
After fielding a huge number of requests from frustrated gamers amongst the vibrant community that had grown around its groundbreaking PC gaming products, NACON decided to take on the challenge.
 

To make it truly competitive at the elite level of PC gaming, the new gamepad would require software and hardware innovations never before seen in a controller. Its right stick would have to mirror the manoeuvrability of a gaming mouse and its button layout would have to offer the flexibility of a keyboard.

 
 

After developing a series of early prototypes, NACON entered discussions with the French eSports Academy and enlisted the help of respected pro-gamer, GEN1US. The early tests were promising and what was to become known as the “Alpha Pad” began to generate a great deal of interest amongst gamers. 

 

 

 
 
 


 
The final prototypes were produced in January 2016 and, with your support, we will be able to begin production in anticipation of shipping the Alpha Pad towards the end of the year.

 



 
 
 At NACON our mission is to create tools that turn players into gamers. Passionate about their work , our young and innovative team of designers and engineers enjoy close links with the professional gaming community, and it’s the valuable feedback of pro gamers around the world that has allowed us to bring a succession of pioneering  products and accessories – including gaming mice, keyboards, gamepads, USB hubs and headsets – to the market since 2014.
Here are some of the key names behind the creation of our most requested product, the Alpha Pad:

   

 
 




Help us promote our campaign by referring as many friends as you can to our Indiegogo page. The first 50 referees to generate 699 or more visits to our page will receive a black Alpha Pad completely free of charge.
How to Participate
1.  Login to Indiegogo.
2.  Copy your unique URL link and share it with your friends via social media, email or your blog or website.
3.  Check your Referral Status through your Indiegogo profile.
For more information about Indiegogo referral contests, click here.


 
 
  
We have a working prototype of the Alpha Pad ready to go. We just need your help to take the next step.
We will use the first $30,000 USD raised to fund the initial production run (53%), contribute to the cost of tooling (12%), pay Indiegogo and payment fees (10%) and meet marketing and admin costs (25%).
 
 
 

 

Why is the Alpha Pad wired?
The Alpha Pad is wired for extra accuracy. Its durable braided cable features a robust metal connector that can be quickly detached for transportation.
Could I access to the project in different languages?
 Do not hesitate to check the project in your own language at: http://nacongaming.com/gc400es-project/ No dudes en revisar el proyecto en tu propio idioma en :
http://nacongaming.com/es/gc400es-project/
N'hésitez pas à découvrir le projet en français en vous rendant sur: 
http://nacongaming.com/fr/gc400es-project/
Non esitate a consultare il progetto nella propria lingua a:
http://nacongaming.com/it/gc400es-project/
Zögern Sie nicht, das Projekt in Ihrer eigenen Sprache zu überprüfen, um:
http://nacongaming.com/de/gc400es-project/
Is it compatible with Windows 10?
The Alpha Pad is fully compatible with Windows 7, 8 and 10.
Is it compatible with all PC games?
Yes, the Alpha Pad is compatible with every PC game. It has been designed to offer the optimum performance across all gaming genres.
Can the Alpha Pad truly perform in gaming genres, like MOBAs, that are usually only suited to mice and keyboards? 
Yes. The NACON team have worked closely with the French eSports Academy, world champion gamer Norman “GEN1US” Chatrier and the professional PC gaming community to ensure the Alpha Pad is competitive across all genres.
How can I protect my Alpha Pad when I am not using it?The Alpha Pad comes with a fabric travel pouch.
Will it work the xbox one as it runs on Windows 10?
No only on WINDOWS PC, for XBOX ONE compatibility you need to have the license of Microsoft ( security chipset )


When will the Alpha Pad be available?
We are aiming to ship the Alpha Pad in September 2016. However this date is subject to change and we will keep everyone who has ordered one updated.
What’s the retail price?
The Alpha Pad’s recommended retail price is set to be €99 (including VAT), £60 (including VAT) and $89.99 USD (not including taxes). However you can purchase it at a significant discount by selecting one of the above perks.
Will you ship internationally?
At launch we will ship to Canada, the European Union and the United States. If you live elsewhere, please contact us and we will find a shipping solution for your location.
What is the cost of shipping?
Shipping costs will vary depending on your location. Check out our perks to see how you can get your Alpha Pad shipped to Canada, the European Union and the United States for free.

story:
Winterdale is 3d printable city, delivered as an STL File pack for your 3d printer

 

 

 

After the successful release of The Original Winterdale, we are now ready to expand the city. This is a 21 day fundraiser.

Winterdale is a complete modular medieval fantasy city for 28mm tabletop wargames and RPG. Each model is delivered as a .stl file pack to be downloaded and printed on your home 3D Printer.

We are the worlds first and only dedicated 3d printable scenery website and have built up a great following selling our models throughout the world based on both model quality and design. www.printablescenery.com

Beasts Of War ---  3D Printing Industry --- Maker Games --- Adafruit

Each piece is first hand drawn then individually 3D sculpted for maximum detail and optimized to print on small home printers. 

 

 

All our models are original designs by professional fantasy artists

 

+++ FREE BONUS ITEMS for all pledge levels ...

 

3 Modular townhouses that can be configured in a wide variety of ways.
1. Non brick version, as seen on left
2. Full brick version, the concept is top right
3. Part brick version concept is bottom right

These are modular components

 

The Perks ...

THE HAMLET:This is a modular cottage collection. 14 Individually sculpted modular pieces that can be arranged to create a variety of multi level buildings and bridges. Delivered in downloadable .stl file format for your 3D printer so you can print and scale the pieces how you like..

THE TOWER: Everything in the previous perk (The Hamlet) and consists of 5 modular tower building pieces and 3 gnarly trees delivered in downloadable .stl file format for your 3D printer. + the free bonus items see below

 

THE CITADEL  Everything from the previous perks (The Hamlet and the Tower) and also consists of 12 modular castle building pieces. Delivered in downloadable .stl file format for your 3D printer. This level qualifies for Turret Cupola, Gate, Castle Hording and Barbican Stretch Goals + the free bonus items, see below.

 

THE CASTLE:  Everything from the ALL previous perks (The Hamlet and the Tower and the Citadel) and also consists of castle wall extension gatehouse and drawbridge. Deliverd as an STL file pack to be printed on a home 3d Printer. This level qualifies for ALL the Stretch Goals + the free bonus items + the free bonus items, see below.

 

Stretch Goals ...

The basic 'perk' levels represent amazing value in themselves but with the addition of the extra models available by the unlocking of the stretch goals for each perk level you'll be getting an unbelievable amount of models for your perk.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Stretch goals will be completed before May 2016

 

 

Upgrade ...

Upgrade and get all the Winterdale 1 Stretch Goals
For $29 you can also receive all the Winterdale 1 stretch goals. That's almost $100 worth of downloadable Winterdale models

 

 

See the segment on the Beasts of War weekend update from the Original Winterdale - SKIP TO 0:56

 

 

    More Information

    Painting tips

    Scaling with 3d Printable Scenery

    Customer prints and printer feedback

    --- Please check out the reviews on our work ---

    • 3D Print Review
    • ADAFRUIT
    • 3D Print Board.com Review
    • 3Ders.org Review
    • Fabbaloo

    Social Links ... 

    • https://www.facebook.com/printabelscenery/
    • https://www.instagram.com/printablescenery

    All images and designs are copyright Printable Scenery 2016

    Concept art by Elwira Pawlikowska

     

     

    TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

    When you make a contribution to Winterdale you will receive the .STL files for the models as per your selected perk.

    'You can print these files for you own personal use but you may not sell the printed items or distribute the digital 3D models'

    Please read out terms and conditions on the printable scenery website.

    http://www.printablescenery.com/content/3-terms-and-conditions-of-use

story:
This project is concluded, but donations through PayPal are still accepted on the website at http://gamersagainstbigotry.org/donate

Welcome! We're updating with news about the project (and the hackings) just below here, but the basics of what GAB is and what we're doing are further below.  Scroll a bit to "GAB in Short" to read that first.

Update #4

Hey folks! Thanks for all the support! If you're curious to read about what happened with the site, the piece by Winda at NBC News does a fantastic job of summing it up.

We've got a big team of folks working together to get the site relaunched stronger than ever, and very soon.  I'm also working on filing preliminary paperwork necessary for the 501(c)3 non-profit incorporation.

It's been so wonderful seeing how passionately people are getting behind us.  We're really going to be able to hit the ground running!

Update #3

What a crazy 24 hours.  After the GAB site with all the pledges got wiped Sunday night, all of my other sites, personal and professional, got knocked out one-by-one.  Most everything is back online, and the support on Twitter, Facebook, and -- most of all -- here has been amazing!

I wanted to make a few clarifications now that we've broken the funding goal, because a few media agencies are incorrectly reporting on this whole IndieGoGo thing. 

  1. This project was not originally a response to the hacker attacks.  In fact, it was launched at the same time as GAB, with the main goal of incorporating as a 501(c)3 non-profit

  2. The goal of the project has changed, but, unfortunately, I'm not able to change the key details on IndieGoGo (e.g., funding goal) to reflect that.

  3. While it's fantastic that the hackers have raised awareness about GAB, the unfortunate side is that now all of the money we've raised so far ($1200), as well as a great deal more, will have to go into improving the security for the site.

Update #2

At 11pm CT Sunday, July 22, as the pledge score was nearing 1500 pledges, the site was taken down by hackers, causing us to lose all of the pledges.  As we try to assess the situation and rebuild, this campaign will be incredibly important in fighting back.  A few people were so threatened by the idea of ending bigotry, that they went out of their way to wage a week-long series of attacks on the site, culminating in this last blow.  

As a fan on Facebook said, “they need the IndieGoGo – they’re going to need the level of security you normally find at research corporations just to stay afloat with the savage attacks they’re going to receive.”

(Psst... If you're a developer who thinks you can help, please contact me using one of the links at the bottom of this page)

Update #1

Check out this great interview at The Mary Sue and Mashable with GAB founder Sam Killermann!  It provides a deeper insight into the organization and its goals.

GAB in short

Gamers Against Bigotry was created with one purpose in mind: to create a more welcoming gaming community for all gamers, regardless of their identity.  Gaming is awesome.  And online multiplayer gaming is more awesome.  But it sucks that gamers have to choose to not play online, or to deal with a relentless barrage of identity-based hate slung their way if they do log in.

If you don't think this is a problem, watch this video, this video, or check out this site, then get back to us.

At the end of June, we created a pledge and a website where gamers could go to make a stand.  With no advertising but the word of mouth, in the first week over 600 gamers from all around the world signed the pledge and showed their support.  We've managed to do all of that in a week, with absolutely no funding.  Imagine what we can do if we get the community behind us.

Here is the pledge:

As a gamer, I realize I contribute to an incredibly diverse social network of gamers around the world, and that my actions have the ability to impact others. In effort to make a positive impact, and to create a community that is welcoming to all, I pledge to not use bigoted language while gaming, online and otherwise.

Bigoted language includes, but is not limited to, slurs based on race, ethnicity, gender,sexual orientation, and disability.

Read more about the pledge, and what is and isn't included, here.

Read why you shouldn't use the word "rape" casually here.

What We Need Funded

Update: Given the recent level of attacks on the site, our needs have changed.  I've annotated the new needs in italics below.

So far, everything we have accomplished has been without funding.  The development of the website, the artwork, and the engineering of the pledge have all been donated.  In order to grow, we'll need the following:

Incorporate as  Non-Profit: we want to officially incorporate and apply to be a 501(c)3 non-profit, but it's (ironically) incredibly expensive to start a non-profit.  Help us with the $300 - $500 legal fees!  Still priority number one

Advertising: word of mouth has done us well so far, but advertising on Facebook and gaming forums will allow us to greatly expand our reach, and advertising isn't cheap.  No longer as much an issue -- after funding the non-profit, money will go first into the next two things

PHP/MySQL Developer: the site is vulnerable to attacks right now (and has actually been brought down by a couple of troll hackers a few times already), so we need the help of a professional PHP/MySQL developer to enhance security of the pledge and protect against exploits.  Getting a security specialist or two on board is a must

Dedicated Server Hosting: right now the server space is shared with several other projects on a group hosting plan, but as the site grows and starts getting more traffic, we'll have to up our hosting.  The cost difference will be going from the current $8/mo to $70 - 100/mo.  Better hosting will help better secure the site

AS WE BREAK $700: there are a lot of things we'd like to get started on right now, but the success of this project will be pivotal in accomplishing them.  Beyond what's listed above, as we break $700 and go upward the following tasks will become possible:

  • Secure the Site!
  • CONs/PAX! We would love to have a presence at PAX to be able to interact, in-person, with gamers and help grow the movement.
  • GAB Mobile Ap! Think Xfire, but with the ability to connect with other gamers who want to play online in a welcoming environment
  • Informative and entertaining video series highlighting different aspects of bigotry in gaming and ways we can end them (professional comedian actors, and film crew)
  • Merch! Right now, we have a cafe press store but the prices are terrible and the overhead is ridiculous.  We'd like to be able to order and print our own series of merch to get it to the fans at a lower price.

What You Get in Return

Other than the swag mentioned for each perk, you get to know that you did something about a problem with the gaming community that most others have ignored and swept under the rug.  That's pretty awesome, isn't it?  It is.

What's Our Plan for the Pledge?

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sign the pledge at http://gamersagainstbigotry.org! Spread the link around to your friends and encourage they sign the pledge.  Tell your friends about this project and suggest they donate a few dollars.  And you can always follow us on Facebook and Twitter to stay tuned for future developments.

story:
What is Luminesca?

Luminesca is an action/exploration PC game set in an underwater world. I am developing the game for the PC (with a little support from some friends) with hopes to bring it to more platforms if it's successful.

In Luminesca you control a little creature called Lum.

  • Outsmart predators, guide small creatures and scare off rivals using your esca (that's the glowing bit on your head!)
  • Explore an underwater world, full of life, which responds to your touch and physical presence.
  • Discover the secrets that lie in the deep...

Luminesca is a 2D side-scrolling adventure which focuses on the events of a changing environment, utilising light and physics to challenge the part of you that loves to explore.

 

More details on the Luminesca Blog.


Story

Springing to life in the protozoan soup, Lum is thrust into a confusing world of dazzling lights and frightening monsters. His colony's habitat comes under threat when a vast, ancient machine grinds into motion and starts to consume all the surrounding water. Lum's adventure takes him from all corners of his environment to the heart of the machine, encountering a rich ecology of inhabitants and learning some valuable lessons about the world around him.




What do I get if I donate?

  • Donating $5 or more gets you same-day access to regular 'work-in-progress' versions of the game.
  • Donating $10 acts as a pre-order of the finished game when it's released.
  • There are bigger rewards for higher donations (such as art prints and the soundtrack) which you can see in the perks box on the right-hand side of the page.




What does Luminesca need money for?

I want to make Luminesca as good as it can be, and this means working on it full-time. The funding would help with living costs during the project and allow me to commit my full time and attention to making the game live up to its maximum potential.

It would also help to pay for promotional efforts such as software licenses and web hosting which are a requirement if I want to bring Luminesca to a wider audience.




What if the community's donation exceeds my goal?

The amount I have asked for is the minimum I would need to make the game. If the community kindly donates more than this amount I can go to extra lengths to improve Luminesca and distribute it on more platforms.


  • Extra funding could contribute towards a Unity Pro license would allow me to improve the visuals of the game and use more powerful tools to create it.
  • And finally, perhaps most importantly, extra funding would allow me to consider hiring other people to provide higher quality art and programming support.

I do not expect you to donate more than you need to, but it would certainly go a long way if you did!




Where can I see more?

  • You can read more on the Luminesca Blog.
  • Follow @LuminescaGame on Twitter.
  • Like Luminesca on Facebook.
  • Subscribe on YouTube.
  • Come and discuss the game on the forum.
  • Find out who I am and what experience I have on my pr﻿ofile.

story:
Creating mobile applications shouldn’t take months to learn. It should be easy, intuitive, and a joy to create.

…And That’s Why We Created MAGE

MAGE, or Mobile Application Generation Environment, is an easy-to-use product that allows anyone to create a mobile application without any programming simply by loading MAGE in their browser. MAGE is perfect for experienced application creators and beginners alike. Load the creation panel; select a template or work from scratch; load your website or drag and drop content and images; select features and build.

MAGE allows anyone to create gorgeous mobile applications without sacrificing functionality.

The mobile creation environment allows anyone to quickly and easily create a gorgeous mobile application with superior functionality. MAGE allows a user to drag and drop content and images as well as incorporate lists, tables, and menus. MAGE also allows an application creator to integrate dynamic content, analytics, and push notifications into their applications by using an online control panel for each created application.

Create Unlimited Apps

There is no limit to the number of apps that you can create using MAGE.

The Goal

The end goal of MAGE is to create an environment that brings all mobile application creation options and outside features under one roof. There are many amazing extra features to complement mobile applications that developers do not add because of the time it takes to add them. MAGE makes this extremely simple, but don’t forget that MAGE’s primary goal is to enable mobile application creation to the highest extent.

The funds provided by you, our backers, will be used to fund the development of MAGE and to pay for the servers to run it after it is completed.

How It Works

If you have a website, not a problem if you don't, the first option will be to enter in your address. MAGE can then pull content (such as images and text) from your website and generate a starter application for you to modify. The application creation panel then allows an application creator numerous options to add text, images, buttons, menus, dynamic content modules, and dozens of other features. Choose from our pre-designed templates to build off of, load your website, or build an application from scratch. The choice is yours.

Templates

MAGE users will have the option of choosing from a set of templates to help them get started creating their mobile application. These templates will be for businesses and individuals alike.

Creating Games with MAGE

A lot of feedback we have gotten is for the ability to create games with MAGE. We are happy to respond to these requests with a very positive YES! You will be able to create games with MAGE. Using our games pack and provided templates you will be able to create games. These games will be limited to the templates we provide, but our goal is to continually be providing new templates for our users as MAGE continues to develop and evolve.

Mobile Control Panel

Each application built using MAGE also gets a mobile control panel that is generated by MAGE. Application creators can access the control panel and use it to change content on the application, push out updates, send push notifications, and monitor analytics.

Dynamic Content

Our dynamic content option allows for an application creator to set a specific area on an application for dynamic content and then set this content through the mobile control panel. This content can be changed at any time from the control panel, and it is instantly reflected across all installed applications.

Analytics

MAGE has two levels of analytics: basic and advanced. Basic analytics keep track of page views and installs of your applications. Advanced analytics break this data down into much more detailed information, such as time period of views, location of installs, and other useful information.

Push Notifications

MAGE offers push notifications for all applications. The mobile control panel has a scheduling and grouping plug-in built in that allows administrators to schedule when notifications are to be sent as well as whom to send notifications to.

Publishing Your App

Many app creators don't realize the extra work and effort required to submit their app to their chosen platform's app store. MAGE takes care of this as well for application creators. We will build your application binary, certify it, and submit it for review. The Google Play Store publishes application within several hours, Apple's App Store usually takes some time due to their extensive review process, and Windows Phone usually takes some time as well to review the submitted application.

Wireframes

Below are wireframe images of the application creation panel and the mobile control panel.

Our Story

The Demski Group is a company focused on innovation and helping to improve businesses and individuals. MAGE was conceived out of the idea of an easier way to create mobile applications without having to pay high prices or sacrificing functionality. Among us, we have a rather extensive background in designing, building, and publishing mobile applications, and it has brought us joy to see our users discover what we have built and use it. We wish to bring that same joy in creating to everyone.

The idea for MAGE originally stemmed from the questions of how to get more individuals and businesses exciting about mobile applications and how they can use them to address their needs. Our first thought was to go to more events and trade shows and directly interact with potential customers there; however we didn't think that a few phones and slides would be all that interesting. Our next idea was to allow individuals to create a mobile application right there on the spot using a laptop or tablet. From this idea, MAGE was born.

The Team

Andrew - CEO and Chief Developer. With over 10 years of experience in the industry Andrew has worked on hundreds of groundbreaking projects.

Aaron - Social Media, Marketing, and Design. Aaron has a knack for recognizing trends and capitalizing on them. He helped create the original design for MAGE.

Mike - Developer. Creating applications and seeing them in use has always been a joy for Mike, and MAGE is a project he is very passionate about.

Taylor - Designer. With an amazing ability to bring to life the designs people only imagine, Taylor is one of the primary designers for MAGE and his designs will facilitate an easy-to-use user interface.

Seth - Creative. Seth is the ideas guy. When we get stuck on a problem he has no problem pushing the limits and finding a solution.

Kody - Designer. A designer specializing in UI design. Kody has created designs in the past for mobile applications and understands what needs to be done to create conducive user interfaces.

Development Timeline

So far we have built, tested, and implemented the back-end framework for the control panel that includes dynamic content, analytics, and push notifications. Several applications are already using these features with excellent results.

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

1700 stellt die Stürmung eines von einer Hand voll von Punks besetzten Hauses als Computerspiel nach. Die Besetzung war insbesondere deshalb brisant, da der Hausbesitzer die Hausbesetzer zuerst selbst eingeladen hat, um die letzten Mieter herauszuekeln.

Der Spieler übernimmt dabei die Steuerung der Polizisten und muss versuchen das Haus zu entern. Von der Mechanik liegt das Pixelgrafikspiel zwischen Lemmings und Donkey Kong.

Vom 1700 Team wurde der erste Prototyp entwickelt und der öffentliche Test hat gerade gestartet. Mit deiner Unterstützung wollen wir:

  • Gameplay und Flow
  • Levels, Levels, Levels und Szenen
  • Die Mobilversion als Apps mit Gestensteuerung für die wesentlichsten Plattformen
  • Der Supercop mit Walzerspezialfähigkeiten und absoluter Balltauglichkeit

Die Veröffentlichung dieser Version erfolgt dann zum 30.01.2015

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Bisher haben alle Projektbeteiligten ehrenamtlich für dieses Projekt gearbeitet. 

Mit deiner Unterstützung können wir das Spiel schneller vorantreiben, mehr Inhalt und mehr Spielspaß generieren.

Als Gegenleistung kannst du dich je nach Spendenhöhe mit einem limitierten handgedrucktem 1700 Shirt, mit einem Tag, deinem Pixelavatar im Spiel oder gar als Polizeipräsident im Spiel verewigen.


      Und wenn dir das Projekt gefällt

      dann gib uns Aufmerksamkeit, erzähl weiter davon, verbreite es und gib uns dein Geld.

story:
Help make Mouffe ready-to-travel with the necessary equipment!

Mouffe is a very unique kind of experience, and can be enjoyed by a very wide range of audiences -- from families to festivals, from gamers to galleries. We would very much like to bring Mouffe to more events; however this is difficult due to the physical needs of the project.

It is very important to us that Mouffe becomes a stand-alone, hassle-free package. With all the components in one place, Mouffe would be simple for any event coordinators to set up, even without any of our team members present. Owning equipment, like our own projector, would mean that we wouldn't need to rely on our show venues to provide it for us. We would be able to test and continue tweaking and improving the game, in-house. Assistance on travel funds makes it easier for us to get it to events it’s accepted to, no matter the location – it could be your city! We would even be able to host the creation of more games for the tent and blanket controller by other developers.

A one-package Mouffe is an accessible Mouffe, and we want to bring it to you!


Update: We've reached 100%!! Thank you so much to everyone who donated and help us get the word out. We can't tell you how much we appreciate it.

Stretch Goals -- New Developers Making Games for Mouffe

One of Mouffe Team's goals has always been to turn the Mouffe set-up into a platform that various artists and developers can make their own games for. We'd really love to have new experiences that we can bring along with us to events and festivals.

Your donation will help us pay our collaborators, and further the exciting evolution of Mouffe.

With every $1000 stretch goal we meet, we will announce a new artist! They will each make a game that will be shown inside Mouffe (played with a blanket!) that will also be available to download for any funders at the $25 perk level and higher.

We're super happy to announce our first collaboration is with Montreal's Devine Lu Linvega. Check out our latest update for more information.




Mouffe is a daydream simulator: while lying down inside a tent and using a quilt as a controller, players set off abstract animations projected onto the ceiling of the tent. It is an interactive art installation that is part-game and part-toy. Lie down and experience visual, aural, and tactile satisfaction in a quiet, intimate space. Press buttons, things happen. Relax and Play.

Mouffe pushes at the borders of the games as a medium – it’s not downloadable and it's irreproducible; there’s no way to “win”, and no achievements to unlock. All that being said, Mouffe is really FUN TO PLAY, and despite it being a non-commercial piece, with your help we can get it into gamers’ (and everyone’s!) hands.

Mouffe has been shown at the Google offices in Montreal, and in Austin, Texas. It was an official selection of IndieCade 2014 in Los Angeles and Gamercamp in Toronto. 

Upcoming appearances:

Salon Ludique: Dreams

Montreal, QC - 7pm, February 5th
Espace Fibre, 2665 rue Augustin-Cantin, 2nd Floor
$5 donation at door (goes directly to artists)
www.salonludique.org

Vector Festival 2015

Toronto, ON - Ongoing, February 18th to March 21st
InterAccess Gallery, 9 Ossington Ave
Free to attend
www.vectorfestival.org
EXHIBITION OPENING RECEPTION: February 18th, 7pm to 9pm
PANEL DISCUSSION: February 20th, 7pm to 9pm


The purpose of this fundraising campaign is to:

●  primarily, purchase the necessary equipment that Mouffe needs to run, such as a short-throw projector and a suitable container;

●  offset any travel or shipping costs that Mouffe incurs in order to tour the project to different places.

It is a very simple breakdown: we buy the equipment first, and funds we receive in excess will go towards reimbursing transportation costs made in service to Mouffe. We are not asking for much, but we are very grateful because every penny counts towards getting Mouffe closer to you!

Your donation, no matter how big or small, is really important to us and we want you to know how much you have contributed to helping Mouffe. With your help, it can be seen by as many people as possible and continue to grow.

* Offensive pennant names may be subject to revision.

Check back often for campaign updates on this page to see previews of all the different perk items!



There is actually very little risk involved in this donation campaign. With Indiegogo’s flexibility, no matter what you decide to put in, that amount will go directly to the project.

Mouffe was never a commercial creation and we don’t ever want to charge for its exhibition, so crowdfunding is the only way to cover future costs of the project. On the flip side, this also means that we will be asking for this donation only once, and any investment that we receive from you will go far.

At the end of this campaign, no matter what happens, we plan to have that complete package, ready to show around the world!

Frequently Asked Questions

1. How come there aren't multiple tents and blankets? May I have my own Mouffe?

Mouffe was originally created in an incubator program for experimental games at a university that provided much support and resources for its creation. Unfortunately, without that infrastructure and a working budget, we're unable to make multiple set-ups of Mouffe... for now.

2. Why aren't you including a digital build of the game for download?

The short answer is that the visual composition and gameplay are designed specifically for the tent. Without the Mouffe set-up, the experience just isn't the same, and a digital build cannot fully capture how wonderful it is. Half of the fun of Mouffe is who you play it with, so we hope instead to just be able to go to many places!

3. Where will Mouffe be in the future? I want to hang out in a Mouffe!

We have some upcoming events lined up to announce soon! Please check back often, here and on our website, www.mouffegame.com. Our first priority for now is to finish this campaign, and how it all turns out will be indicative of what Mouffe Team will be up to next. Looking forward to it!


Mouffe Team came together at the Critical Hit Collaboratory program at Concordia University in Montreal, Canada. During this incubator, they had the chance to combine their talents and varied backgrounds to explore experimental controllers and games played in alternate spaces. 

Kim Hoang is a comic artist who crafts tales about steadfast friendships, budding romances, and the adventure found in everyday encounters. She holds a BFA from Emily Carr University. She is a member of the independent Canadian comics collective Love Love Hill, works as a manga teacher for teens, and makes murals with EMPLM. Kim also volunteers her time for TCAF, and is currently a co-coordinator for the 2015 Pixelles Game Incubator. Kim provided fabrication for Mouffe, creating the blanket and tent.

Ben Swinden is an artist and game-maker from Halifax, Nova Scotia. He graduated from NSCAD with an interdisciplinary BFA. Ben has been focused on creating small experimental game experiences for the past several years while also working as an artist and designer on larger projects such as Pocketwatch Games’ Monaco: What’s Yours Is Mine. He is the co-founder of the Halifax Game Collective, an organisation that holds regular meetups and game jams in Halifax. Ben provided programming and art for Mouffe.

Hamish Lambert is an animation artist based in Montreal, Quebec. He likes to animate simple little creatures and work on films and games with heart. He received his BFA in Film Animation from Concordia University in 2013 and graduated as the valedictorian of the Faculty of Fine Arts. Since graduating he has continued to produce work independently. His work has screened and been presented in festivals internationally. Hamish provided animation and art for Mouffe.

Zachary Soares is a 3D artist and sound designer from Montreal, Quebec. He enjoys creating immersive worlds using voxel art and sound. With a BA in Urban Planning he is constantly creating and studying environments. Once graduated, Zach took up game development full-time and has started working on various games creating, and designing more environments to experience. Zach provided sound and music for Mouffe.

that being said, Mouffe is really FUN TO PLAY, and despite it being a
non-commercial piece, with your help we can get it into gamers’ (and everyone’s!)
hands.Mouffe has been shown at the Google offices in Montreal, and in Austin, Texas. It was an official selection of IndieCade 2014 in Los Angeles and Gamercamp in Toronto. Upcoming appearances:Salon Ludique: DreamsMontreal, QC - 7pm, February 5thEspace Fibre, 2665 rue Augustin-Cantin, 2nd Floor$5 donation at door (goes directly to artists)www.salonludique.orgVector Festival 2015Toronto, ON - Ongoing, February 18th to March 21stInterAccess Gallery, 9 Ossington AveFree to attendwww.vectorfestival.orgEXHIBITION OPENING RECEPTION: February 18th, 7pm to 9pmPANEL DISCUSSION: February 20th, 7pm to 9pm
The purpose
of this fundraising campaign is to:
●  primarily, purchase the necessary equipment that
Mouffe needs to run, such as a short-throw projector and a suitable
container;
●  offset any
travel or shipping costs that Mouffe incurs in order to tour the project
to different places.It is a very
simple breakdown: we buy the equipment first, and funds we receive in excess
will go towards reimbursing transportation costs made in service to Mouffe. We
are not asking for much, but we are very grateful because every penny counts
towards getting Mouffe closer to you!





Your donation, no matter how big or small, is really important to us and we want you to know how much you have contributed to helping Mouffe. With your help, it can be seen by as many people as possible and continue to grow.* Offensive pennant names may be subject to revision.Check back often for campaign updates on this page to see previews of all the different perk items!

There is
actually very little risk involved in this donation campaign. With Indiegogo’s
flexibility, no matter what you decide to put in, that amount will go directly
to the project.
Mouffe was
never a commercial creation and we don’t ever want to charge for its
exhibition, so crowdfunding is the only way to cover future costs of the project. On the flip side, this also means that we will be asking
for this donation only once, and any investment that we receive from you will
go far.
At the end
of this campaign, no matter what happens, we plan to have that complete
package, ready to show around the world!
Frequently Asked Questions1. How come there aren't multiple tents and blankets? May I have my own Mouffe?Mouffe was originally created in an incubator program for experimental games at a university that provided much support and resources for its creation. Unfortunately, without that infrastructure and a working budget, we're unable to make multiple set-ups of Mouffe... for now.2. Why aren't you including a digital build of the game for download?The short answer is that the visual composition and gameplay are designed specifically for the tent. Without the Mouffe set-up, the experience just isn't the same, and a digital build cannot fully capture how wonderful it is. Half of the fun of Mouffe is who you play it with, so we hope instead to just be able to go to many places!3. Where will Mouffe be in the future? I want to hang out in a Mouffe!We have some upcoming events lined up to announce soon! Please check back often, here and on our website, www.mouffegame.com. Our first priority for now is to finish this campaign, and how it all turns out will be indicative of what Mouffe Team will be up to next. Looking forward to it!Mouffe Team came
together at the Critical Hit Collaboratory program at Concordia University in
Montreal, Canada. During this incubator, they had the chance to combine their
talents and varied backgrounds to explore experimental controllers and games
played in alternate spaces. Kim Hoang is a comic artist who crafts tales about steadfast friendships, budding romances, and the adventure found in everyday encounters. She holds a BFA from Emily Carr University. She is a member of the independent Canadian comics collective Love Love Hill, works as a manga teacher for teens, and makes murals with EMPLM. Kim also volunteers her time for TCAF, and is currently a co-coordinator for the 2015 Pixelles Game Incubator. Kim provided fabrication for Mouffe, creating the blanket and tent.
Ben Swinden is an artist and game-maker from Halifax, Nova Scotia. He graduated from NSCAD with an interdisciplinary BFA. Ben has been focused on creating small experimental game experiences for the past several years while also working as an artist and designer on larger projects such as Pocketwatch Games’ Monaco: What’s Yours Is Mine. He is the co-founder of the Halifax Game Collective, an organisation that holds regular meetups and game jams in Halifax. Ben provided programming and art for Mouffe.
Hamish Lambert is an animation artist based in Montreal, Quebec. He likes to animate simple little creatures and work on films and games with heart. He received his BFA in Film Animation from Concordia University in 2013 and graduated as the valedictorian of the Faculty of Fine Arts. Since graduating he has continued to produce work independently. His work has screened and been presented in festivals internationally. Hamish provided animation and art for Mouffe.
Zachary Soares is a 3D artist and sound designer from Montreal, Quebec. He enjoys creating immersive worlds using voxel art and sound. With a BA in Urban Planning he is constantly creating and studying environments. Once graduated, Zach took up game development full-time and has started working on various games creating, and designing more environments to experience. Zach
provided sound and music for Mouffe.

story:
Who We Are

Base10 Games is a small, but talented group of developers that joined together to make amazing video games! Currently based in Colorado, we are passionate about creating the rich and entertaining experiences that we have learned to love while growing up.  Our first project, 'My Lil' Viking' is a compact action/platformer game for iOS and Android. What we have planned will be perfect for mobile platforms, but we need some help getting there!

Although we have already started working on the game, raising $7000 will go a long way towards helping us cover the cost of licensing software, purchasing necessary hardware, and will also of course speed up production time. Without your help, 'My Lil' Viking' could take well over a year to get off the ground, and will probably force us to release a smaller, less feature-complete version of the game. Now we know supporting a cause is fun and all, but we don't want funding our project to be a one-way relationship. So in exchange for helping us out, we're offering all kinds of exclusive 'My Lil' Viking' perks ranging from awesome t-shirts to entire shields!  Your contributions will not only guarantee 'My Lil' Viking" will makes its public debut, but it will also ensure that Base10 Games will continue to make quality video games for many to enjoy in the future. Thanks!

The Game

Fast Facts:

  • Singleplayer Action/Platformer 
  • Fast paced gameplay
  • 5 Themed Stages
  • 25 Enemies*
  • 25 Learnable Abilities
  • Postable High Scores

*Not including the enemies you design!

Introducing:

 

Leeroy McElroy

Leeroy is a scrappy little kid dead-set on becoming a full-fledged viking. He is the only Lil' Viking known to retake Viking Exams untill he has mastered them. 

Likes: Axes, Fighting, Looting                                                                    

Loves: Root Beer

Dislikes: Goblins, Undead, Haircuts

 

Gameplay 

My Lil’ Viking is a sidescrolling platformer game where the player must try to earn points, combat waves of enemies, and keep from being defeated for as long as possible in order to obtain a high score.

We here at Base10 are very aware of the picture-to-word exchange rate, so instead of just writing how the game works, we're proud to present you with:

The Basics of Viking School!

 Step1: Enter The Stage

Players begin by entering a stage. Stages are filled with traps to avoid and monsters to fight. As time passes, more traps and monsters will begin to appear, making survival more challenging.

 

Step2: Collect Treasure

Obtaining “Thunder Coins” is the primary method of achieving points in My Lil’ Viking. Small coins will drop from defeated enemies, and large coins will appear randomly throughout the stage. Obtaining “Loot” and defeating enemies in quick succession will add multipliers to your score.

 

Step3: Survive!

If the player is hit three times by an enemy or trap, the game will end. The longer the player survives, the higher the score. Defeating certain amounts of a specific enemy will allow you to learn a special ability from them. These abilities are permanent and will allow the player to survive much longer than playing without them. 

 

Step 4: Receive A Grade

After the game ends, the player’s overall score will be calculated into a final grade. Swapping out various abilities to suit personal playstyles is key to achieving a higher score.

 And that's My Lil' Viking in a nutshell!

 

Can't Contribute?

Sure you can! Just get the word out! The more people who know about 'My Lil' Viking' the better. If you show us proof of yourself spreading the word, we'll post your name in the MLV section of the official Base10 Games website...Forever! It can be anything: posting flyers, forum signatures, Facebook posts, Twitter updates, anything! Send your proof to basetengames@gmail.com Go on and make some noise!

 

Check Back Soon!

We're adding information and media to the My Lil' Viking page all the time, so make sure to check back here for updates!

story:
The Vaecon network is a Minecraft Minigames network, we run all our servers on Dedicated hardware for the best experience possible in addition to unique and never seen before minigame ideas to give you the best possible experience.

Not only do we provide a great experience but we also have a team of very dedicated members working to enhance the user experience, in addition to an XenForo forums for users to communicate with others and for users to communicate with the server staff team. Our staff team consists of:

- Dan [Vaecon] - Head of Project

- Alex [12thetechguy] - Backend Management

- minecrafterwork - Network Manager

- Nick - Developer

- Brandon - Developer

- Adam - Developer

- Peter - Developer


     Supporting us will allow you to receive special perks, these perks are found on the right of the page, they allow you to receive special perks only found here on Indiegogo. As for what we offer on the network, we offer a wide variety of unique perks that are only found on the Vaecon network in addition to unique gamemodes also only found on the Vaecon Network, first off the features will be described in addition to the gamemodes afterwards, gamemodes listed here are only some of our gamemodes and we plan to release new gamemodes every once in awhile. 


Here is a list of the unique features we offer on the Vaecon Network:

- Dedicated Hardware

- Unique and Custom plugins

- Lag free experience

- Custom Dynamic Join System

- Custom built maps and lobbies


Some of the gamemodes we offer on the Vaecon Network:

Based off Ender's Game

You are given a Freeze gun with ammo, your goal? Freeze the other team before they freeze you, in a interactive environment jump around the map and make sure not to get frozen, also make use of your grappling hook to get around.

Want to chat with your team only? Chat while holding your team wool in your inventory

Want to be unfrozen? One person per team has the unfreeze rod and may be your only chance to get out of a frozen situation



Based off Hidden in Plain Sight

You are a Ninja disguised amongst under Ninjas and fake Ninjas, your goal? Kill all the other Real Ninjas or run over all the other beacons located around the map, you should avoid being discovered and try to blend in to avoid being killed, once your killed the game is over. Buy perks with coins you earn to unlock special abilities pre game to help you on your quest.


Multiple Gamemodes are also coming soon to the Vaecon Network but are still unannounced

Unable to support us via Payment? There are other ways you can help out like:

- Share this page with your friends

- Share this page on Facebook

- Tweet this page out

- Use the Indiegogo share tools built into this page

story:
Our Mission Summary

Our mission is to raise Disney’s awareness of the Kingdom Hearts fanbase at the Magic Kingdom by hosting a night where at least 300 fans attend one of Disney’s Halloween events dressed in cosplay or Kingdom Hearts clothing. At the same time, this event doubles as a Kingdom Hearts fellowship event for fans across the county—and across the globe. By connecting the hearts of a legion of fans, we will be connecting these two Kingdoms together. This is why our tag-line is: “Re:Discover, Re:Connect”.

Ultimately, our goal is to have Kingdom Hearts presented in the theme parks in some consistent way, either through merchandise, official Kingdom Hearts costumes, attractions, or some other presence. While we do not believe that this single event will get Kingdom Hearts into the Magic Kingdom over-night, we strongly believe that it is a powerful step towards that final goal.

Our motto is: “It’s kind of fun to do the impossible.” Walt Disney himself saw this as his personal philosophy for life and kept moving forward towards his own dreams of theme parks, memorable characters, and animated films. We hope to follow his legacy by doing something seemingly impossible—getting Kingdom Hearts into the Magic Kingdom.

If Walt could do it, so can we. We believe that—by uniting together—we can accomplish our own impossible goal… and have fun at the same time.


What Our Funds Go Towards

All proceeds go 100% towards PROJECT: Magic Kingdom Hearts. Any amount helps, though we recommend a minimum of $5.00. Your donation will go towards:

  • Purchasing lanyards for the event
  • Advertising the event through Facebook
  • Purchasing prizes for event day attendees and social network give-aways
  • Paying for ink, paper, site maintenance, and other things necessary for spreading the word and keeping the project on its feet
  • All donations come with at least one perk

The Impact

This our chance to let not just Disney, but the world know of our presence, and our love for this wonderful series!

  • With this project, we can unite Kingdom Hearts fans from around the country.
  • We can attempt to build more prominence of the series in the Disney parks.
  • This will be our second year holding this event at the Magic Kingdom, as our first was a rousing success.
  • With your help, we can do something great for the fans.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some fans out there don't have the fund to contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

  • Get the word out! Share our Facebook page, our home page, and hit our share button on IndieGoGo!
  • Spread the word to Kingdom Hearts fansites, and gaming forums. Let the world know we're here, and ready for round two!
