story:
A combat-driven RPG fueled by unlimited, fresh, community created content powered by our innovative design tools.

From between the folds of the fabric of reality they came, enticed by the call of the mighty Dungeonforge. The Aedifects, demigods with the power of creation in their hands, came together with one purpose: to create the ultimate test of the zeal and bravery of mankind. As a member of this ancient and almighty race of creators, the power of the legendary Dungeonforge is yours to wield. How will you use its might to shape the destiny of mankind?

Dungeonforge is a free to play RPG where the community drives the content. We provide a dungeon and quest creation system, a rich gameworld for community content to exist in, and insane, action RPG combat with some innovative twists thrown in for maximum freshness. Dungeonforge is built on two main premises, that great gameplay, first and foremost, makes great games and that community created content makes the gaming world go ’round.


The game will be free to play for everyone and all gameplay content will be available for free at all times. It is important to us to allow all players to enjoy the unlimited fresh content created by our community without restriction. Also, items that affect gameplay are not directly sold to players at all. Cosmetic items such as skins for your character will be offered to those interested in personalizing the look of their character. Our most interesting mechanic, however, is the Epic Dungeon system. Any dungeon can be played as an Epic Dungeon when using an Epic Dungeon Pass. This automatically increases the difficulty setting of the dungeon. When the dungeon is completed, all participating players are rewarded with Epic Loot. Epic Loot is simply aesthetically unique loot that may have interesting (however precisely balanced) effects when used. These effects will tend to be of a visual nature (think, transforming a defeated enemy into a harmless bunny rather than a corpse. Stuff like that). Epic Loot will also come in collectible sets that grant a boost to the user when all pieces are worn. Loot may be freely traded with other players so you can seek out and trade for the set you're currently collecting. When a dungeon is played using an Epic Dungeon Pass, the creator of the dungeon receives a kick-back of in-game currency to be used on cosmetic items or, if enough is accrued, even cashed in for real-world money providing a tangible reward for creating the very best content. Also, if your map is highly rated we'll promote it within the game upping the chances players find and play it and increasing your opportunity for such rewards.


PC is our lead platform for the game. Simultaneous launch will be performed on Windows and Linux, with Android being our next priority. iOS and Mac OS support is in the pipeline and console support will be considered based on demand.

As the name of the game aptly demonstrates, the "Dungeonforge," our toolset for creating dungeons and quests, is at the heart of what we hope to accomplish. What we’re delivering is a set of tools for easily creating content for others to enjoy. 

Was there ever a time when playing a game you loved that your imagination just went wild thinking about what you might add to the game? You’re not alone. User-made creations are woven throughout the very fabric of gaming. Have you given any thought, even just for a moment, to what mark you might want to leave? What’s standing in your way?

With the map editor that is at the core of Dungeonforge, we give you all you need to create instantly playable content. You'll be able to create a dungeon by laying down prefabricated sections. Once you've laid out the rooms and corridors you can set down monsters, determine loot drops, set down treasure chests, even add NPCs that can act as quest givers, merchants, helpers, or whatever else your narrative requires. Quest creation and editing tools are included to create your own story. You can add dialog or even add full-motion cut-scenes to your dungeon quickly and easily. Once your dungeon is finished, we then take that content and put it center stage for all to enjoy.

New, user-created content is always available and accessible from within the game as part of a rich, interconnected gameworld with the very best content becoming an indelible part of the gameworld and its lore.

Central to our promise of delivering a game with great gameplay at its foundation is our innovative take on combat. Dungeonforge is presented as a top-down, aRPG in the legacy of Diablo, Baldur's Gate, and other classics. Where we depart from the well-worn philosophy that governs that genre, however, is in the way our combat system emphasizes player skill and strategy to a greater degree, and the stat sheet to a slightly lesser. Stats form an important part of defining how a character plays and the ability to customize and focus that around your play style is fundamental to our philosophy. However, your character's stats are never given final say in victory or defeat. We put that power where it belongs; in the player's hands. 

Though the player perspective is borrowed from games like Diablo, the combat system finds inspiration in particular from two other, very different games: Dark Souls, and the Witcher 2.


The Dungeonforge combat system emphasizes timing, positioning and knowing your foe. Here, avoiding taking damage is on equal ground to dishing it.

Attacks are handled via the mouse clicks and the "qwer" hotkeys that should be familiar to many players. Where combat becomes unique, however, is in the timing-based combo system. In short, every attack can be strung into a combo. Every combo has a particular timing that, when exactly accomplished, grants a massive boost in damage or effects on enemies. This is supported by a robust animation system to vividly and fluidly display the combos and give players ample visual cues as to how the timing of a combo should be executed just by watching your character perform the moves. This prevents battle from ever degrading into "stand there and spam a button 'til monster dies" territory.
To defend oneself, a player has the ability to dodge incoming attacks or take them on a shield. Here, positioning and timing are paramount to avoid taking an ax to the face. These defensive maneuvers blend seamlessly with offensive attacks, opening up enemies for devastating counter attacks. 


Our desire and intention with the combat system has been clear to us from the outset: to design something that is unique without being unfocused or cumbersome, plays fluidly, is fun to use, and emphasizes player skill first and foremost. Whatever we did, the end result would have to be something that was worth coming back to play over and over again. Something that supported our underlying premise that great games are built upon the foundation of great gameplay.

Our characters are built upon our unique combat philosophy. Each character emphasizes different combat skills; one may facilitate speedy attacks and dodging to avoid damage, while another focuses on standing and delivering mighty blows while using a shield to absorb damage. To this end, our character system itself had to be something new and unique; simplicity with flexibility.

Characters are not function specific. In other words, there is no "tank" character or "dps" character. Rather, characters may each may fulfill a different role depending on build and gear. A vital part of our philosophy on characters is to allow the player to tailor their experience to their playstyle.

The Characters


The game will launch with five characters, each with their own lore and playstyle. They are as follows:

Swordsman


Dauntless warrior clad in steel with a mighty shield in one hand and swift death to his enemies in the other. The swordsman is peerless at close quarters; his might overpowering the forces of the wicked as they fall before him.

The Wizard


Deranged and twisted by an unnaturally long life spent standing too close to the Source of ultimate power in the universe, he is a nearly unrecognizable shell of his former humanity; that humanity he sacrificed in pursuit of unlimited power. Though once coursed blood through the veins of a man, now flows the scintillating essence of the universe itself.

Ranger


One with nature even as she is one with her bow. Lightning quick and deadly accurate. She knows the truth; that the quickest way to a man's heart is actually a two-and-a-half foot shaft of steel-tipped spruce given flight on the thrum of a bow string from 100 yards.

Assassin


Efficient. Professional. Lethal. The Assassin has one job and he executes it with surgical precision and the utmost discretion. Swift and nimble, he is able to able to elude his enemies if (and it’s a big “if”) anything should ever not go according to plan. To quote a metal legend, “Killing is (his) business... and business is good!”

Warden


A mysterious entity in the form of a man, the Warden has manifested throughout history to hold back the storm in the defense of mankind. Able to part the onslaught of the enemy swarm; to arrest the swift blade of the destroyer; to push back the very breath of the dragon, the Warden has the power to turn the tide of battle and push forward unto victory.

A note on the Warden as far as gameplay. We really wanted to go beyond the normal cleric-type buffer/healer. In keeping with the idea of timing-based combat, the warden's protective abilities require a lot of timing to pull off. An example would be a bubble shield that can cover any players within a set vicinity and deflect all incoming damage, but only lasts about a half-second. The Warden is a powerful character that requires a lot of skill to master.

All content in the game will be accessible via a rich, dynamic, open overworld. Here you can explore and find new content, group up with friends, and jump in and take on the best dungeons created by you and the rest of the community. The very best maps earn the right to become a permanent part of the gameworld and its lore.

Any aRPG worth its salt will have a compulsively addictive loot system. We place a massive priority on creating interesting loot that has the capacity to complete change the way you play each time you pick up a new item.

Each weapon will have three attributes: base damage, elemental damage, and extra effects.

Base damage is simply the minimum amount of damage a weapon will do per attack.

Elemental damage comes in three forms: Fire, ice and electrical. Enemies in the game may have resistances or weaknesses to any of these three. Each is embellished with a satisfying visual flair.

Where things really get interesting is the Extra Effects. Weapons may exhibit extra effects ranging from fairly mundane modifiers to crit or knockdown chance etc., to far more exotic in rare cases. Some examples of the exotic being a fire-damage weapon that explodes an enemy on last-shot, causing AOE damage; an electrical weapon that chains lightning to a limited number of nearby enemies; an ice weapon with a small chance to completely freeze an enemy on hit; a weapon that on last-shoting an enemy causes them to reanimate for 8 sec and fight for you; a weapon with a very small chance of completely restoring health if you last-shot; a weapon with a very small chance of one-shoting mob-level enemies.... It could get completely crazy! In all of this, balance is an all-important priority.

We hope loot will provide a massively compulsive reason to keep playing and keep searching for the most unique and insane items.
A Word about Art Direction

We are very excited to introduce the world to the art of Humberto Urriola. We've been working with Humberto for a while now and his concepts never cease to amaze us with their out-of-the-box thinking. Take a look at the concept art for our wizard up there and just think if you've ever seen something quite like that. The art in Dungeonforge ranges from quirky, to strange, to dark and twisted and that's just exactly how we like it. Visually, we want to strive to make this the freshest game of this type you've ever played.

At the center of our long term vision for the game is a constant influx of fresh new content from the community. We will deliver, not just the map editor tools that allow everyone to create amazing content using the in-built assets, but tools that enable technically savvy users to create and import their own assets. In keeping with the theme of keeping things fresh and dynamic, we will continue to release new assets, both to make things visually interesting and to continually evolve the gameplay.

Themed content is also in the offing with various licenses of popular properties being considered.

It is our hope to build a game with such great gameplay and such powerful tools that we enable a community of extremely creative individuals to rise up around this game. We will support that community and the continued betterment of the game every step of the way, year after year, for as long as there is anyone still playing.
story_txt:
A combat-driven RPG fueled by unlimited, fresh, community created content powered by our innovative design tools.

From between the folds of the fabric of reality they came, enticed by the call of the mighty Dungeonforge. The Aedifects, demigods with the power of creation in their hands, came together with one purpose: to create the ultimate test of the zeal and bravery of mankind. As a member of this ancient and almighty race of creators, the power of the legendary Dungeonforge is yours to wield. How will you use its might to shape the destiny of mankind?

Dungeonforge is a free to play RPG where the community drives the content. We provide a dungeon and quest creation system, a rich gameworld for community content to exist in, and insane, action RPG combat with some innovative twists thrown in for maximum freshness. Dungeonforge is built on two main premises, that great gameplay, first and foremost, makes great games and that community created content makes the gaming world go ’round.The game will be free to play for everyone and all gameplay content will be available for free at all times. It is important to us to allow all players to enjoy the unlimited fresh content created by our community without restriction. Also, items that affect gameplay are not directly sold to players at all. Cosmetic items such as skins for your character will be offered to those interested in personalizing the look of their character. Our most interesting mechanic, however, is the Epic Dungeon system. Any dungeon can be played as an Epic Dungeon when using an Epic Dungeon Pass. This automatically increases the difficulty setting of the dungeon. When the dungeon is completed, all participating players are rewarded with Epic Loot. Epic Loot is simply aesthetically unique loot that may have interesting (however precisely balanced) effects when used. These effects will tend to be of a visual nature (think, transforming a defeated enemy into a harmless bunny rather than a corpse. Stuff like that). Epic Loot will also come in collectible sets that grant a boost to the user when all pieces are worn. Loot may be freely traded with other players so you can seek out and trade for the set you're currently collecting. When a dungeon is played using an Epic Dungeon Pass, the creator of the dungeon receives a kick-back of in-game currency to be used on cosmetic items or, if enough is accrued, even cashed in for real-world money providing a tangible reward for creating the very best content. Also, if your map is highly rated we'll promote it within the game upping the chances players find and play it and increasing your opportunity for such rewards.

PC is our lead platform for the game. Simultaneous launch will be performed on Windows and Linux, with Android being our next priority. iOS and Mac OS support is in the pipeline and console support will be considered based on demand.

As the name of the game aptly demonstrates, the "Dungeonforge," our toolset for creating dungeons and quests, is at the heart of what we hope to accomplish. What we’re delivering is a set of tools for easily creating content for others to enjoy. Was there ever a time when playing a game you loved that your imagination just went wild thinking about what you might add to the game? You’re not alone. User-made creations are woven throughout the very fabric of gaming. Have you given any thought, even just for a moment, to what mark you might want to leave? What’s standing in your way? With the map editor that is at the core of Dungeonforge, we give you all you need to create instantly playable content. You'll be able to create a dungeon by laying down prefabricated sections. Once you've laid out the rooms and corridors you can set down monsters, determine loot drops, set down treasure chests, even add NPCs that can act as quest givers, merchants, helpers, or whatever else your narrative requires. Quest creation and editing tools are included to create your own story. You can add dialog or even add full-motion cut-scenes to your dungeon quickly and easily. Once your dungeon is finished, we then take that content and put it center stage for all to enjoy. New, user-created content is always available and accessible from within the game as part of a rich, interconnected gameworld with the very best content becoming an indelible part of the gameworld and its lore.


Central to our promise of delivering a game with great gameplay at its foundation is our innovative take on combat. Dungeonforge is presented as a top-down, aRPG in the legacy of Diablo, Baldur's Gate, and other classics. Where we depart from the well-worn philosophy that governs that genre, however, is in the way our combat system emphasizes player skill and strategy to a greater degree, and the stat sheet to a slightly lesser. Stats form an important part of defining how a character plays and the ability to customize and focus that around your play style is fundamental to our philosophy. However, your character's stats are never given final say in victory or defeat. We put that power where it belongs; in the player's hands. Though the player perspective is borrowed from games like Diablo, the combat system finds inspiration in particular from two other, very different games: Dark Souls, and the Witcher 2. The Dungeonforge combat system emphasizes timing, positioning and knowing your foe. Here, avoiding taking damage is on equal ground to dishing it.Attacks are handled via the mouse clicks and the "qwer" hotkeys that should be familiar to many players. Where combat becomes unique, however, is in the timing-based combo system. In short, every attack can be strung into a combo. Every combo has a particular timing that, when exactly accomplished, grants a massive boost in damage or effects on enemies. This is supported by a robust animation system to vividly and fluidly display the combos and give players ample visual cues as to how the timing of a combo should be executed just by watching your character perform the moves. This prevents battle from ever degrading into "stand there and spam a button 'til monster dies" territory. To defend oneself, a player has the ability to dodge incoming attacks or take them on a shield. Here, positioning and timing are paramount to avoid taking an ax to the face. These defensive maneuvers blend seamlessly with offensive attacks, opening up enemies for devastating counter attacks. 
Our desire and intention with the combat system has been clear to us from the outset: to design something that is unique without being unfocused or cumbersome, plays fluidly, is fun to use, and emphasizes player skill first and foremost. Whatever we did, the end result would have to be something that was worth coming back to play over and over again. Something that supported our underlying premise that great games are built upon the foundation of great gameplay.

Our characters are built upon our unique combat philosophy. Each character emphasizes different combat skills; one may facilitate speedy attacks and dodging to avoid damage, while another focuses on standing and delivering mighty blows while using a shield to absorb damage. To this end, our character system itself had to be something new and unique; simplicity with flexibility.
Characters are not function specific. In other words, there is no "tank" character or "dps" character. Rather, characters may each may fulfill a different role depending on build and gear. A vital part of our philosophy on characters is to allow the player to tailor their experience to their playstyle.
The Characters
The game will launch with five characters, each with their own lore and playstyle. They are as follows:
Swordsman
Dauntless warrior clad in steel with a mighty shield in one hand and swift death to his enemies in the other. The swordsman is peerless at close quarters; his might overpowering the forces of the wicked as they fall before him.

The Wizard
Deranged and twisted by an unnaturally long life spent standing too close to the Source of ultimate power in the universe, he is a nearly unrecognizable shell of his former humanity; that humanity he sacrificed in pursuit of unlimited power. Though once coursed blood through the veins of a man, now flows the scintillating essence of the universe itself.

Ranger
One with nature even as she is one with her bow. Lightning quick and deadly accurate. She knows the truth; that the quickest way to a man's heart is actually a two-and-a-half foot shaft of steel-tipped spruce given flight on the thrum of a bow string from 100 yards.

Assassin
Efficient. Professional. Lethal. The Assassin has one job and he executes it with surgical precision and the utmost discretion. Swift and nimble, he is able to able to elude his enemies if (and it’s a big “if”) anything should ever not go according to plan. To quote a metal legend, “Killing is (his) business... and business is good!”

Warden
A mysterious entity in the form of a man, the Warden has manifested throughout history to hold back the storm in the defense of mankind. Able to part the onslaught of the enemy swarm; to arrest the swift blade of the destroyer; to push back the very breath of the dragon, the Warden has the power to turn the tide of battle and push forward unto victory.A note on the Warden as far as gameplay. We really wanted to go beyond the normal cleric-type buffer/healer. In keeping with the idea of timing-based combat, the warden's protective abilities require a lot of timing to pull off. An example would be a bubble shield that can cover any players within a set vicinity and deflect all incoming damage, but only lasts about a half-second. The Warden is a powerful character that requires a lot of skill to master.


All content in the game will be accessible via a rich, dynamic, open overworld. Here you can explore and find new content, group up with friends, and jump in and take on the best dungeons created by you and the rest of the community. The very best maps earn the right to become a permanent part of the gameworld and its lore.

Any aRPG worth its salt will have a compulsively addictive loot system. We place a massive priority on creating interesting loot that has the capacity to complete change the way you play each time you pick up a new item.Each weapon will have three attributes: base damage, elemental damage, and extra effects.Base damage is simply the minimum amount of damage a weapon will do per attack.Elemental damage comes in three forms: Fire, ice and electrical. Enemies in the game may have resistances or weaknesses to any of these three. Each is embellished with a satisfying visual flair.Where things really get interesting is the Extra Effects. Weapons may exhibit extra effects ranging from fairly mundane modifiers to crit or knockdown chance etc., to far more exotic in rare cases. Some examples of the exotic being a fire-damage weapon that explodes an enemy on last-shot, causing AOE damage; an electrical weapon that chains lightning to a limited number of nearby enemies; an ice weapon with a small chance to completely freeze an enemy on hit; a weapon that on last-shoting an enemy causes them to reanimate for 8 sec and fight for you; a weapon with a very small chance of completely restoring health if you last-shot; a weapon with a very small chance of one-shoting mob-level enemies.... It could get completely crazy! In all of this, balance is an all-important priority.We hope loot will provide a massively compulsive reason to keep playing and keep searching for the most unique and insane items.A Word about Art DirectionWe are very excited to introduce the world to the art of Humberto Urriola. We've been working with Humberto for a while now and his concepts never cease to amaze us with their out-of-the-box thinking. Take a look at the concept art for our wizard up there and just think if you've ever seen something quite like that. The art in Dungeonforge ranges from quirky, to strange, to dark and twisted and that's just exactly how we like it. Visually, we want to strive to make this the freshest game of this type you've ever played.

At the center of our long term vision for the game is a constant influx of fresh new content from the community. We will deliver, not just the map editor tools that allow everyone to create amazing content using the in-built assets, but tools that enable technically savvy users to create and import their own assets. In keeping with the theme of keeping things fresh and dynamic, we will continue to release new assets, both to make things visually interesting and to continually evolve the gameplay.Themed content is also in the offing with various licenses of popular properties being considered.It is our hope to build a game with such great gameplay and such powerful tools that we enable a community of extremely creative individuals to rise up around this game. We will support that community and the continued betterment of the game every step of the way, year after year, for as long as there is anyone still playing.

story:
Pour la version Française cliquez-ici / French version click here.

For English readers

 

 

 

 

In Dice Seadog, you play a pirate captain who try to become the king of pirates by being the first one to gather 17 Golds.

Pictures of the prototype

 

 The Game's Board

 Pictures of the Ex-libris

*Pictures not contractual .

 

 

We wish to raise funds to publish a minimum of 1000 copies of the game that we created : Dice Seadog. This represents a 7200€ investment, part of which is provided by ourselves.

 

 

  • The rules book : You will find the rules book here.

 

 

  • A notebook of rules(rulers) of 4 pages colors.

  • 4 individual score grids

  • 1 white die (pyrographed)

  • 1 yellow die (pyrographed)

  • 1 green die (pyrographed)

  • 1 purple die (pyrographed)

  • 1 red die (pyrographed)

  • 1 blue die (pyrographed)

  • 4 yellow cubes of 8 mm side lenght(esteemed)

  • 4 green cubes of 8 mm side lenght(esteemed)

  • 4 purple cubes of 8 mm side lenght(esteemed)

  • 4 red cubes of 8 mm side lenght(esteemed)

  • 4 blue cubes of 8 mm side lenght(esteemed) 

 

 

For every round, the first player rolls the white, green, purple, red and blue dice. All the dice will be resolved as they where thrown by the first player. 

The first player is the player who's turn it is to roll the dice for this round. First player change in a clockwise order every round. As a rules of thumb, the pirate with the longest hair/beard start first, but any random method works fine.

The one who rolled the dice takes the white die without changing the result. Then starting clockwise with the player who has the white die, every player is going to choose one of the remaining colored die, also keeping the result the first player rolled.


Next, starting with the player who has the white die and going clockwise, the players solve their dice. The player having the white die always solves it first,  solving the colored die he has choosen afterward.

When all the players have solved their dice, the players left of the first player become the new first player, he then roll the dice and a new round begin.

 

 

  • An autographed Ex-Libris
  • A T-shirt of Dice Seadog, with a picture of the Kraken.
  • A set of phosphorescent game's dice
  • A set of game's dice that mimic(fake) precious material (ivory, ruby, jade, amethiste, gold, saphir)
  • A new score grid acting as " mini extension ", on the Poulpy theme.
  • Printable version of the extension of the game with :
    • 6 score grid representing the pennants of 6 nations in presence (France, Spain, Holland, England, Portugal, America).
    • 30 tiles pennants and their supports representing nations forbidden in ports (5 tiles by nations).
    • 1 corsair Die (black), taking back sides of the other dice and a new one : the Privateer! (Die unfold, easy to assemble)
    • 1 notebook of rules, containing rules to play until 6 players, that introduces the notion of nation and the Privateer side.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • Coming soon!

 

All the contributors will receive a printable version of the game, once this one is financed, but without the definitive pictures .

 

 

Dice Seadog is produced in china, with the company Artofgames. Once the necessary funds collected and the fundraising campaign ended, the game should be available around mid-July (unless last minutes problems).

 

  • Your copy of the game will be sent to you as soon as available, by mail. No additional cost, will be asked.

 

 

 

Payments are processed through Paypal, which ensures the security of your transaction but no refund in case our funding goal isn't reached. Because the game will be edited and your command shipping mid-july.

 

 

Please note that the published product may have differences regarding sizes, quantities or layout because of the production's limitations/adjustments.

 

Please DO NOT use the artworks of this game without our permission.

 

Should you have any comments or questions, feel free to contact us at contact@editionsfantasy.com or on Facebook.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Version Française / French version

 

 

 

À propos

Ceci est la campagne française de Dice Seadog, qui a pour but de faire fabriquer ce jeu.

Dice Seadog est un jeu simple et fluide dans lequel des capitaines pirates s'affrontent afin de déterminer qui sera le nouveau roi des Pirates. Revivez la grande aventure de la Piraterie, dès 2 joueurs, jouable jusqu’à 4 joueurs !

Nombre de joueurs : 2-4      À partir de : 10 ans      Durée d'une partie : 4 à 45 min
Genre : Jeu apéritif (aléatoire)

Amusant - Jeu rapide et interactif, sans temps mort.
Facile - Règles apprises en 5 minutes.
Stratégique - Élaborez votre plan de victoire et influencez celui des autres joueurs.

Le livre de règles : retrouvez le livret de règles ici.

 

Si le palier de 1 800 euros est atteint, Dice Seadog sera édité.

Le matériel de Dice Seadog contiendra :

  • 1 plateau de jeu (10,5 x 29,7 cm) représentant une coupe longitudinale d'un navire.
  • 20 cubes en bois représentant les membres d'équipage (rouge), l'or (jaune), les vivres (bleu), les tissus (violet) et les épices (vert).
  • 6 dés pyrogravé. Un dé pour chaque couleur ( jaune, vert,violet, rouge et bleu) de ressource et un pour le dé aventure (blanc).
  • 1 livret de règles
Si le palier de 5 200 euros est atteint, Dice Seadog sera imprimé et l'ensemble des dés gravé. Bonus :
  • 1 ex-libris d'une illustration de Dice Seadog faite par Kevin Wandrol et dédicacé.
  • 1 Plateau de jeu "mini extension" qui permet de jouer le Kraken "Poulpy" au lieu d'un pirate.
 
Si le palier de 14 400 euros est atteint, Dice Seadog sera imprimé avec les dés gravé. Bonus, l'extension de Dice Seadog en exclusivité contenant :
  • 6 extensions de plateaux représentant les fanions des 6 nations en présence (France, Espagne, Hollande, Angleterre, Portugal, Amérique). 
  • 30 tuiles fanions et leur support représentant les nations interdites dans les ports (5 tuiles par nation).
  • 1 Dé corsaire (noir), reprenant des faces d'autres dés et une nouvelle dédiée : le Corsaire ! (dé avec languette pour faciliter le montage)
  • 1 livret de règles, contenant les règles pour jouer jusqu'à 6, introduisant la notion de nation et la face corsaire.

 

  • En exclusivité la future extension de Dice Seadog, introduisant la possibilité de jouer jusqu'à 6, de devenir corsaire et de nouvelles mécaniques rendant le jeu encore plus stratégique, sans perdre en vitesse de jeu.
  • Tous les contributeurs recevront un exemplaire du jeu imprimable, une fois le financement assuré.

  • Un T-shirt Dice Seadog, avec en illustration au dos, l'illustration promotionel faite par Kevin Wandrol sur le thême du Kraken.

  • Un jeu de dés, pour le jeu, phosphorescent.

  • Un jeu de dés, pour le jeu, en imitation de matières précieuses (ivoire, améthiste, jade, saphir, rubie et or)

Photos du prototype

Le plateau de jeu.

 Esquisse de l'Ex-libris

 

*Photos non contractuelles

Frais de port :

Les frais de ports, son compris sur l'ensemble de nos offres.

 

À quoi va servir le financement ?

Le financement des participants nous permettra d'assurer deux éléments :

Premièrement, assurer la production du jeu.

Mais aussi, nous donner la chance de pouvoir proposer nos autres créations par la suite.

Merci de votre soutien.

 

À propos du porteur de projet

M. Gilles Becq directeur des Éditions Fantasy est un éditeur de jeu de société, couvé par PACELOR.

Page Facebook des Éditions Fantasy et Blog du projet "Dice Seadog"

Nous créons et éditons des jeux qui vous racontent à chaque partie une histoire nouvelle.

Un jeu de dés, pour le jeu, en imitation de matières précieuses (ivoire, améthiste, jade, saphir, rubie et or)

Photos du prototype


Le plateau de jeu.

 Esquisse de l'Ex-libris

 

*Photos non contractuelles
Frais de port :
Les frais de ports, son compris sur l'ensemble de nos offres.
 




À quoi va servir le financement ?


Le financement des participants nous permettra d'assurer deux éléments :
Premièrement, assurer la production du jeu.
Mais aussi, nous donner la chance de pouvoir proposer nos autres créations par la suite.
Merci de votre soutien.



 

À propos du porteur de projet


M. Gilles Becq directeur des Éditions Fantasy est un éditeur de jeu de société, couvé par PACELOR.
Page Facebook des Éditions Fantasy et Blog du projet "Dice Seadog"
Nous créons et éditons des jeux qui vous racontent à chaque partie une histoire nouvelle.

story:
Screeps is a strategy online game wherein the core mechanic is programming your units AI. With all the attributes of a real strategy game, you control your colony by merely writing JavaScripts which operate 24/7 in the single persistent world filled by other players on par with you.

The game has already been developed and launched in the MMO mode. This campaign is aimed at two things:

  1. Open-sourcing the game server engine giving anyone the capability to run his or her own game world locally with its own rules.

  2. Developing a Steam client allowing to connect to the local world and play in it with your friends for free.

About the Game

If you are a programmer, didn't you think the last time you played your favorite online game that it would be cool to automate it somehow? Be honest: you did. Because it makes lots of sense: why waste precious time making routine actions that any bot could perform equally well? Why should you manually enter the game daily just to get a reward if a script could do this for you? No more wasting time on dumb movements even a child can do. We, grown-ups and programmers, can do much better. Not only Screeps allows scripting, but moreover, it's a game wholly about scripts!  

In Screeps, each player writes an actual JavaScript program which controls the play. By managing resources, base, and units, you fight for dominance in the gaming space inside a single, huge, persistent real-time universe. However, instead of traditional manual point'n'clicking, you build an AI which controls everything without your direct interference. Think of it as macro-management of the world with the help of some Matrix-like computer, but you are in charge of how it works!

Your units continue living their lives even as you are offline! Just write a script, and they will mine and build. Improve your script, and they will conquer and defend. And all of this – while you are at work, sleeping, or walking your dog.

There is no session match-ups: units of all players coexist in the same real-time persistent open world and obey the same rules.

You could build a large empire with a complex network of roads, sourcing, mining, manufacturing, border defense which would live on its own, while you would occasionally drop in just to check the situation and polish your scripts, if needed. Everything is OK, up and running? Fine, isn't this why you are a programmer? Ask for pay rise! :)

Screeps may be called a platform game. If you are a programmer, you well know how to study API docs and build an app upon an existing framework. Screeps gives you an opportunity to apply your skills to compete with other programmers (including right in your office) in a way you never thought was possible!


Open Source

Currently, the only way to play Screeps is inside our main MMO world. Since running your scripts each second in the 24/7 mode requires vast computing resources, we charge a subscription fee.

This campaign will help us polish and publish to GitHub the game engine code to let you run the game world emulation on your own. You will be able not just create a copy of our online game world on a local machine, but also modify it over a wide range, change the rules, and even create new object types with individual behavior. You might even create your own game based on Screeps platform.

To achieve this, we need to rework the existing engine in such a way that it can be launched outside of our server environment. This work will not generate any revenue, since you will be able to play for free. This is why we ask everyone who wants this release to join our campaign.

Steam Version

To allow you to connect to our local game engine along with your friends using the graphical UI, we want to release a standalone Steam version of the game. You will just choose a server you want to connect to, be it our online world, your local machine world, or any IP address you wish.

The Steam version will contain a game world editor allowing you to run and modify your world without downloading and setting up anything.

To deploy this version, we need your support on Steam Greenlight. Please vote to get Screeps on Steam!


Perks

Steam version. You will get a redemption code for obtaining your copy of the Steam version with the capability to edit the game world (when ready).

Early access to sources. You will get the full source code of the fully functional game engine a month prior to the general availability release.

MMO game time. You will receive a coupon to activate your game time within our main MMO world right within 24 hours after purchase.

Custom badge. Each player chooses a symbol that will personalize his or her creeps in the game. Buying this perk will enable you to use your own custom symbol as your badge.

Lifetime MMO access. Exclusive limited offer for this campaign backers: you get unlimited game time in the MMO world without buying and prolonging any subscription!

Premium support. This perk is mostly for companies that want to use Screeps for education, entertainment, and team-building purposes in their engineering teams. We offer support and consulting on setting up and customizing your game world for your own needs, like changing some rules or creating your own game quests based on our engine.

Promotion


Questions & Answers


Will I be able to play only after the end of this campaign?

No, the game has already been developed and launched, you can sign up on screeps.com and start playing right away by purchasing game time. This campaign is intended on releasing the Steam version and the game server.

Will Steam version be paid or free to download?

Playing on Steam will require a small one-time fee. Going forward, if you plan to play only in your local world, you won’t be required to pay anything.

The game world server as it is will also be available for download completely free.

How will the Steam version look like, what's the difference from the site?

In fact, it will be a variety of the Screeps web page client but packed through NW.js to run autonomously as a desktop app. Apart from connecting to the local world, it has more differences from the site: authorization via Steam and possibility of using local files as game scripts.

When is the Steam version planned for release? 

We try to do everything possible to release the game on Steam in the second quarter of 2016. 

Will I be able to use the Steam version to play in the main MMO world?

Yes, you will. On startup of the Steam version, you will choose which world to connect to, including our MMO world.

How much will the Steam version cost? 

We can’t give the exact pricing at the moment since many factors depend on Steam itself. However, we want to make the local subscription-less version without the MMO mode as cheap as possible. 

How will the authorization via Steam be connected to the onsite authorization?

You will be able to link your Steam account to your screeps.com account, so your game account will be the same via both authorization methods.

How will the game server be distributed?

We will release it as a package to npmjs.com letting you install and launch the Screeps world on your local machine with easy commands:

npm install -g screeps screeps init-world screeps run

Will I be able to play in my world only myself, or others can join too?

You can open access to your world to any owner of the Steam version of the game who can connect to you either by your IP address or by a Steam invite.

Will my friends have to buy the Steam version to play on my server? 

Yes, they will. Each player has to own his or her own copy of the game to access the any local server. 

Can I buy gift codes for my friends?

Yes, you can buy them through Steam when the game is released. If, however, you want to pre-order a large number of gift codes now on an attractive price, please email us at contact@screeps.com

I bought a perk with game time, so when will I get my coupon? 

We regularly send out coupons in real time. If you haven’t received yours within 24 hours, please email us: contact@screeps.com 

Does game time start from the purchase or I can activate it later? 

On receiving your coupon, you can activate it at any moment you wish. The game time starts at the moment of the activation of the coupon on our website.

story:
About Late Date

We can all relate to the stress associated with date events. Our app aims to alleviate that stress by benefitting both hosts and guests. It allows hosts to easily send out invitations and create guest lists, and allows guests to view those guest lists. It also helps guests to find plus-ones through our date finder. Late Date suggests dates in the following ways: 1) based on who was recommended as a good date in the past 2) randomly using Facebook friends and friends of friends OR 3) through specific criteria set out by you. Late Date is the coolest multipurpose event management app in the game!

How It Works

Pictured below is the opening screen on the app. Here, you can select an option based on whether you are the host or guest of the event.

If you are the host of the event, you will select “Register an Event.”

You will then be asked to provide the following information:

Once you have filled out the event information, you can invite people to the event via Facebook.

After you have invited all the guests and finalized the event, you can sit back and relax as your guest list is compiled for you!

If you are the guest of an event, you will be invited to the event via Facebook if you haven’t downloaded the app yet, or through the Late Date app itself if you have already downloaded it. You will select “Join an Event.”

Then, you will enter the RSVP code that the host has provided you with. After, you can view the event and scroll through the options that allow you to view the full guest list, see who people are taking as dates, or find a date for yourself using the Eligible Date Finder.

The Eligible Date Finder offers you three different options: Most Endorsed, Surprise Me, and I’m Picky. By selecting Most Endorsed, you will receive suggestions for dates who have been highly recommended in the past. If you choose Surprise Me, you will be given random suggestions for dates. However, because your safety is important to us, these suggestions aren’t completely random; they are only Facebook friends and friends of friends. Finally, selecting I’m Picky allows you to specify certain criteria about your ideal date, by filtering by network, school, interests, age, or gender.

After you have found your ideal date, you can invite him or her through the app. Now that Late Date has taken care of all the work, all you have to do is find a killer outfit.

Why We Need Your Help

Funding that we receive will go toward our three big goals: hiring an Android developer to make our app compatible with Android devices, hiring a full time tech staff member, and improving our website. Achieving these goals will help to expand our customer base and keep users updated and satisfied with the product.

Other Ways You Can Help

Download Late Date from the App Store and use it for your next date event! If you have any suggestions or wish to give us feedback, feel free to email us at latedateapp@gmail.com. We would love to hear from you!

Also, please like our Facebook page and check out our Twitter and Instagram accounts @latedateapp. We promise to keep you entertained...

story:
Suddenly Drunk is a set of 54 cards which can easily be added to any turn-based board or card game that transforms it into a hilarious drinking game for 3 - 8 Players.

Created by veteran Gaming Bar Event Manager and co-owner of board/card/video game bar Beta Bar, Skaidris Gunsmith. Suddenly Drunk is the culmination of years of research in how people enjoy drinking and playing games.



Pick your favorite board or card game. Suddenly Drunk works best with simple party games like Cards Against Humanity, Jenga or Uno but can be played with ANY turn based board or card game.

Before playing your turn, draw a card from the Suddenly Drunk deck.

It will either be an Instant or Anytime card.

If it's an Instant, you read the card out loud and do what it says then discard the card.

If it's an Anytime card, you read it to yourself, place it face down in front of you and put it's effects into play at any point during the game no matter who's turn it is.

Apart from doing the obvious of getting you tipsy the role of Suddenly Drunk is to help keep the party going.
Rule and Minigame Cards are designed to take people out of their comfort zones and lighten the atmosphere.

Soon rules will be stacking up and people will be falling over their own words to try and remember if they're supposed to be speaking in third person or if they have to dance whenever they go anywhere. And YOU will be leaping at the chance to call people out for failing to do so.


Cards are not all just "DRINK NOW!'' cards, almost every card will give you an option, to drink OR complete a certain task.
The amount of times you have to drink isn't dictated by a simple chance draw of a card, it's how well you manage the rule and minigame cards that come into effect.

There's even removal cards so for example if you come under effect of the ''Pardon My Poot Card'' which instructs you to always make a fart sound whenever you stop talking there's always the chance to remove, deflect or even use it's effects on others during gameplay.

These simple, easy to follow dynamics help make whatever game you're accompanying it with more entertaining without distracting you too much from your core game.

It will be amazing if we manage to make out funding goal but on the off chance that we SURPASS that goal here are some stretch goals that we want to reach for.

If we get over our funding goal to $7,500 I will include blank Instant and Anytime cards into everyone's order so you can add your own custom rules to Suddenly Drunk!

If we manage to make $9,000 I will be able to step up production on a run of Hardcore Mode Expansion Decks, this set will include far more brutal punishments for those unable to meet the cards requirements. I hope you have an iron liver!

If we amazingly manage to make $10,000 I will put into production the Feral Expansion Deck which contains far more gross and outrageous rules and Mini-games for you to play with... not everyone will want to play with this deck...


While the game is 95% complete and playtested, fulfilling the Indiegogo Deck reward will take some extra time to complete since the possible new cards will only be decided once the campaign has ended completely and they have been playtested thoroughly to work in conjunction with the Basic Deck!

But i'm totally confident in meeting our deadlines and your expectations with this product and can't wait until everyone gets the chance to play this with all their friends like I have!

story:
Adoro ar livre e desde que me mudei que ando a pensar em arranjar uma bicicleta para dar umas passeatas e para ir às compras por estas bandas. 

Os meus anos estão aí e, inspirada por amigos que tiveram iniciativas semelhantes nos seus aniversários, decidi perder os medos e aventurar-me nesta coisa do crowdfunding para vos propor oferecerem-me um presente com o significado da liberdade!

Esta coisa do Indie Gogo obriga-me a mínimo de 500€. Andei a ver e há para aí bicicletas mais baratas e outras bem mais caras que isso. A totalidade do valor que se reunir aqui será integralmente usado para comprar uma bicicleta e, se der, alguns acessórios como um cadeado e outros básicos que eu não tenho. 

As Wacky Races inspiraram-me a pensar que cada pessoa tem o seu transporte. A bicicleta que vou comprar vai depender de quanto conseguir reunir aqui. Pelo que já andei a ver, está-me cá a parecer que há-de sair uma taylor made nº5!!

Diz que ainda não é nesta encarnação que vou fazer a maratona (não se preocupem!), mas este presentinho já vai dar para uns bailados no quarteirão, com a vantagem de que, como dizia o outro, "ginasticar dá mais força ao coração" e eu preciso disso! 

Dão-me uma ajuda?

---------

I love outdoors and since I moved I've been thinking about getting a bicycle to wander around and to go shopping in the area.

My birthday's arriving, and inspired by friends who have had similar initiatives in their birthdays, I decided to put my fears aside and venture myself into this crowd funding thing to propose you offering me a present with the meaning of freedom!

This thing of Indie Gogo, forces me to ask for a minimum of 500 €. I've been searching and there are cheaper bikes and other far more expensive than that. The whole amount that I gather here will be fully used to buy a bike and if, there's enough room to it, to buy some accessories like a locker and some other basics that I don't have.

The Wacky Races inspired me to think that each person has their mean of transportation. The bike I'll buy will depend on how much I can gather here. From what I have seen, sounds like it will be a taylor made # 5 !!

Been told it's not yet in this incarnation I will do the marathon (don't worry!), but this little gift will at least promote some ballets in the block, with the advantage that, as said in the Sesame Street, "exercising gives more strength to the heart" and I need that!

Will you give me a hand?

 Esta coisa do Indie Gogo obriga-me a mínimo de 500€. Andei a ver e há para aí bicicletas mais baratas e outras bem mais caras que isso. A totalidade do valor que se reunir aqui será integralmente usado para comprar uma bicicleta e, se der, alguns acessórios como um cadeado e outros básicos que eu não tenho. 
As Wacky Races inspiraram-me a pensar que cada pessoa tem o seu transporte. A bicicleta que vou comprar vai depender de quanto conseguir reunir aqui. Pelo que já andei a ver, está-me cá a parecer que há-de sair uma taylor made nº5!!
 Diz que ainda não é nesta encarnação que vou fazer a maratona (não se preocupem!), mas este presentinho já vai dar para uns bailados no quarteirão, com a vantagem de que, como dizia o outro, "ginasticar dá mais força ao coração" e eu preciso disso! 
Dão-me uma ajuda?
---------

I love outdoors and since I moved I've been thinking about getting a bicycle to wander around and to go shopping in the area.
My birthday's arriving, and inspired by friends who have had similar initiatives in their birthdays, I decided to put my fears aside and venture myself into this crowd funding thing to propose you offering me a present with the meaning of freedom!
This thing of Indie Gogo, forces me to ask for a minimum of 500 €. I've been searching and there are cheaper bikes and other far more expensive than that. The whole amount that I gather here will be fully used to buy a bike and if, there's enough room to it, to buy some accessories like a locker and some other basics that I don't have.
The Wacky Races inspired me to think that each person has their mean of transportation. The bike I'll buy will depend on how much I can gather here. From what I have seen, sounds like it will be a taylor made # 5 !!
Been told it's not yet in this incarnation I will do the marathon (don't worry!), but this little gift will at least promote some ballets in the block, with the advantage that, as said in the Sesame Street, "exercising gives more strength to the heart" and I need that!
Will you give me a hand?

story:
DARQ tells the story of Lloyd, a boy who becomes aware of the fact that he is dreaming. To Lloyd's misfortune, the dream quickly turns into a nightmare and all attempts to wake up end in failure. While exploring the darkest corners of his subconscious, Lloyd learns how to survive the nightmare by bending the laws of physics and manipulating the fluid fabric of the dream world. 

 

 

In DARQ, sound plays a very important role. There are sections of the game that take place in absolute darkness and in order to navigate the environment, Lloyd has to rely on the location of sounds. 

 

 

  • Psychological horror game about lucid dreaming.
  • Unique artstyle combining 2d and 3d graphics.
  • Shining-like pacing, relying on a slow build and creepy atmosphere rather than gore and violence. 
  • Music written by Hollywood film composer Wlad Marhulets.
  • Puzzles that involve bending the laws of physics (walking on walls and ceilings, levitating), manipulating the dream world (creating items, spawning doors and entire locations), collecting and using found objects, and avoiding enemies. 
  • Emphasis on sound - some parts of the game involve navigating the environment in complete darkness, which makes the player rely heavily on the location of sounds.
  • Randomly generated elements of the gameplay (enemy spawn locations, objects, some locations). No walkthrough is the same. 
  • Lots of interactive objects and characters that will unfold the story and help Lloyd find answers about the meaning of his journey.
  • Dynamic dream world - in DARQ, visiting a room for the second time might yield a surprising result. You might find that some details have changed, or maybe even the entire room got replaced with a new one.
  • Multiple endings, depending on the choices you make throughout your journey.

 

 

The game is designed to be a moving artistic experience. The art style of DARQ is a juxtaposition of opposites: it combines 3d locations with 2d hand-drawn characters, beauty with horror, elegance with roughness...The beauty element becomes the means of seduction, inviting the player to enter the world of Lloyd's nightmare.

 

 

We're very particular about the use of light in our game - both as a part of the overall aesthetics, as well as the main component of the gameplay. Light and shadow are almost the main character in DARQ. The game builds tension based on the uncertainty of not knowing what to expect when switching the flashlight on and off. 

Lloyd is up against much stronger enemies; he has no chance of winning in an open confrontation. Instead, he has to rely on stealth and careful planning to avoid getting detected. 

 

In addition to hearing, most enemies posses good sight. That's why sneaking by would often require switching the flashlight off. When the light is off, it becomes crucial to listen closely to the sounds made by enemies. Faster and more irregular breathing indicates higher level of alertness, and therefore higher possibility of being detected. 

 

In DARQ, there will be numerous jump scares, however we're doing our best not to make them cheesy or conventional. A jump scare will never occur for the sake of an easy scare. It will always result from the story. 

 

Enemies differ from one another in a variety of ways. Some of them are scared of light, others are attracted to it. There are monsters who are blind  or have their eyes covered (see the picture above). Every encounter with a monster in DARQ requires a different strategy. 

 

WLAD MARHULETS - Producer / Music Composer

Hi, I'm Wlad  - the founder of Unfold Games and the producer of DARQ. I'm also a five time ASCAP Award winning film composer. I'm fortunate to have worked with Marco Beltrami on such films as Hitman: Agent 47, starring Rupert Friend and Zachary Quinto, The Giver,starring Meryl Streep, November Man, starring Pierce Brosnan, and others. DARQ is my dream project to work on, both as a producer and a composer. 
 

DAMIAN MARHULETS - Co-Producer / Programmer

Hey, my name is Damian. I'm a co-producer of DARQ and a programmer. I'm also the founder of Marhulets Agency. We represent innovative multimedia projects, such as this game. Our activities encompass direction and production of pioneering video games, animation and artistic interactive audiovisual projects.

 

 

We are aiming at PC and MAC release on Steam (currently on Greenlight!). If we surpass our goal by $10.000, we will be able to afford preparing iOS and Android releases (see "Stretch Goals").

 

 

 

 

 

 

The exact release date is to be announced, but we are hoping to release DARQ on STEAM later in 2016. There are multiple factors that come into play, one of which being how much we manage to raise. Surpassing our goal will allow us to expand our team, which will speed up the process. In the meantime, please vote for us on STEAM GREENLIGHT!
 

 

We set our goal at $20.000, which the amount that will allow us to hire an additional programmer for the period of 5-6 months, as well as to hire voice actors who will add life to our characters. If we don't meet our goal, the game will be finished, but the development process will take much longer than expected and we won't be able to add voice over (which is an important part of the concept). 

We will also need to purchase a license of Unity PRO Engine to take full advantage of the graphic capabilities it has to offer. 

  • IF WE RAISE $30.000, 
    we're going to release the game on iOS and Android.

  • IF WE RAISE $40.000,
    we're going to record the soundtrack with a real orchestra (listen to a sample of live music to see what kind of difference live recording makes)


     

  • IF WE RAISE MORE THAN $40.000,
    we're going to expand our team by adding additional programmers, artists, and level designers to significantly shorten the development time. 

Pledging to our campaign is not only about money. As a backer, you will become a part of the exciting journey of building a unique video game with revolutionary features. We want you to actively participate in the process DARQ development, share your ideas and give us feedback. By pledging, you become an integral part of this game, and your name will forever stay in the game credits. 
 
You can choose between the following perks:
 
  • $5 LLOYD'S BEST FRIEND!
    Your name in the credits + Backer's Updates!

  • $10 EARLY-BIRD DREAMER!
    Digital download of the game ($14.99 value!) + everything above

     

  • $15 DREAMER WITH DARQ DESKTOP!
    Digital download of Concept Art HD Wallpapers not available anywhere else!  + everything above

     

  • $20 MUSIC DREAMER!
    Digital download of DARQ Soundtrack by 5-time ASCAP Award winning composer Wlad Marhulets + everything above

     

  • $35 ALPHA DREAMER!
    Access to Alpha version of DARQ - play it before anywhere else gets to! Also, your name will forever appear on our official website DarqGame.com + everything above

     

     

     

  • $50 DREAM GURU!
    Access to our private development forum where you will be able to contribute your ideas & see behind-the-scenes screenshots and photos & stay in touch with the developers + everything above

     

  • $70 WELL-DRESSED DREAMER!
    DARQ t-shirt (S, M, L, XL) + everything above

     

  • $120 DARQ POSTER!
    DARQ Concept art poster + everything above

     

     

     

  • $170 SIGNED DARQ POSTER!
    Signed DARQ poster with a personalized message + everything above

     

  • $350 DREAM PAINTING - only 10 available!
    One of the paintings found in the game will be a stylized portrait of...YOU! + everything above

     

  • $500 MONSTER DREAMER - only 4 available!
    Based on your photo, we will create an in-game monster with unique attributes that looks like you! + everything in $170 tier.

     

  • $1000 DARQ CO-PRODUCER
    You get a co-producer credit and get to actively participate in making the game. You'll stay in touch with the developers via email and share your ideas. Your name will be prominently displayed on our website and in our presskit, which gives you a chance to get exposure in press, news, game reviews, etc. It's a great way to get your name out there + everything in $170 tier.
     

 

 

Thank you for taking the time to reading this! Please, help us make this game a reality by becoming a backer and sharing this page on your social media!

 

 

 

  • DARQ on STEAM GREENLIGHT!
  • DARQ on Twitter
  • DARQ on Facebook
  • Official Page

story:
Short Summary

Chapters of the forgotten is an RPG game focused on the characters and the world around them. You start the game as Shard, a ex-bandit who lost his memory and now tries to find answers. The Game is free when it comes out!

The game is made with RPG Maker VX Ace and because of this the battle style and look very similiar to the older Final Fantasy games. We are using a lot of custom made scripts to enhance the gaming experience.

We aim to include the following things in to the game.

  • Voiceacting for every major character.
  • Atleast about 10h of gameplay
  • Beautiful original soundtrack to company the player.
  • Compelling story
  • A lot of updates to the game even when it's done.
  • Ever expanding game world.
  • Huge amount of sidequests that sometimes are voiceacted.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding for paying the people who work on the game.

By donating to the project you will be helping us to get more talented artists and composers to work on the project. Also we will be able to keep providing the copy of the game for free to everyone to download at our website when it's done. Also the more money we are able to gather, the more the game will grow as a hole. Adding a lot new stuff while the funding grows.

The Impact

Your donation will make our goal to make the best and most immersive RPG game true. You will help us to make something that we always wanted to do become true.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this page with friends and share it around the web.

Also following us in twitter @EmbriumInt

story:
What We're About

I have been an avid player of simulated pet games for years. Recently, a friend approached me with an idea. She wante to make a game like no other. She wanted to create a game like no other. A game where you are the animal instead of just looking in from an outside view. And so this was born. Together we're working to create a new pay-to-play game that can be fun for all ages.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds from this campaign will go to 3 places.
 
1. $160 -> Artist. Because the site needs art. Specifically fully customizable breed artwork.
2. $40 -> Hosting/Domain name. Without these, there can't even be hope of a site.
3. $300 -> Programming. This will just brush the surface. The programming will likely cost $1000-1500.
 
But that's only $500! Where does that other $25 go?
As you likely know, IndieGoGo takes a cut of the profits. That $25 is our leeway so that we can maximize the amount we are able to collect.
 
In exchange for donating, everyone that donates will get to be a tester on the site as well as getting a full free year of gameplay after the site opens. Additionally, donators will get a special item that will be available only to donators.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, there are other ways you can help out. You can advertise on facebook, twitter, and tumblr. Tell your friends. Even if we can't get enough donations, at least we'll be able to get support!

story:
History

Conquar has now more then 20.000 players in 17 countries, we want to extend the amount of cities and we have to give the game a better gameplay (especially for new users). Conquar can now be played on iPhone and Andriod on the Layar platform (Augmented Reality Browser), now with the Layar player we can build the Layar browser into our own iPhone app, so we can give the game more experience all over the app.

Now the game is realy simple and it's like playing Risk (boardgame) but you have to attack cities and not countries. We have a new story line setup, which makes the game a bigger and better game.

Storyline

Special agents from five different Great Powers were secretly managed to keep the peace. By working together to form a Secret Union. 

After a long period in which several world wars were successfully prevented the cooperation was sabotaged from within. Nobody knew exactly how it was only fl-confidence was crying, everybody loved each other a close eye on everyone and put his own agenda after. Slowly started spying, intimidation, aggression and breaking into their intrigues.

When all members after a tip from an anonymous informant, a strategic point ofanother member was captured cooperation to an end and was the world history. 

The battle is cracked and loose all armies with their own strategy and weapons into combat.

Get ready for Conquar 2

Styling

Now we've the simple design:

Army level: Characters

Red team

Ruler: Dictator Stanislov Boryenka
Country: Rusia
Weapons: Bullets
Shield: Star/Bear
Color: Red


Yellow team

Ruler: Ruler Cheng Min
Country: China
Weapons: Fire
Shield: Flame/Dragon
Color: Yellow

Green team

Ruler: Bomb Squad member Trey ‘Boom Boom’ Jackson
Country: USA
Weapons: Bombs
Shield: Explosion/bomb
Color: Green

Blue team

Ruler: Assasin Chick Linda Bernadette Armandine
Country: France
Weapons: Electricity
Shield: Lightning/Snake
Color: Black

Black team

Ruler: Mad Scientist Doctor Dietz
Country: Germany
Weapons: Nuclear
Shield: Nuclear symbol
Color: Black


Images of the character /  teams have to tell the story and gives the users missions, so the game will be more fun and more team based.

Investments

Character design, iPhone programming and game engine improvements. Not to forget we add more options to the game, like buying bombs or special weapons and building a real time location based messaging system.

Please interact with me, if you have improvements or questions. You can also email me at fred@attiq.nl

story:
What is it?

Pawn-O-Gram is a Pawn Shop App. If you ever want to sell to a Pawn Shop, or get a loan from one, the app allows you to submit your request to multiple locations at the same time. 

Why does it matter?

Speed. When you're in a cash crunch, speed in finding money is most important. After all, bills don't wait. Speed is your reward. 

How does it work?

If an item isn't interesting to your local Pawn Shops, move on to the next quickly and without effort.

Help Tell Pawn Shops About Campaign!

Help spread the word to Pawn Shops. Let them know about this Indiegogo Campaign. There are over 12,000 Pawn Shops in the U.S. the more who participate the better results the app will produce. Help Spread the word by sharing this campaign!

Here are some of our pitch video's to give you ideas in how to explain Pawn-O-Gram to Pawn Shops. 




Funding Goals

If an item isn't interesting to your local Pawn Shops, move on to the next quickly and without effort.

Help Tell Pawn Shops About Campaign!
Help spread the word to Pawn Shops. Let them know about this Indiegogo Campaign. There are over 12,000 Pawn Shops in the U.S. the more who participate the better results the app will produce. Help Spread the word by sharing this campaign!
Here are some of our pitch video's to give you ideas in how to explain Pawn-O-Gram to Pawn Shops. 





Funding Goals

story:
Bonjour à tous,

Je m'appelle Alain Truffier (Alias Angelstar) et je suis le créateur de plusieurs jeux en ligne dont 650km.com et Druidik.com.

J'ai fondé mon entreprise "Les mots dits Français" pour permettre aux milliers de joueurs en ligne de profiter de nouveaux concepts, add-on et animations au sein de mes jeux.


Ce projet de financement INDIEGOGO permet d'améliorer 650km.com en créant de nouveaux pack d'objets et scénarios pour les ruines.

Cette page INDIEGOGO vous permet de faire vos contributions en toute sécurité et de recevoir vos KM-POINTS sous 24 heures après le crédit des achats sur le compte de 650KM

Je vous invite à mettre à jour vos informations personnelles dans 650km.Com afin que je puisse faire la liaison entre le contributeur INDIEGOGO et le joueur de 650km!

Grâce à ces fonds il me sera possible de maintenir le jeu en état et également de pouvoir créer de nouveaux scénarios et objets pour les prochaines ruines.

Il est donc désormais possible d'utiliser vos cartes de crédits ainsi que vos comptes Paypal pour obtenir des KM-POINTS!

Comme ce projet et vos paiements sont liés à mon activités dans le jeu j'ai décidé de présenter une échelle de travaux qui sera fait en fonction de vos contributions totales :

PALIER DE CONTRIBUTION

TRAVAUX QUI SERONT EFFECTUES

300 $

Mise en ligne de nouveaux objets en boutique (Pack appât, Pack armure d'ours)

600 $

Création d'une nouvelle salle des ruines + 1 nouvel objet surprise collector!

900 $

Mise en ligne de nouveaux objets  basés sur les suggestions des joueurs (forum).

1200 $

Création d'une nouvelle salle des ruines + 1 nouvel objet surprise collector!

1500 $

Mise en ligne de nouveaux objets  basés sur les suggestions des joueurs (forum).

1800 $

Création d'une nouvelle salle des ruines + 1 nouvel objet surprise collector!

2500 $

Nouveau livre et pleins de nouveaux objets à fabriquer!

Alain Truffier / Angelstar

story:
Updates!

New interface

We did a little video of the new upcoming interface for Bamboo Combat, as you can see it's much better than the previous one!
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T-hWYlwB9uA
 
A screenshot of the lobby and profiles (new interface):
(ALL PICTURES BELOW BELONG TO THE OLD INTERFACE)

Bamboo Combat

Bamboo Combat is a free multiplayer game for all ages and operating systems (Windows, Linux, Mac) and is also available for most Web Browsers if you do not wish to download it. We also wish to support as many languages as possible! We currently have English, Spanish and Finnish translations, and we will be able to add more languages depending on how much money we raise.

Details

In Bamboo Combat your character is a panda. You can customize your panda in the registration stage, but be warned- you can only customize it once!

What? Why a panda?

Well, we wanted to give Bamboo Combat a professional look that could also be casual enough for both children and adults to enjoy.

Ok ok, but tell me more, what is this all about??

The objective of Bamboo Combat is to become a powerful panda, but how?

Easy, in Bamboo everything happens while the round is in play. A ranked match must consist of a minimum of 4 players and a maximum of 14 in which the winner receives 10 points and the rest gain 2 points. However, a tie is possible if by the end of the round there is still more than 1 player alive; the remaining players will receive 10 points each. You can play an unranked match if the number of players in the room is less than 4.

Points? What for?

The points are useful for buying items and spells. You can buy items for your head, body, nose, and paws. These items will give you advantages over other players and a customized look.

On the other hand you can buy spells which will give you unique powers and can enable you to defeat your opponents. You can choose your favourite spell branch such as fire, ice, etc.

I don’t like it! Those players with the best spells and items will always win...

Absolutely not. Bamboo Combat's attack system is manual and you have to aim and calculate the trajectory of the spell. We promise that the best ranked player of Bamboo will have to work hard if they want to defeat you; everything is possible with enough practice! Try a few unranked matches before playing ranked ones.

Wow, manually aim and calculate the trajectory? That sounds really hard and slow to get used to!

Again, absolutely not. Bamboo Combat is very simple, funny and enjoyable to play! We promise! Please watch the video if you haven't already.

Rooms, matches and maps

You are able to create rooms and specify the maximum number of players allowed in as well as create an entry password. Also you will be able to choose from a range of match options such as solo match, team match, etc..

Match duration will be automatically adjusted according to the number of players.

Maps are very important in Bamboo Combat. When a match starts, Bamboo Combat will load a random map from a list of hundreds of maps.


The room leader may start the match as they see fit.

Tell me more about items and spells!

The items not only give you advantages but they can also cause a few disadvantages. Each item has the possibility of giving you an advantage (such as health), or two advantages (such as health and increased spell range) or it could also take away health and add damage! In you lies the power to create the best combination that matches your fighting style.

Spells can be short, medium or long range and they can have different behaviours and ways of launching such as straight or radial.

 

Brotherhoods

Players are able to create brotherhoods which are composed and integrated by multiple players. Brotherhoods will unlock new spells and items according to the global rank and stats of the brotherhood. When you join a brotherhood you will automatically receive the spells and items that your brotherhood has unlocked, but joining a new brotherhood will erase the items and spells you received in your previous brotherhood.

HD Graphics

Although Bamboo Combat is a 2D game, the design is made with extreme care and we put all our efforts into making a game with very high visual quality.

Fun

Above all, Bamboo Combat is really fun, dynamic and simple to play.

Why we need the money?

Well, these may seem like the typical answers:

Software & Hardware

We need software licenses and hardware that could make our lives easier and speed up the development of the game.

Dedicated Server

You all know that multiplayer games require dedicated servers which are out of our financial reach.

Food

We need food to survive while developing the game.
 
UPDATE: We decided to make more specific and clear why we need your help. Here's a short summary!
 

About us: Our Background and Our Story

We are just two people with a very special story:

You can call me Dani, the programmer of Bamboo Combat. My girlfriend is the designer of Bamboo; her name is Siiri. Yes, you read that right, she is my girlfriend. I'm Spanish and she is Finnish, but how did we get into a relationship being so far from each other?

I met her when I was 16 in a little multiplayer game. We talked about how much I like programming and what I know about game programming and she showed me some designs and we then started to develop little games and tried out our skill as indie gamemakers. Time passed, we worked a lot together and obviously we got closer. We currently live together in Finland and we have been developing Bamboo Combat for about 4 or 5 months; this is our first attempt at creating an online game. We have gotten a lot of inspiration from the games we've played in the past and Bamboo Combat is an attempt to make a game we would love to play.

We have spent a lot of money on the basic licenses that we need to make our games legal. We are very clear with what we have in mind and what we want in the future- and that is to develop games together without money being an issue - and why not become a future video game company?

I started programming when I was 12 years old and 3 years later I sold my old video games console to buy my first game engine. Now I'm 18 years old and I have still much to learn, but I have a lot to prove. I came to Finland 2 months ago and we are currently very happy living our lives together and doing what we love - which is creating video games.

That's why we need your help to make our dream come true and if that happens, we will be eternally grateful to you.

Thank you all for your time and consideration!

Why flexible funding campaign?

Well I've read comments from people saying that the "Flexible Funding Campaigns" are not as serious and comments from other people who claim only to help "Fixed Funding Campaigns". The reason that our campaign is flexible is mainly because we already bought the basic software licenses that could allow us to finish the game.

It's our dream to finish Bamboo Combat- so even if we don’t get enough money to finish it up, we'll fight to keep it alive and work on it in order to publish it someday. Even though we're both students and we don’t have that much money to spend, we're looking forward to the future and are fully motivated!
