story:
Back Story

IIn 1998 GT Interactive commissioned Eurocom to create a game. This game was 40 Winks, also known as Ruff and Tumble in Europe. However, in 1999, due to a slew of bad decisions by GT Interactive, the company lost millions of dollars of revenue. These financial troubles plagued GT Interactive throughout the following two years. 

To stay afloat, GT Interactive began downsizing operations and selling popular game franchises. Eventually the financial strain became too much, and they were acquired by Infogrames. 

The Infogrames acquisition brought with it shakeups within GT Interactive including, but not limited to, cancelling projects and pressing the “kill” button on other games that were in development. 

While 40 Winks was able to see release on the original PlayStation console, the Nintendo 64 port, which was under development around the time Infogrames became involved, was not as lucky. The N64 version of 40 Winks was cancelled and until recently thought to be lost to history and time itself. 

Nearly 17 years later Piko Interactive have pulled 40 Winks out of limbo and plan to give it a fair chance to shine on the Nintendo 64.

Who We Are

For those that have not heard of us, Piko Interactive is a game developer and publisher focusing on retro gaming. We actively develop and produce new games for old consoles.  

 

Our catalog includes games for the NES, SNES, Sega Genesis, Game Boy Advance, Atari Jaguar, and digital releases for PC.

We have been in business since 2013 and have brought to the retro scene a lot of great projects in their original physical form. 

Why Crowdfund

Crowdfunding is a wonderful place to reach people that love retro gaming. We come to Indiegogo InDemand because this is the very first time anyone has attempted to release a Nintendo 64 game since the console was discontinued. As with the first time for anything, there are additional costs to get the project off the ground.  


Launching a new game for a new console requires production of PCBs, toolings, packaging, and other details to basically start mass producing Nintendo 64 games again. Funds acquired in this project will pay for the manufacture of a working PCB that is compatible with the Nintendo 64. Then work will commence on getting the cartridges done, designing the package and insert, and if stretch goals are met – even more cool stuff.

NOTE: Funds Allocation are just approximations, there may be changes in costs, other sections will need more funds than estimated than other.

40 Winks is an action platformer where you control brother and sister, Ruff and Tumble. Your goal is to collect 40 Winks scattered around the world to stop an evil man called Nitekap. Nitekap wants to turn the winks into hood-winks who are responsible for giving children nightmares.

Game Features:

  • Transform into different characters! Attack as a stealth ninja, fight as ferocious monster, or fly into action as a super hero!
  • Tons of mini-games as well! Race dragons, strap on a rocket, and more!
  • 6 themed levels - a scary castle, shipwreck city, outer space, deep down underwater, back to the prehistoric world of T-Rex and giant wasps and into the nightmare world of ghosts and monsters.
  • Co-op 2 player mode exclusive only to the N64 version.

 

 

 


The Campaign

 40 Winks will be the very FIRST N64 game released after the console was discontinued by Nintendo. There has not been any other homebrew, indie, or unreleased game produced officially since then.

Considering this is the first new N64 game, we have come to Kickstarter to judge the demand for a new Nintendo 64 game cartridge and to fund the production run for this new platform we plan to support with new games.

There will be 2 game versions, the Regular and Special Edition.

Regular Version:

  • 40 Winks Regular version will include a 40 Winks gray game pack compatible with your N64 console.
  • Color Cardboard box and insert.
  • Color Manual.

 Download 40 Winks Press Kit Here

story:
Short Summary

Selestial Esports is an organization  comprised of gamers across the globe who have experience in many different aspects of the industry. From Esports competition to content creation our members have seen it all. We’re here to create the world’s first community driven organization, to give a voice to gamers, and to directly help gamers accomplish their goals. We believe this is an extremely important time to launch a community driven competitive gaming organization because Esports is in its pioneering phase. Through traditional sports and entertainment we can see that there are many sports teams that function without considering their fans. We’re here to change that in the newest form of sport, Esports. If you’re able to contribute to this project, you will be embarking on a journey that will enhance the community’s gaming experience. From applications of VR, AI, and apparel technology, we’re here to bridge the gap between technology and gaming.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are requesting a $100,000 backing from the community to start Selestial. This is a flexible goal, meaning, even if we don't meet our initial goal, Selestial will still launch and all of our backers receive what they were promised. We chose this because Selestial is a project that will be brought to life by the community. Of course, as a special thanks for supporting our platform and helping to build Selestial, we have very exclusive perks available during this campaign only including Selestial apparel, precursors to our programmable LED apparel line, exclusive designs, special discount offers,meetings with Selestial team members, and much more in the provided perks section. These offers and designs will never be distributed again after the campaign is over. On top of that, we will be adding a backer crest to our apparel and some of our designs to show that you supported Selestial from the very beginning.

 

 

The Impact

All of us are here to spark positive change in gaming. The main mission of our organization is to serve you, the gamers in the industry. Using our skill sets from managing other competitive organizations, competing in Esports events, and creating content for gamers all across the world, Selestial will make your vision of gaming come to life. We’ve chosen to go down the crowdfunding route because it makes us reliant on and accountable to our community. 

Risks & Challenges

We will always be completely transparent with our community. The largest risk we face right now is finding out if the gaming community wants an organization to bring their ideas to life. There currently are plenty of organizations in the industry that are here to win tournaments and have fans but we’re creating a completely new type of organization in a completely new type of industry. However, we’re confident we can overcome this challenge because Selestial is formed by these same fans and gamers. From sitting down and discussing the weak points of our industry, Selestial is our solution to the current hardships our industry faces.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are always ways you can promote this campaign and organization. Feel free to talk about us on social media, sharing our links with your friends and family at home and spreading the word at school and work. Ultimately, we’re here to make a future for you and would like to give you a platform to bring your ideas to life.

LOGITECH

We're proud to say Logitech is supporting our initiative of developing a community oriented Esports organization. Our players and content creators will exclusively be using the best high caliber peripherals to elevate their gameplay.

 

 

 

 

 

 

BACKER GRAPHICS

SIZING CHART

Other Ways You Can Help
There are always ways you can promote this campaign and organization. Feel free to talk about us on social media, sharing our links with your friends and family at home and spreading the word at school and work. Ultimately, we’re here to make a future for you and would like to give you a platform to bring your ideas to life.
LOGITECH
We're proud to say Logitech is supporting our initiative of developing a community oriented Esports organization. Our players and content creators will exclusively be using the best high caliber peripherals to elevate their gameplay.

 

 

 

 

 

 
BACKER GRAPHICS

SIZING CHART

story:
My Story

Hello!  My name's Jack Nilssen, I'm a full-time independent game developer, and I'm building computer games using the Unity 3D game engine.  While the free version is fully functional, having the professional version will allow me to produce a game of much higher quality and a more engaging experience for the players.

The Impact

Having access to the expanded tools in the Unity Pro license will enable me to make it the best games at the highest possible quality.

Incentives!

  • $5+ : access to the prototype stages of any project started during this drive.
  • $10+ : 1 free license of the first commercially published project.
  • $25+ : 1 free digital copy of the Project Zero Zero support novella "Tale of the Madeus".
  • $100+ : 1 free license each for all future DARK ACRE GAME DEVELOPMENT INCORPORATED commercially published projects. (Limited to 15)

Each higher tier of incentive includes any prior.  All donors will be credited in the final published build of the first project unless they wish to remain anonymous.

The cost of a Unity 3D professional license is $1500 USD, therefore the balance of the target amount will be to cover this.

Any additional raised will be put towards outsourced art and sound contracts, and marketing efforts to promote the final game.

If I do not reach my target by the deadline the remainder will be self-funded, and a license will be obtained no later than the end of the first week of January 2011.

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to donate, or don't feel comfortable doing transactions over the computer?  I totally understand.  If you can, please spread the word about my project by linking through your Facebook, Twitter, or even just by E-mail.  Any support you can give will be gratefully appreciated.


Thank you for taking the time to read my proposal, and thank you for your support!

story:
In the future of 2056, archaeologists discover a buried and forgotten facility, enshrouded in mysterious happenings and sightings. Led by a leading archaeologist and his team, a rigorous exhibition is conducted to find out what exactly had happened. After being led astray by his curiosities, main character Francesco will be lost in a journey of horrors and trepidations that only his worst nightmares held, and will never forget until the day he dies or worse…

 

Basically, we're starting fresh. We have made no other games, we have no prior experience and we're still learning as we go. This is why we need your help; we need recording equipment, freelance hiring, advertisements and more. 

 

WE NEED YOU! DON'T LET US STRUGGLE HALF WAY!

First step in our path is to acquire funds to make our pathway, a little more 'straight-forward'. As soon as we can purchase recording equipment we will be recording every sound we can make to, bring life to our game. With the rest of the money we will hire freelance 3d modelers, concept artists and writers.

Next, we will work out butts off! We're going to aim to finish the game as soon as possible, so that we can release it.

We can't do this without you, so please help us!

story:
Short Summary

We are two guys from the North of the Netherlands. We share a passion of board and card games. We already made two nice games and now we want to make a business out of it.

Our dream is to make board- and card games which make people happy. Games with beautiful artwork for a good price. Why? Because we love to play with friends or family and we want to share that feeling with you all.

What We Need & What You Get

We need 5000,- euro to print the game and pay the artwork.

If you support us you'll get of course the game. It contains 110 cards with 9 different circus artist, a box and the game rules. Free delivery in the Netherlands (other countries 2 euro extra).

We also offer a t-shirt or the possibility to give a playing card a name you desire.

The Impact

If this funding succeeds we will be able to transform more of our ideas into games.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our game you also can support us by sharing our facebookpage: www.facebook.nl/circusspel or use the many ways Indiegogo give to make noise about it.

Bonus Goal

If we reach the target of 8000,- Euro, one contributer will be surprised with a performance of ball jugller and circus artist Marco Bonisimo (www.balkunstenaar.nl) for free. This performance will take place in a location in the Netherlands chosen by the contributor. As the lucky winner you may invite up to 59 people to watch the show with you.

How does the game work?

If you want to learn more about the game, visit the game rule section on our website (www.spellenko.nl/circus-gamerules.html)

story:
Short Summary


Since I can remember I always imagined many facets of the usual goods improved or just changed a little bit. So right now I am introducing you to my latest invention that with your help could change a world of mechanics and technology a little bit.

I can compare my invention to Leonardo da Vinci CVT – gear which is not perfect due to skid of cooperating transmission components.

Invention of IVTG is far much more than improved Leonardo da Vinci idea (exact description you will find down below).

This campaign is focused to raise funds for creating prototype of IVTG and market it, which will be strategic leap forward for IVTG idea.

Thanks to your contribution I strongly believe IVTG will change for ever world of power transmissions used in propelled trains, vehicles, boats, helicopters and many others.

All contributors not only will be involved in the creation of revolutionary invention but also will be the part of the IVTG team.

I'm reaching out to ask for your support to change a world a little bit.

There are two ways to help:

1. Contribute - even small contributions raise popularity and give more visibility on the site.

2. Post to Facebook - in the end, the more people hear about IVTG, the more likely we are to meet our target.

With a little help from you a big change can happen…

Thank you!


Rafal Spychalski

inventor





/Below exact explenation of IVTG idea/


What We Need

All our researches indicate that phases of prototype feasibility, definition, design, realization, verification, validation, used components, systems and machines should be very close to U$ 0,5 mln.

The unique advantage of IVTG is that transmission smoothly obtains power and changes the parameters of movement – torque and angular velocity without any loss or skid of cooperating transmission components (thanks to interlocking hemispheres).

Cooperating transmission components - interlocking hemispheres toothed in a logarithmic spiral way - that have never been designed, qualified and tested before, are challenges that lie at the cutting edge. 

What we need is embedded critical know-how, ultra-precision design capabilities, expert verification, tooling and managed transfer to prototype.

Thanks to combined metrology, mechanical design, system and software architecture capabilities we will be able to realize precision components of the IVTG prototype. 

Difficulty and complexity of all mentioned factors are above high but thanks to the raised funds, the ability to take our idea, our IVTG invention and transform it into prototype or manufacturable product will be completed.


All the raised funds are strictly intended for further development of the IVTG.

All the contributors will be granted full access to monitored realization of the strategy and, at the same time, appraise our IVTG team on what has been implemented. 




The Impact

The impact of the IVTG invention will change globally perception of the power transmission in vast business range of automotive, agriculture, aircraft, defense, energy, manufacturing, technology and transportation industries.

Advantages of IVTG shown on automobile example:

IVTG provides smooth and "stepless" ratio changes, unlike conventional transmission systems that use sets of fixed gears.

IVTG selects automatically the optimal gear ratio based on road and driving conditions by keeping the engine in its ideal power range that benefits of fuel economy.

IVTG means seamless, enjoyable acceleration and a smooth ride, and predictable driving means more fun behind the wheel.

IVTG eliminates shocks when changing gears, giving linear response and allowing the engine to run quieter, making it an exceptional transmission solution.

Thanks to completely new and uniquely designed interlocking hemispheres toothed in a logarithmic spiral way IVTG is able to transmit high torque and power also reduces mechanical noise during operation.

IVTG is able to shifts ratios faster than any the previous gearbox solution, resulting in powerful performance combined with superior fuel economy.


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is to lower IVTG production costs, due to the fact the essential parts of the gear - interlocking hemispheres have never been produced, initial production costs can be relatively high.

This only obstacle can be overcome by popularization of IVTG and mass production which surely have an impact on production costs.


What You Get

Such a market range gives infinite opportunities and a skyrocketing popularity.

Assuming that this invention will attract lots of media attention, TV reports, press pictures of the prototype and many other forms of presentations, all contributors will have a chance to be a part of the IVTG team.  

 Each contribution of US$ 49 will bring the contributor 1x1 cm of laser engrave on the metal cover, integral part of the prototype. 

Each perk presents different size of the laser engrave due to multiplied amount of US$49, bigger contribution - bigger size.  

We imagine that the metal cover of the prototype will fit 10 000 names or logos in the size of 1x1 cm, the metal cover will be 100x100 cm in total.  

The TOP US$500 perk will be very special for us and the contributor : )) 



We will do our best to daily update space availability and send updated PDF file to the contributors.

Please mind that engrave space availability on the IVTG is limited, so please hurry up, and please contribute now even a little bit : ))

We really do hope that pretty soon after the market launch of the IVTG the Smithsonian - the world’s largest museum and research complex will be interested in exhibiting IVTG prototype (with your name or logo engraved).

Or do you wish us to place the IVTG prototype in other museum:

The Deutsches Museum, Munich, Germany

 The Academy of Natural Science of Drexel University, Phildelphia, USA

Universeum, Gothenburg, Sweden

The Exploratorium, San Francisco, USA

Let us know your suggestions in Comments, we will be glad to hear from you today.


Other Ways You Can Help

All kind of positive contribution will be very appreciated.

The more people will be aware of IVTG the more demand for production is created, so please share this invention with others.

Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, are very, very welcome : ))


Ok, Let's see how IVTG works : ))

The invention presents infinitely variable gear mechanical transmission, in which the power transmission takes place via interlocking hemispheres toothed in a logarithmic spiral way. The transmission smoothly obtains power and changes the parameters of movement – torque and angular velocity without any loss of skid of cooperating transmission components.

This transmission can change seamlessly through an infinite number of effective gear ratios between maximum and minimum values. This contrasts with other mechanical transmissions that offer a fixed number of gear ratios. The flexibility of a this gear allows the input shaft to always maintain a constant angular velocity.

This invention can provide better fuel economy than other transmissions by enabling the engine to run at its most efficient revolutions per minute (RPM) for a range of vehicle speeds. It can also be used to build a kinetic energy recovery system.

Alternatively it can be used to maximize the performance of a vehicle by allowing the engine to turn at the RPM at which it produces peak power. This is typically higher than the RPM that achieves peak efficiency.

An example of the invention is the following solution.




Hemispherical rack (1), (2) are mounted centrally on the shafts (4) and (5).

The spherical rack (3), tangentially mediates between the racks (1), (2) and is centrally mounted on the shaft (6).

Hemispherical rack (1), (2) and the spherical rack (3) teeth are arranged on the track of logarithmic spiral curve, Figure 9, Figure 10, making the teeth of these gears intersect at the same angle, thus reducing friction, grinding, vibration and noise. The teeth mesh without causing jerks and do not emit unpleasant sounds known from traditional gear rack.




Racks (1) with (3) and (2) with (3) are always relative to one another in the tangential points, respectively identical to each other, forming always the same tangential relative circles, respectively (X) for the racks (1) with (3), fig. 13 (Y) for the racks (2) with (3).

The shaft (6) is movable and can change its position in points (A) and (B) with respect to the axis of rotation at a point (C) along a trajectory (D) and (E).

A rack (2) is integral with the cog (7) via the shaft (5). The shaft (5) is movable and can change its position in points ( I) and ( J) with respect to the axis of rotation at a point (H) along a trajectory (F) and (G).

The shaft (4) is coupled to a drive source, e.g. by coupling to the crankshaft of the internal combustion engine or electric engine, it transmits a rotational movement to the hemispherical gear (2).

Through mutually intermeshing hemispherical racks (1), (2) and spherical rack (3) movement is transferred without slipping on the cog (7) centrally mounted on a shaft (5) and then to perpendicular cog (9) mounted centrally at a point (K).

Cog (10) is centrally mounted at a point (H) and is tangent to the cog wheels ( 9 ) and (11) to pass rotary movement to cog (12) and then onto the shaft (13).

Cog wheeels (9), (10) and (11) contact one another at the periphery - they have teeth on the wheel rim.

In addition, the cog (9) and (11) have perpendicular teeth so as to contact each other with a cog (7) and (12).

The concept of the continuously variable transmission is based on seamless change through an infinite number of effective gear ratios between maximum and minimum values.




The constant torque on the shaft (4) / e.g. coupled with the motor / is changed into variable torque on the shaft (13) / e.g. driving wheels / and the flexibility of this gear allows the input shaft (4) to always maintain a constant angular velocity while output shaft (13) angular velocity is changed raltively.


Smooth motion-parameters change of the input drive shaft (4) relative to the output shaft (13) is effected by variation of the angle and position of the shaft (5) – thanks to the control vane (8) and for shaft (6) – control vane (14).

Control vane (8) integral with a hemispherical rack (2), cog (7), (9) and the shaft (5) is moveable in points (I) and (J) with respect to the axis of rotation at a point (H) along a trajectory (F) and (G).

Control vane (14) integral with a spherical rack (3), cog (10) and the shaft (6) moves in points (A) and (B) with respect to the axis of rotation at a point (C) along a trajectory (D) and (E).

Control vanes (8) and (14 ) may be moved mechanicallly, hydraulically, pneumatically or electrically /coupled with an electric motor controlled by a processor /.

Changes in the angle and the position of (8) and (14) are simultaneous and synchronized e.g. with the aid of gear in such a way that turning the control vane (8) clockwise to the rotation axis at the point (H) decreases radius of the tangent circle (Y) arising at the interface between racks (2) and (3), while the control vane (14) performs rotation clockwise in (C) causing the increased radius of the tangent circle (X) formed at the interface of racks (1) and (3). In this way, the peripheral speed of the tangent circle (X) is increased, while the peripheral speed of the tangent circle (Y) is reduced.

Therefore, at the constant angular velocity of the shaft (4) and its constant torque the value of angular velosity of the shaft (5) and (13) is increased at the same time the torque of the shaft (5) and (13) is decreased.

Similarly, changing the position of the control vanes (8) and (14) by rotating them clockwise with respect to points (H) and (C), at the constant angular velocity of the shaft (4) and its constant torque the value of angular velocity of the shaft (5) and (13) is decreased at the same time the torque of the shaft (5) and (13) is increased.

By changing the position of the control vanes (8) and (14 ) at a constant velocity of the shaft (4) and its constant torque, finally smooth and seamless change take place in the velocity of the shaft (13) and is followed by the smooth torque change of shaft (13).

The greatest advantage of the continuously variable transmission of the hemispherical racks is that power and torque loss is reduced thanks to the usage of racks and cogs (instead of chain or belt) and a unique durability compared to the solution with variator .


If you need our help referring to IVTG please do not hesitate and write or call us, we would be very grateful to hear from you today.

email: ralphicspy@gmail.com

phone: +48 606 308 779

@RafalSpychalski


With a little help from you a big change can happen…

Thank you!

Control vane (8) integral with a
hemispherical rack (2), cog (7), (9) and the shaft (5) is moveable in
points (I) and (J) with respect to the axis of rotation at a point
(H) along a trajectory (F) and (G).
Control vane (14) integral with a
spherical rack (3), cog (10) and the shaft (6) moves in points (A)
and (B) with respect to the axis of rotation at a point (C) along a
trajectory (D) and (E).
Control vanes (8) and (14 ) may be
moved mechanicallly, hydraulically, pneumatically or electrically
/coupled with an electric motor controlled by a processor /.


Changes in the angle and the position
of (8) and (14) are simultaneous and synchronized e.g. with the aid
of gear in such a way that turning the control vane (8) clockwise to
the rotation axis at the point (H) decreases radius of the tangent
circle (Y) arising at the interface between racks (2) and (3), while
the control vane (14) performs rotation clockwise in (C) causing the
increased radius of the tangent circle (X) formed at the interface of
racks (1) and (3). In this way, the peripheral speed of the tangent
circle (X) is increased, while the peripheral speed of the tangent
circle (Y) is reduced.
Therefore, at the constant angular
velocity of the shaft (4) and its constant torque  the value of
angular velosity of the shaft (5) and (13) is increased at the same
time the torque of the shaft (5) and (13) is decreased.
Similarly, changing the position of the
control vanes (8) and (14) by rotating them clockwise with respect to
points (H) and (C), at the constant angular velocity of the shaft (4)
and its constant torque the value of angular velocity of the shaft
(5) and (13) is decreased at the same time the torque of the shaft
(5) and (13) is increased.
By changing the position of the control
vanes (8) and (14 ) at a constant velocity of the shaft (4) and its
constant torque, finally smooth and seamless change take place in the
velocity of the shaft (13) and is followed by the smooth torque
change of shaft (13).


The greatest advantage of the
continuously variable transmission of the hemispherical racks is that
power and torque loss is reduced thanks to the usage of racks and
cogs (instead of chain or belt) and a unique durability compared to
the solution with variator .



If you need our help referring to IVTG please do not hesitate and write or
call us, we would be very grateful to hear from you today.
email: ralphicspy@gmail.com
phone: +48
606 308 779
@RafalSpychalski


With a
little help from you a big change can happen… 
Thank you!

story:
Your home is in danger of drying up and it's up to you to fight for the remaining life saving water. Reservwars is a real time strategy video game with a Story Campaign mode and multiplayer Battle mode with your friends.

We have created a brand new world with fantastic creatures, wacky personalities and a story that has depth. The game mechanics involve choosing creatures and strategically moving them around on a map. When creatures on enemy teams run into each other, there will be a fight. The player will need to accomplish certain goals on a map to win. Unlock playable creatures, maps and rewards as you complete the game.

In order to see this vision realized we need funding. To that end, we are asking for your financial pledge and your help!

Roo the kangaroo is a natural leader, quick to action and anger and loves a good fight. Hard working and very loyal to her friends; Roo needs to find water to save her community. A massive water shortage is driving creatures to compete for water resources and it is up to Roo to lead her people to survival and victory.

Orky the orchid inspires others to greatness with his charisma, but his pride often gets him into trouble. He is driven from his lush home by invaders coveting his fertile land, in this time when water is scarce. Now Orky must gather allies and fight to survive in a hostile environment.

For people who like to battle with their friends, Reservwars has a Battle Mode, consisting of multiplayer LAN battles with a choice of game type and terrain. Multiplayer game types include possessing territory, controlling critical resource points, subduing all your opponents and destroying specific targets before the other team beats you to them.


 Baylor Triplett, is our fearless leader and new father! After working at Sony for a number of years, including Twisted Metal, Warhawk, Syphon Filter, SOCOM, God of War Ascension, Hot Shots Golf, he is now producing his own game. Baylor is running this campaign and also programming the majority of the game.

Dado Almeida is our amazing concept artist. The whole team has been amazed by his work. Check out his other projects on his website http://www.dadoalmeida.com/

Ashleigh Hendrickson is our marketing and social media guru. Her services can be found at http://smashservices.net/

Jay Chu is composing and producing music. Check out his other music and his first CD on his website http://www.jaychumusic.com/

Melanie Konar has worked on all parts of the project, from programming and marketing to dialogue, art and animation.

Rodney Brett has been modeling and texturing the creatures. His experience has been really helpful for the team.

Michael Goodwin has been giving art direction and has been modeling and texturing.

Dylan Papp has been creating beautiful environments.

Srdjan Aksic is a graphic artist and has been doing our game user interface.

The rest of us were so inspired by the creativity of this project and the beautiful concept art, that we wanted to contribute to Reservwars. As a team, we care about exciting game play, character development, wacky bright colored creatures and engaging stories. Making money would be great but it's not why we're doing this. Our true goal is to deliver an extremely fun game.

You can find more information about all of us on the Reservwars website. http://reservwars.com/about/

Reservwars has its own characters, world and gameplay. However, we want to let people know where the game has some similarities with other great video games.

Plants vs Zombies' colorfulness and wackiness is a great model.

Starcraft's multiplayer capabilities and gameplay depth are another game to aspire too.

These games are all massively fun and have very polished experiences.

A video game is a big. complex project that takes time and money to complete. Most of us have day jobs and this interferes with our time to complete the game. For the most part we've all found a way to put in the time every week to make progress. Projects like this are a bit like a snowball. Once they start to build up some mass they kind of take over and gain momentum.

Quality is expensive. That polish that great games have doesn't come cheap. The more money we raise, the more we can refine and improve the game. We plan to do lots of focus testing; getting feedback at all stages of the game and adjusting the design as needed to make sure everyone who plays enjoys the experience. 

Please support us and this game by pledging to a tier.
We also need your support by sharing this with your friends and other people.
  • Tell friends and others about our campaign and provide the link
  • Sign up for our newsletter to keep up to date on all things Reservwars at http://reservwars.com
  • Follow us on social media and give us feedback on the game.

  • Donate your time, creativity and expertise to the development of Reservwars.

If you do pledge, Thank You! We really appreciate your support and hope you will love the game as much as we love making it.

Note, there is free shipping to the USA. All other physical goods delivery will have a separate shipping charge.
We thank you for your interest and can't wait to deliver you an amazing game. Have a great day.

story:
We will try to finish the game no matter how much funds we raise, these funds will only help to make the game better and to finish it sooner, so all the perks will be delivered in any case! 

We are a small team of indie game developers - www.jenots.com We are passionate about game making, and we would be very happy to dedicate all of our time to games, but we have to pay the bills, so our daytime job in our small design and IT agency takes a lot of our resources.

Our core team consists of main programmer Artūrs Sosins, his wife Anna Sosina, programmer associate Artūrs Kadikis and Art Director and team manager Toms Meijers.

So far we have launched two games, and one of them is doing quite good - Mashballs (check it: http://jenots.com/mashballs). But it’s not good enough to fund our next projects. So we need Your Help to switch to game making and make this exciting game available and free to play! :)

The main game objective is to discover the universal element - Philosopher's stone. During the game, the player has to perform different experiments to gain knowledge points and advance through the path of self evolution to discover new elements.

Advancing through the evaluation path:
There are 3 base level packs - discovery of 3 main elements - Salt, Mercury and Sulfur. By completing the each pack, Player unlocks 1 main element and 2 new game elements and proceeds to next pack.

To complete it, Player also has to gain knowledge points by performing experiments in experiments game mode and unlock the special levels, which each has different tasks to complete.

Each unlocked element appears in further levels, making the game very exciting to play.
By discovering the 3 main elements - Salt, Mercury and Sulfur - the player can start to use them all and discover the Philosopher's stone to complete the game.

Basic Elements:

Green Earth
Red Copper
Blue Water
Yellow Gold
Black Sun
Purple Magnesium

Special Elements

Alteration liquid - changes the color and nature of the basic element
Projection Hole - changes position after every move
Defixation Ball - moves an element by one unit in every direction
Unknown Matter - the color and nature appears only after placing the element
Multiplication stone - color and nature changes after every move
Sublimation element - can unite with every color and element

Obstacles

Ice Shields - need to match element two times, first to remove shield, second to remove element
Walls - elements can’t go through additional walls on the game field
Replicators - elements spawn other elements same color after specific period of moves

Power ups:

Bullet - removes one element from the field
Bomb - removes elements in 3x3 field
Color bomb - removes specific color from field
Drag element - drag element from one position to another

Experiment Difficulty

Easy - only elements that are already on the stage appear
Medium - elements that are already on the stage appear +1 random element type
Hard - any of discovered elements can appear at any time

Different types of levels

Clear all elements - default for experiments
Survive specific amount of moves
Combine by three to top color (discover new/next element)
Collect needed amount of points
Quests (need to match specific element surrounded by other or eliminate specific element)
Defeat Replicators
All shielded - all elements have shields
Walled up - level has walls on the game field 

So far we have developed fully working game engine prototype, but to finish the game we need:

- programmer time to finish the engine and make all of the adjustments, testing and fine-tuning.

- artist work to make the art and all of the graphics and animations

- level design and testing

- project management

- basic publishing and marketing work

- outsource for sound, particle animation and special effects and video editing

So the money would cover outsourcing (graphics, sounds, etc), team's time to finish the game, launching a marketing capmaign and as well as some perks and indiegogo.com commissions!

If we do not reach our goal we still invest all of the money to speed up the process of finishing the game. 

Streched goals: 

7000$ - completley new evaluation path with a unique new levels and puzzles!

 

We will design a lot of custom stuff for game play, print and clothing :)

As well as unique stone art and oil paintings.

All this will be seen on next update! ;)

Game money does not sum!

 

What else can You do to help?

Sharing is caring :) Please, spread the word and share this page! And, of course, always think positive and send us some good thoughts! :)

story:
Our Story

   My name is Ian Houser, and I'm a designer currently trying to finish developing and publishing an interactive application on the iOS and Android mobile platforms. The application is a continuation of multiple projects I've been working on for one of my best friends, Jeffrey Kutsch. This particular leg of the project is a mobile version of Jeff's soundboard.
   Jeffrey (or Jeffy, as he prefers) Kutsch is one of the most loved individuals I've ever known. Due to complications at birth, Jeffy has had significant trouble with brain development and multiple serious physical problems. This might slow ordinary people down, but not Jeffy. But then again, Jeffy could never possibly be categorized as ordinary.
   Jeffy is one of the funniest people you may ever come across. It's for that reason I created a website for him a couple years ago-- I couldn't help but share him with the world. Since then we've gone on to make multiple "movies", and other fun projects. Each year his Halloween party is our area's biggest event of the year, usually featuring a short film we make. These projects are the easiest and most effective way we can make Jeffy feel loved and happy. 
   His soundboard, though, is far and away the most popular feature of his website. It draws hundreds of visitors each month who just can't get enough Jeffy. I'm continually told how if  people aren't feeling great one day, they go on Jeffy's soundboard or website and it cheers them up. That's why I want to make this free app. 


The Impact

   Not only would this app be a great way to share Jeffy's humor and spirit with a huge segment of people, but it would also make Jeff one of the happiest people in the world. His website is already his favorite thing-- he can't stop talking about it. His mother says she can still hear him in his room playing with the soundboard for hours on end cracking up with each word. Jeffy hasn't had much good news lately, on account of multiple health and other concerns, and it's my desire to keep him positive and happy no matter what. It's my desire to show the world what a blessing someone with mental disabilities can be.


What We Need & What You Get

   The bulk of the funding would go to buying the Apple Developer account, which is $99. I am personally in a very tight financial situation and cannot continue to support these projects without additional support. The surplus would go to development of future versions, hopefully including more features and support for more platforms. If we do raise significantly more, we'd love to make more movies with proper lighting, props, and special effects. Check out Jeffy's previous movies if you haven't already!

   Unfortunately, since we will be creating a free application, there's nothing we can give to you that you couldn't get yourself for free. What we can give you is a link to the app once it's published!


Other Ways You Can Help

Share JeffyKutsch.com! That's the best way to help. All advertisement revenue goes towards site costs and making this app. You can also donate through his website, if you prefer. Thanks for your support! Jeffy loves you!

story:
Our Story

I attended my first game jam without knowing what to expect, only that I would meet some new people and create audio for a few games. Working on sound design for games, I was curious to see the process a developer goes through while creating one. That quickly changed as I was the only sound floater that showed upâ€¦and my first jam literally turned into a 72-hour trial of my skills. I surpassed even my own expectations, so much so that I was one of a few people asked to talk about their TOJam experience at the Toronto IGDA Post Mortem event.

After that hurricane weekend I had purged myself of any doubt, not only in my abilities, but on a personal level & socially; I had finally found the group of people I had been missing in my life. I was quite literally a changed man. Immediately my personal and business life followed suit. D.A.R.C. Productions Inc., the company I co-operate with my friend Ryan Cox, turned its full attention towards indie game development & started creating professional audio at a cost that make sense for Indie Game Developers budgets. D.A.R.C. began attending, volunteering and donating to many local community events. This culminated in January 2012 when I co-organized the Toronto Chapter of the Global Game Jam with Randy Orenstein.

About a week and a half before GGJ, I woke up at about 4 in the morning with the idea of filming the event. After talking to Jackson Main, a friend who is a writer that works in film and television, we came up with the idea to follow 4 separate teams to document their experiences at the game jam. The footage we captured during this event portrays a strong community and tells a story of determination, perseverance and creativity through teams as diverse as the games they were making. Delving deeper into the experience of game jams, we have already interviewed almost 30 jammers to gather further insight into this hobby and the community surrounding them. Weâ€™ve set up interviews during GDC 2012 with jammers from all parts of the globe, the people who founded IGF & the community who have embraced this pastime.

Game Jam is a documentary about people & their experiences while creating games under extreme pressure.

Director/Producer/Editor - Troy Morrissey. DOP/Producer - Ryan Cox. Composer - Matthew Reid. Cameraman - Jackson Main. Cameraman - Chad Kerzwill. Grip - Brandan Mitchell. Andrew Craig -  Animation & Artwork.

Game Jammers in the Film 

Michael Todd-Happy Little Smile Games, Jim & Em McGinley-TOJam/Bigpants Games, Robert Segal-Get Set Games/TOJam, Mare Sheppard & Raigan Burns-Metanet Software, Alex Bethke & Andrew Traviss-Golden Gear Games, Emily Clair Afan-CAC, Jon Remedios-Righteous Dude, Jason P. Kaplan-Game Prototype Challenge, Zoe Quinn & Cale Bradbury-OMGbees, Matt Hammill-creator of Gesundheit!, Miguel Sternberg-Spooky Squid Games, Chris Hecker-Indie Game Jam, Gorm Lai-Global Game Jam, Ian Schreiber-Global Game Jam, Martin Jonasson-No More Sweden, Koji Mikami-Global Game Jam Japan, Christer Kaitila-The Game Jam Survival Guide, Alex Schwartz-Owlchemy Lab, Mike Kasprzak-Ludum Dare/Sykhronics Entertainment and many many many more!


The Impact

I always tell people that game jams are like sweat lodges for game developers but, truth be told, the experience is different for every single jammer. I can never truly convey the experience of a game jam with words. It really is a momentous thing that one needs to experience to fully comprehend. My hope is to capture the essence of that experience in this documentary, to open strangers minds to the positivity, creativity & passion of game developers, and reveal what a community can achieve in a single weekend of collaboration. 

I could make this film locally and tell the tale of the gaming community in Toronto, but that really isn't telling the story of game jams. For an accurate portrayal of game jams, jammers around the world need to have their voices heard in this film. 


What We Need & What You Get

The footage we captured of the Toronto Global Game Jam and interviews with local jammers turned out beautifully. So much so that I want to bring a small film crew with me to GDC to make certain I can keep with the films quality. I need $4,500 to pay for return flights, lodging and meals for the film crew. 

We will be filming interviews with game developers from all over the world at this years Game Developers Conference March 5-9, 2012. Attending GDC will also enable us to promote the film and build support from the community the world over. It will also help to promote the documentary while at the conference by having a proper film crew working on this project. 

Some of the perks we are offering include posters, digital and physical copies of the film, GJD T-Shirts & GJD Hoodies. 

D.A.R.C. Productions Inc. is all about promoting indie game developers & have recently started putting together promotional packages for local Toronto Indies. We are offering a perk on the "Support Your Local Game Developer" portion of the Game Jam Documentary website. This perk will include a short biography, company logo and video of your projects. We will work with you to get this put together.

Another reward we are offering for game developers is the opportunity to have me fly to your city and film a one on one interview with you and document your personal experience at a game jam to be used in the film. This personal encounter I think is essential to telling the real story of game jams.

Game Jams are massive events, and this is something that people outside the gaming community have never really peered into. As a maybe overly ambitious perk we will fly to your game jam and document your cities story. Not only will this be used in Game Jam The Documentary film, but we will create a complete trailer of your game jam for you to own.

Any additional funds raised with this campaign will go towards traveling the world, over the next year, to film different game jams for the documentary. We will be looking to film in the cities that contribute the most funding, along with some remote locations, this way we can more accurately document the diversity of game jams


Other Ways You Can Help

This story is not mine alone, it is about everyone involved in the gaming community. It is for everyone who wants the world to know we are not the stereotype portrayed by television. This story is for anyone that's ever been asked, "What's a Game Jam?" This story is about the evolution of indie game development and ALL of the people who eat, breath and sleep games.


This is your story, and in order to do it justice I need your help to spread the word around the world...so we can better promote games and gaming culture!
story_txt:
Our Story








I attended my first game jam without knowing what to expect,
only that I would meet some new people and create audio for a few games. Working
on sound design for games, I was curious to see the process a developer goes
through while creating one. That quickly changed as I was the only sound
floater that showed upâ€¦and my first jam literally turned into a 72-hour trial
of my skills. I surpassed even my own expectations,
so much so that I was one of a few people asked to talk about their TOJam experience
at the Toronto IGDA Post Mortem event. 
After that hurricane weekend I had purged myself of any
doubt, not only in my abilities, but on a personal level & socially; I had finally found the
group of people I had been missing in my life. I was quite literally a changed
man. Immediately my personal and business life followed suit. D.A.R.C.
Productions Inc., the company I co-operate with my friend Ryan Cox, turned its
full attention towards indie game development & started creating professional audio
at a cost that make sense for Indie Game Developers budgets. D.A.R.C. began attending,
volunteering and donating to many local community events. This culminated in
January 2012 when I co-organized the Toronto Chapter of the Global Game Jam
with Randy Orenstein.
About a week and a half before GGJ, I woke up at about 4 in
the morning with the idea of filming the event. After talking to Jackson Main,
a friend who is a writer that works in film and television, we came up with the
idea to follow 4 separate teams to document their experiences at the game jam. The footage we
captured during this event portrays a strong community and tells a story of
determination, perseverance and creativity through teams as diverse as the
games they were making. Delving deeper into the experience of game
jams, we have already interviewed almost 30 jammers to gather further insight into this
hobby and the community surrounding them. Weâ€™ve set up interviews during GDC
2012 with jammers from all parts of the globe, the people who founded IGF &
the community who have embraced this pastime.
Game Jam is a documentary about people & their
experiences while creating games under extreme pressure.
Director/Producer/Editor - Troy Morrissey. DOP/Producer - Ryan Cox. Composer - Matthew Reid. Cameraman - Jackson Main. Cameraman - Chad Kerzwill. Grip - Brandan Mitchell. Andrew Craig -  Animation & Artwork.
Game Jammers in the Film 
Michael Todd-Happy Little Smile Games, Jim & Em McGinley-TOJam/Bigpants Games, Robert Segal-Get Set Games/TOJam, Mare Sheppard & Raigan Burns-Metanet Software, Alex Bethke & Andrew Traviss-Golden Gear Games, Emily Clair Afan-CAC, Jon Remedios-Righteous Dude, Jason P. Kaplan-Game Prototype Challenge, Zoe Quinn & Cale Bradbury-OMGbees, Matt Hammill-creator of Gesundheit!, Miguel Sternberg-Spooky Squid Games, Chris Hecker-Indie Game Jam, Gorm Lai-Global Game Jam, Ian Schreiber-Global Game Jam, Martin Jonasson-No More Sweden, Koji Mikami-Global Game Jam Japan, Christer Kaitila-The Game Jam Survival Guide, Alex Schwartz-Owlchemy Lab, Mike Kasprzak-Ludum Dare/Sykhronics Entertainment and many many many more!





The Impact

I always tell people that game jams are like sweat lodges for game
developers but, truth be told, the experience is different for every single jammer. I can never truly convey the experience of a game jam with words. It really is a momentous thing that one needs to experience to fully comprehend. My hope is to capture the essence of that experience in this documentary, to open strangers minds to the positivity, creativity & passion of game developers, and reveal what a community can
achieve in a single weekend of collaboration. 
I could make this film locally and tell the tale of the gaming community in Toronto, but that really isn't telling the story of game jams. For an accurate portrayal of game jams, jammers around the world need to have their voices heard in this film. 



What We Need & What You Get
The footage we captured of the Toronto Global Game Jam and interviews with local jammers turned out beautifully. So much so that I want to bring a small film crew with me to GDC to make certain I can keep with the films quality. I need $4,500 to pay for return flights, lodging and meals for the film crew. 

We will be filming interviews with game
developers from all over the world at this years Game Developers Conference
March 5-9, 2012. Attending GDC will also enable us to promote the film and build support from the community the world over. It will also help to promote the documentary while at the
conference by having a proper film crew working on this project. 
Some of the perks we are offering include posters, digital and physical copies of the film, GJD T-Shirts & GJD Hoodies. 
D.A.R.C. Productions Inc. is all about promoting indie game developers & have recently started putting together promotional packages for local Toronto Indies. We are offering a perk on the "Support Your Local Game Developer" portion of the Game Jam Documentary website. This perk will include a short biography, company logo and video of your projects. We will work with you to get this put together.

Another reward we are offering for game developers is the opportunity to have me fly to your city and film a one on one interview with you and document your personal experience at a game jam to be used in the film. This personal encounter I think is essential to telling the real story of game jams.

Game Jams are massive events, and this is something that people outside the gaming community have never really peered into. As a maybe overly ambitious perk we will fly to your game jam and document your cities story. Not only will this be used in Game Jam The Documentary film, but we will create a complete trailer of your game jam for you to own.


Any additional funds raised with this campaign will go towards traveling the world, over the next year, to film different game jams for the documentary. We will be looking to film in the cities that contribute the most funding, along with some remote locations, this way we can more accurately document the diversity of game jams



Other Ways You Can Help
This story is not mine alone, it is about everyone involved in the gaming community. It is for everyone who wants the world to know we are not the stereotype portrayed by television. This story is for anyone that's ever been asked, "What's a Game Jam?" This story is about the evolution of indie game development and ALL of the people who eat, breath and sleep games.


This is your story, and in order to do it justice I need your help to spread the word around the world...so we can better promote games and gaming culture!

story:
You may know of dungeon crawling games like Nethack with infinity of levels. Paper Dungeons takes this game concept and adds more strategy and more variations in it.

Paper Dungeons is a single player game boosted with online content. You will be able to create your own paper dungeons and upload them to a community server.

The game design is based on a paper grid like the old pen and paper Role Playing Games, with clean and sharp manga style sprites. The score has an epic feel, with a medieval touch.

 

 

Paper Dungeons is primarily designed for Mac and PC, but also aimed to be multiplatform: IOS version for iPhone and iPad, plus Android and even Linux platform versions will be developed after the Mac and PC official release. Also, any levels designed on any platform of the game, and put online, will be compatible with any device.

 

 
  • 5 character classes with male or female choice (Warrior / Archer / Cleric / Mage / Thief) 
  • 6 types of monsters (1 classic monster and 5 with special abilities)
  • 1 to 3 gaming modes: (Puzzle), (Adventure) if we reach $13,000 and (Rogue) if we reach $15,000.  
  • 3 sizes of dungeon (Small 14x10, Medium 24x20, Large 34x30) 
  • 5 dungeon types 
  • 3 zoom levels. 
  • 120 levels in the campaign 
  • Hundreds of online levels to come and as many as you want, created by yourself
  • You have to beat 20 dungeon levels with one character class to unlock another class in the same game mode
  • 6 plateforms at final : PC, MAC (if we reach a streched goal at  $ 9,000 ). And only after the PC and MAC release : iPhone, iPad, Android, Linux.
 
 
I’ve always wanted to create a never ending dungeon crawling game.

For example, I loved Dungeon Master when I was young, but what I preferred by far was Captive and its procedural levels, where, after you beat the game, you could still fly to another planet and continue on a new adventure, and so on.

The problem with these procedurals levels is that they can quickly become too repetitive and boring. But what if you had at your disposal a really intuitive level editor to create and tell your own story? What if you also had instant access to all the dungeons created by other people on Earth? On a classic pen and paper role playing game, I personally always enjoyed this moment when I had to quickly draw some dungeon rooms and throw in my players to challenge them with some new traps and monsters.

 

Paper Dungeons was born from this basic idea: a simple dungeon level, drawn on screen, and strong tactical rules where you have to beat the higher monster to win the challenge.

Monsters hit hard, but you get some heals each time you uncover a new tile. If you need direct access to new parts of the dungeon, you can even destroy walls but at great life cost. Fortunately, you can ease your journey with some items, spells and bonuses dispatched around the map. Don’t forget to seek protection from a Deity, or to visit the store to equip your character. Monsters are all neutral and will only advance towards you if you engage them in a fight.

 

 

PUZZLE GAME  Screenshot

Unlike many games of the same genre, Paper Dungeons’ main gaming mode is a pure puzzle game. Nothing is random: you can see what awaits you in the undiscovered zones. Damages dealt are based on the player or monster level. It all seems predictable and too easy? Don’t be fooled: the game elements are precisely balanced and one single bad choice on your attacks or your moves can be lethal. Each character class has a different gameplay, which means you have to use different tactics to solve the same level. Every new dungeon, your character resets (level and items). Your score is based on the time you spend solving the level.

 

STRETCH GOAL : $13,000 : ADVENTURE GAME 

Everything is random here, though it’s calculated on a certain ratio based on your level and your statistics. All monsters and items are placed randomly on the map and you can’t see what’s underneath the undiscovered zone. There’s a roleplaying part, where every time your character levels up, you can choose which statistic to spend your points into. These game mechanics promise an epic fail or epic win depending on luck and the tactic chosen. Every new dungeon (tableau), your character resets (level and items). Again, your score is based on the time you spend solving the level.

STRETCH GOAL : $15,000  : ROGUE GAME 

This mode has the same rules as the Adventure game, but your character level does NOT reset after each dungeon. Your character keeps leveling up indefinitely until his death. This time, you score is not time dependent, but depends the last level reached by your character.

That means 3 games in one! (Should you back them, else it’s just PUZZLE available).

These three game types can be played in Campaign, Personal or Online mode.

 

THE EDITOR

This aspect of the game has really been polished to offer the best experience possible. The level creation is easy and fast: use basic tools to draw walls or place monsters and items. Or you can move or erase them with a simple mouse click, without changing your actual tool. Just keep clicking to put all your monsters and items, or one click the dice button to place them semi randomly (depending on your player’s position). Click the [Try] button for a quick test of the level, then go back to Editor mode with the [Escape] button. You can personalize your levels by using special items like indicator panels.

Once saved, you can choose to post your level online for all to enjoy.

At level creation, you can tag some items or monsters that won’t be randomly placed in Adventure or Rogue game mode. This allows you to avoid impossible situations like starting surrounded by walls, without any [Destroy wall] magic book in close proximity.

 

THE ONLINE LEVELS

These levels are created, rated and commented by the Paper Dungeons players’ community. At the beginning of the game, if you choose the Online levels option, you can browse all games posted on our server. You can filter them by rate, note, name, size or by several meaningful tags chosen by other players (TRICKY, EASY, FOR ARCHER, FUN, ROLEPLAY, BORING, PRETTY, etc...).

Every time you’ve achieved an online level, the game will ask if you want to rate it, tag it or leave a comment, progressively contributing to sort these levels for the benefit of the community.

 

Thank you.

Paper Dungeons web site can be found at www.paperdungeons.net

story:
Our story

In most video games we see only the most privileged among us (cisethnic persyns, teens, wizards, dogs, and so on), and those of us who lack privilege and are oppressed by society have been crying out for a game made for them.

Using state of the art game development technology like Windows and RPG Maker 2003, we will create a game where the protagonists go on an epic quest to fight and destroy the Kyriarchy, learning dozens of new adjectives they can describe themselves with along the way.

What we need

Making a 100% non-privileged, anti-binary, pro-justice game requires money so that we can afford high quality production values. For example:

Character concepts

Many video games have "characters" and Privilege Blaster is no exception.  We have many wonderful concepts for engaging protagonysts, such as:

  • a gay Palestinian multiple system with five Israeli headmates
  • a crystalline paradox from the thirteenth etherplane
  • a transethnic genderqueer Whovian
  • a sentient car who identifies as a different model of car

Level design

Our protagonysts will battle the forces of the Kyriarchy in many varied locations and environments:

  • the Sbarro at the mall
  • Africa
  • atop the Kyriarchiplex Megatower during a raging patriarchy storm
  • your stepdad's den 

Monster concepts

The Kyriarchy will send its most fearsome beasts to try to defeat the protagonysts in epic combat.  Some of our monster ideas so far: (tw: scary monsters)

  • Sexxhavar, the Asexual Erasure Rhinoceros
  • Binaritron, the Spectrum-Denying Steampunk Robot
  • Your stepdad
  • Richard Dawkins' Evil Twin Who Loves Jesus
  • A guy who really hates Doctor Who

Other ways you can help

If you can't donate, then you can help by checking your privilege.

story:
What is this project all about?

The Cameroon Project 2014 was founded in January 2014 in Stuttgart, Gemany. The main goal is to provide professional medical and surgical service all over the world (especially in African countries) by sending our team to support local doctors. The long-term aim is to build up a world wide network of doctors, which could constantly support our projects in every place around the world.

The first service (one week Pilot-Project) had his premiere in May 2014 in a rural hospital in Mingo in Cameroon, where one of our maxillofacial surgeons (Marcin Bierc) was cooperating with the local ENT surgeon dealing with some surgical cases. 

November 29th, 2014 we start our second mission. Two weeks at Mbingo Hospital in Cameroon with two surgeons (Marcin Bierc, Anna Zychowicz) willing to donate time and effort for this project.


What is the mission and who is the project for?

One of the main problems in Africa remains that there is limited access to professional health care. There is a small number of specialized doctors, who can provide correct treatment. Some specialties don't even exist. Thats why many specialists from around the world come to support local doctors by giving advice and assisting in difficult cases. 

Mbingo Baptist Hospital is a Christian mission hospital in the Northwest Region of Cameroon, West Africa. It is a rural hospital, however one of the best in Cameroon due to its surgical and internal medicine training program for African doctors supported by PAACS (Pan-African Academy for Christian Surgeons). 

Patients are currently received from throughout Cameroon and some surrounding African countries. Mbingo has 290 beds which include 130 surgical beds, 6 operating theaters, and a very busy outpatient surgical clinic. The PAACS program at Mbingo Baptist Hospital began in 2006. Currently the program has nine residents from four countries- Cameroon, Democratic Republic of Congo, Liberia, and Uganda.  The surgical faculty consists of two full time general surgeons, one with vascular and the other with thoracic training, as well as an orthopedic surgeon and an ENT surgeon.  Twenty to thirty visiting surgeons of all specialties supplement the surgical program each year. 

So, we are part of this mission and we would like to support the doctors in Mbingo Hospital with our professional knowledge about maxillofacial and general surgery for two weeks! 


How can you help us?

You probably know this by now, but almost every volunteer is required to pay for their expenses when volunteering abroad!

The collected money will be used to cover our accomodation cost and inland travel expenses. We are already covering flight, visa, all vaccinations and travel insurance costs by ourselves. We are also going to buy a new set of professional surgical instruments for a head and neck surgery, which patients and hospital staff will profit from greatly. Also when we are gone.

Your donation will not only help us but also give bussines to the poor local community enabling them to develop and thrive. 

By diminishing our costs you will give us the chance to return more frequently which is ultimately our goal!


Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!


https://www.facebook.com/pages/Helping-Helps/38...
